Subject: Shell Imagine the Future Scenarios Competition
Body:
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ty-oGyKdw2E> 

Dear students,

How do you imagine life in 2050? Will we eat 3D-printed food? Will our lives be ruled by artificial intelligence? Step into a world of possibilities with Shell Imagine the Future Scenarios Competition. Listen to what previous participants have to say!

Scenarios provide plausible alternative views of the future. Building and using scenarios can help us explore what the future might look like and the likely challenges of living in it.

Team up in groups of 5-8 students and build scenarios of what more and cleaner energy for Asia Pacific and Middle Eastern cities will look like in 2050. Envision how their residents will live, work and play.

Teams will receive useful guidance from Shell and our partners to develop a useful skill in building and using scenarios. Plus, stand to win attractive prizes for the top teams.

We look forward to meeting you!

Best regards,
Shell Companies in Singapore

SCHEDULE

Hands-on Training (virtual):
Date: Friday, 17 September 2021, 2-5pm
Link will be shared to teams that have successfully registered.

Finals:
Singapore Finals: Thursday, 13 January 2022
Regional Finals will be held by Friday, 30 September 2022

Are you up for a challenge?

Register here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.shell.com.sg%2Fimaginethefuture%2Fregistration.html&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C1b2a3cf76f2941583f5a08d96c63dfb4%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659998792604926%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=hVAxeYSw84ooBZglSi4Ld7aiPsg6bej685m%2FAwqgL%2FI%3D&reserved=0>  by Saturday, 11 September 2022, 5pm. Limited to the first six teams.

Learn more about the competition here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.shell.com.sg%2Fimaginethefuture&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C1b2a3cf76f2941583f5a08d96c63dfb4%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659998792604926%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1ZmK2sGe8aX11KRKuUB9UyXGnewLgU6%2BJCXvpkOWHGk%3D&reserved=0> .

pptsg@x-periencematters.com <mailto:pptsg@x-periencematters.com>

Subject: Invitation: 7th SIP Planning Awards 2021 Presentation eCeremony, 7pm 16Sep21
Body:
Dear all,

 

Forwarding the following invite from Singapore Institute of Planners (SIP) on “7th SIP Planning Awards 2021 Presentation eCeremony” 16 Sep, 7pm. Please refer to the EDM for more details.

 

 

Best regards,

Nichole   

 

 <https://www.planning.org.sg/images/web/sip_logo1.jpg> 

 

Singapore Institute of Planners (SIP) is pleased to announce that we will be holding the Presentation of awards for 7th SIP Planning Awards 2021. Held bi-annually, this prestigious Planning Awards recognise urban planners and allied professionals in Singapore and beyond for their excellence in urban planning. SIP wishes to honour the achievements of like-minded professionals and firms that identify with the Planning Principles SIP champions.

Ms Indranee Rajah, Minister in the Prime Minister's Office as well as Second Minister for Finance and Second Minister for National Development, shall be the Guest of Honour for the Ceremony. The awards to be presented are:

 

UNDER PROJECT

1.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING > 5000 HA
2.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING > 500 HA & UP TO 5000 HA
3.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING < & UP TO 500 HA
4.	EXCELLENCE IN URBAN DESIGN, PLACEMAKING & PUBLIC SPACE
5.	EXCELLENCE IN URBAN DESIGN, HERITAGE & CONSERVATION
6.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING FOR ENVIRONMENTAL RESILIENCY
7.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING FOR HEALTH & WELL BEING
8.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING FOR COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT & SOCIAL INCLUSIVENESS 
9.	EXCELLENCE IN PLANNING DRIVEN BY INNOVATIVE URBAN SOLUTIONS & TECHNOLOGY 
10.	OUTSTANDING STUDENT PROJECT

UNDER PEOPLE

11.	YOUNG PLANNER OF THE YEAR 

 

The winners are selected from a total of 93 submissions received both local and international by a distinguished panel of judges (https://www.planning.org.sg/web/sp_awd-2021.html) <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.planning.org.sg%2Fweb%2Fsp_awd-2021.html&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3407aa4e67fe479a1e6308d96c4f2337%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659909690619684%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sDR1xugEKpomA9H8ogXMAc0B%2BIfRUrdI1XIV6RuczUY%3D&reserved=0>  from diverse international backgrounds. 

We would like to invite you to this exciting event as we unveil the winners of the various award categories.

Date: 16 September 2021, Thursday 
Time: 07:00 PM (SGT) 

Look forward to you joining us online.

2 CPD points for SIP members.

 

Register: https://forms.gle/tQhnibK72RPp72F56 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FtQhnibK72RPp72F56&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3407aa4e67fe479a1e6308d96c4f2337%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659909690629672%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Qs8gmw9kl8FinjDWx02DkN1Eeg6PRoIgdak3BYf4rJk%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: RE: Synpulse Management Consultancy Recruitment Talk - 6 September 12.00pm

 

Hi Students,

Synpulse Management Consultancy is looking to hire again for 2021 and 2022 Grads! 
If you are looking at the financial services industry or a consulting role, or just curious what they do, come and join them for an insightful session. Ask all the questions that you have at this virtual webinar.

Date:  6 September 2021 (Monday)
Time: 12.00 – 1.30pm
Webinar : MS Teams (link will be sent out nearer to date)

Register on GEMS here <https://sutd-csm.symplicity.com/students/?s=event&ss=is&mode=form&id=25877ca58a4292877e3ce84e3692b5e8>  by 2 September 2021.

 

 



 

Regards,
Davina Tham

SUTD Career Development Centre

Subject: RE: foodpanda info session : life at foodpanda 28 Sep 11.00am
Body:
Dear Students,  

 

Foodpanda is organising a virtual event on 28 September, 11am to 12.30pm, to share insights on their growth and innovation in the food delivery and q-commerce industry, and how students can score an opportunity on the team. Register here <https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_xPJV58q0RnCgjWPPyB4jTg?utm_source=ActiveCampaign&utm_medium=email&utm_content=Hey++FIRSTNAME+%2C+foodpanda+invites+you%3A+student+virtual+info+session&utm_campaign=gs_24082021_foodpanda_Employer+Hub> .

 

Additionally, they will also be posting some fresh graduates opportunities for 2022 onto our GEMS career portal, so look out for them.

 

____________________

 

	
 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgtimediaasia.lt.acemlnc.com%2FProd%2Flink-tracker%3Fnotrack%3D1%26redirectUrl%%3D%3D%26a%3D649064615%26account%3Dgtimediaasia.activehosted.com%26email%3D8sUiASukWA%252BvhYyn6XU3sSiFC8pTgZJZdbJfkZ0swGY%253D%26s%3DbWFyY3VzLmNoYW5AZm9vZHBhbmRhLmNvbQ%3D%3D%26i%3D2191A2308A1A31589&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C4b0a954d80234b76077908d96c369f7b%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659804189988696%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UYQs2imqTe031fvQuu4mxWmcvAQ5VsDYI5OgGl9G9L4%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Teachers' Day Gratitude Portal
Body:
Dear Students, 

 

Is there a lecturer or teacher who inspires you? Or, a teacher from your primary or secondary school that you remember? This year, the Ministry of Education has set up a Gratitude Portal to let you post thank you messages to past and present teachers in the week leading up to Teachers’ Day. 

 

Let your teachers know that they made a difference in your life by penning a note at Thankyoucher.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fthankyoucher.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C1bf73217f78544c4156708d96c1ee63c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659702296060529%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=6oLlUZFqLJDqiB2PYj7IrzVFqmVqQjjyZGpW0wCFhsg%3D&reserved=0>  by 3 September. You can tag your message to your school on an interactive map of Singapore. You can also choose to share a drawing or photo to show how much your lecturer or teacher means to you. While on the site, you can also explore the notes that others have submitted to teachers across Singapore. 

 

A heartfelt note of thanks from you will go a long way to affirm the efforts of your lecturers and teachers, and lift their spirits in this challenging year. 

 

We look forward to reading your messages.

 

 

Best regards,

Melissa Koh

Office of Marketing & Communications

 

 

 

8 Somapah Rd #06-301 

Building 3 Level 6

Singapore 487372  www.sutd.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C1bf73217f78544c4156708d96c1ee63c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659702296070518%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Fn6A%2B6T9XjUxnJ7WbfEUod6vTD%2FuLBrqhb8nICOpV4E%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: A survey follow-up on recycling habits
Body:
Dear All

 

A group of UROP students are finalizing  a project on recycling habits, and would like to have your feedback on their findings!

 

You can find the survey here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FKP59cos3vqTQcaba6&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf7ff7521ff524506ac8408d96c1a4605%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659682509150201%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=6qhKe7IqkJp4CmnHxJu7elLPG0lurj9nxfFmGdYvsvI%3D&reserved=0>

Arlindo Silva

Subject: UTA for 10.014 Computational Thinking for Design
Body:
Dear Students, 

 

We are looking for students to be UTA for 10.014 Computational Thinking for Design <https://sutd.edu.sg/Admissions/Undergraduate/Unique-Curriculum/Freshmore-Subjects/Computational-Thinking-for-Design>  (Term 1, Fall 2021) under Student Helper Scheme ($10/hour). 

 

If you are interested, please fill in your details in the form linked below by Thursday, 2 September 2021. We will get in touch with you once your application is successful. 

 

https://forms.gle/gBKPBdZWkX7QZ5PQ7 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FgBKPBdZWkX7QZ5PQ7&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2653812d0a644679433908d96b658e7b%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637658906587109802%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qYU17CTH%2B0t8SkSZXdoNSpOPLUq2a3ZBIof3PYpNz%2FM%3D&reserved=0>  

 

10.014 Computational Thinking for Design

Responsibility

For the second half (Weeks 8 -14) of 10.014 where python programming is taught, UTAs are needed to assist in:

1.     Teaching Assistant for Cohort Classes (starting Nov 2021)

2.     Review and/or help in the preparation of course materials, as and when needed (starting Sep 2021)

3.     Administrative work, as and when needed (starting Sep 2021)

 

Requirement

Must have good programming ability and knowledge and a desire to help your juniors.

 

Thank you. 

 

Best Regards

Irma

 

This email is BCC’d to AY2020  students.

Subject: Invitation to ESD Pillar Information Session (Fall 2021), 15 Sep 2021, 3.30pm (via Zoom)
Body:
Dear All, 

 

Welcome back, hope it was a good term break for everyone. 😊 

 

You will be choosing your pillar of study very soon and to prepare you for making this important decision, we would like to invite you to an Information Session on the Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) Pillar on 15 September 2021 (Wednesday), 3.30pm to 5.30pm on Zoom.  

 

At this information session, you will learn more about ESD. You will also meet our ESD alumni and their managers to hear about their working experiences and views about ESD Programme.

 

To register for the event, please scan the QR code below or alternately, click this link <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FmYkKd6YTLs&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C97615bbf736545ab282208d96b58cfb8%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637658851542018080%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rT0VJLDXkVifGtUioMlN1QJoBkebmHu3cP5Cp2qZoyw%3D&reserved=0> . (Form requires less than 1 minute to complete).

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FmYkKd6YTLs&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C97615bbf736545ab282208d96b58cfb8%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637658851542028075%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=U8A7agAQOtIhz2FP%2F%2BVQOiiRK%2BzPCVVqVpejfqTBWr0%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Looking forward to meeting all of you (online).

 

 

Best regards,
Lee Cheng

 

===

Lim Lee Cheng | Senior Associate (Undergraduate Studies) | Engineering Systems and Design 

Singapore University of Technology & Design | 8 Somapah Road | Singapore 487372 

leecheng_lim@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:aileen_koh@sutd.edu.sg>  | D +65 6434 8231

Subject: SUTD's Social Media Report (9 Aug - 22 Aug)
Body:
Dear SUTD community

 

This is the latest edition of the SUTD Social Media Report, covering the social media posts created on our various accounts for the period 9 to 22 August.

 

If you have any interesting activities that will showcase SUTD’s mission, brand, talents and achievements, do reach out to Terence Chia at terence_chia@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:terence_chia@sutd.edu.sg>  

 

Please share any posts that interest you on your accounts and help us create a greater awareness of our stories.

 

Best regards

Zerlina

Office of Marketing & Communications

Subject: Participate in this fun reverse engineering activity on 17 September!
Body:
Hello!

 

Would you like to help us better understand the strengths and weaknesses of reverse engineering in a classroom setting? You can help us by participating in this classroom activity on campus on 17 September 2021, Friday, from 3.45 to 5.45 pm! It will be a fun and interesting activity and there is a possibility that a Minister may drop by!

 

To volunteer for this activity and study, please read the attached Participant Information Sheet (PIS) and register at https://forms.office.com/r/4Vf765MFYN <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2F4Vf765MFYN&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C38bfd32db855485b41d208d969352758%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656499766272985%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9690ASaei4RtU4zRkzilE7KpZfTfNiA6ICOF3gE%2B7qA%3D&reserved=0>  by 3 September 2021. All information will be kept confidential and any identifiers will be deleted before data analysis.

 

If you have any questions, kindly email Tan Da Yang at dayang_tan@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:dayang_tan@sutd.edu.sg>  or Apple Koh at apple_koh@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:apple_koh@sutd.edu.sg> . 

 

Thank you and take care!

 

Thanks,

Apple

From: Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities 
Sent: Thursday, August 26, 2021 12:36 PM
Subject: [REMINDER]: Webinar: Bogota’s TransMiCable: Building an Innovative and Healthy City from the Air - Friday, 27 August 2021, 10am

 

Dear all

 

On behalf of the Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities (LKYCIC), we are pleased to invite you to a webinar series on “Bogota’s TransMiCable: Building an Innovative and Healthy City from the Air”. This webinar will feature Luis A. Guzman, Associate Professor from Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá (Colombia).

 

Date:              Friday, 27 August 2021

Time:             10 am – 11 am 

 

Please find details in the attached e-flyer. If you are keen to attend, please click here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.sg%2Fe%2Flkycic-webinar-by-luis-a-guzman-bogotas-transmicable-tickets-164795077513&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C0916548e09bd4a52d09a08d969333c1d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656492702482457%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=nMw76FjWL3QabCMZde69xPzMDyy6mViz2CNs%2FPzFFsY%3D&reserved=0>  to register. Thank you.

 

Abstract

 

Cable cars provide urban mobility benefits for vulnerable populations. However, no evaluation has assessed cable cars' impact from a comprehensive perspective. TransMiCable in Bogotá, Colombia, provides a unique opportunity to 1) assess the effects of its implementation on the environmental and social determinants of health (microenvironment pollution, transport accessibility, physical environment, employment, social capital, and leisure time), physical activity, and health outcomes (health-related quality of life and respiratory diseases); and 2) use citizen science methods to identify, prioritize, and communicate the most salient negative and positive features impacting health and quality of life in TransMiCable's area, as well as facilitate a consensus and advocacy-building change process among community members, policymakers, and academic researchers. 

 

This project is innovative in its use of a mixed-methods, interdisciplinary research approach, and in its systematic engagement of citizens and policymakers throughout the design and evaluation process. This study will help to understand better how to maximize health benefits and minimize unintended negative consequences of alternative transport projects. 

 

About the Speaker

 

Luis A. Guzman is an Associated Professor at the School of Engineering at Universidad de los Andes (Bogotá, Colombia). He holds an M.Sc from the Universidad de los Andes, and a Ph.D. cum laude in Systems of Civil Engineering at the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (Spain). Dr. Guzman's research interests include urban mobility, transport, and land-use interaction and social, economic, and spatial analysis of inequalities related to urban transport and policy evaluation in Latin America. He is currently a researcher of national studies including the development models and tools regarding land occupation and land-use changes and its implications on mobility, transport planning, social equity, health, and urban sustainability.

 

Dr Rafael Martinez, Research Fellow at the Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities, will be moderating the Q&A session of this webinar.

Subject: Best Class Spirit Award AY2020
Body:
Dear Students,

 

We are very encouraged to see that many of you have put in great efforts in promoting team spirit among yourselves, thereby making your Freshmore year with the university a very memorable one. Based on the submissions of your Best Class Spirit reports and the evaluations by the panel of judges, we are pleased to announce that Cohort 20F05 is the winner of the Best Class Spirit Award for AY2020. Cohort 20F05 has won a cash prize of SGD 300 and a trophy.  Congratulations!

 

With best regards,

 

Lim Bee Foong

on behalf of Prof Pey Kin Leong, Associate Provost, Undergraduate Studies & SUTD Academy

“Researchers has successfully developed the most stable catholyte (positive electrolyte) to date in AORFBs and demonstrated cells that kept more than 90% of capacity over 6,000 cycles, projecting more than 16 years of uninterrupted service in a pace of one cycle per day.”

“Researchers today announced that they have built a robotic system capable of this kind of supply drop, and which functions entirely inside the gut. The system involves an insulin delivery robot that is surgically implanted in the abdomen, and swallowable magnetic capsules that resupply the robot with insulin.”

“Drones are not the only autonomous vehicles at the forefront of automating deliveries and human services — ships may be about to turn the corner, assisted by helpful tugboats. Researchers at the Delft University of Technology in China have developed a control strategy for ships and their partnered tugs to navigate windy and somewhat unpredictable environments safely and efficiently.”

UX

The Real Reason You’re Not More Productive At Work? It’s Not Boredom—It’s Bad UX <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fastcompany.com%2F90667790%2Fthe-real-reason-youre-not-more-productive-at-work-its-not-boredom-its-bad-ux&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C00ac905448d6477e6a2708d96906f078%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656301020335376%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=LXDFtX63%2FpXzZp9xSlK0qpV1eV%2BdYGhZMCBAg0%2F%2FD5g%3D&reserved=0> 









“A team headed by biomedical engineer Dr Britta Trappmann from the Max Planck Institute for Molecular Biomedicine in Münster, Germany, has developed a cell culture system in which, for the first time, a functional blood vessel system is able to grow within a framework made of synthetic materials.”

“Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) Chief Executive Elon Musk on Thursday said the electric automaker will probably launch a "Tesla Bot" humanoid robot prototype next year, designed for dangerous, repetitive, or boring work that people don't like to do.”

“In a step toward a future of higher performance memory devices, researchers from National Taiwan Normal University and Kyushu University have developed a new device that needs only a single semiconductor known as perovskite to simultaneously store and visually transmit data.”

“According to a new research paper published by the analyst firm Forrester—for which researchers interviewed nearly 200 design teams and dozens of frontline workers in fields like retail—the enterprise software we use at work is slowing us down, and for all sorts of reasons, from individual components of the UI to the workflows that take us from one piece of software to another.”

Source: Eurekalert! <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eurekalert.org%2Fnews-releases%2F926085&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C00ac905448d6477e6a2708d96906f078%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656301020335376%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=koxcsLmkm6GlwK11BVKCfaWz97x0pQins0hdSxtXG7U%3D&reserved=0>  (22 August 2021)

Source: Reuters <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.reuters.com%2Fbusiness%2Fautos-transportation%2Ftesla-unveils-own-chip-ai-training-computer-dojo-2021-08-20%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C00ac905448d6477e6a2708d96906f078%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656301020345366%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=WVOribvC0om2MF8OfQplTO1xmESPDfHrad0n868EzA8%3D&reserved=0>  (20 August 2021)

Source: Kyushu University <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kyushu-u.ac.jp%2Fen%2Fresearches%2Fview%2F216&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C00ac905448d6477e6a2708d96906f078%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656301020345366%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=R3fbikrgwG5rYcERoNtz22tN4Q3jYWONdDuP0jvjEFw%3D&reserved=0> (23 August 2021)

Source: Fast Company <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fastcompany.com%2F90667790%2Fthe-real-reason-youre-not-more-productive-at-work-its-not-boredom-its-bad-ux&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C00ac905448d6477e6a2708d96906f078%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656301020355374%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=RSY9bTS2ICmVd9xFbzWpOh71w1qTWFHb9wBwh3hwXtE%3D&reserved=0>  (20 August 2021)

Career Tips & Advice	

 

8 Skills You Need to Build to Land a Senior-Level Job
Getting a senior-level job requires hard work and dedication. It also requires certain skills. In fact, to land a senior-level position, there are several key skills you’ll need. And below are eight of the most important of these skills—which you need to start building now if you want to land a top position later.
 Read more <https://access.vault.com/recordurl?nid=264374&wid=274402&vid=1> 


Click HERE  <http://access.vault.com/career-insider-login.aspx?aid=274402>  for full access and more career resources on Vault.com.
The service is free of charge for SUTD students and Alumni.
How Career Planning Can Help You Get Ahead
Are you feeling stuck in a boring and unfulfilling job? Or maybe you’re looking for a job but you’re not clear on which career direction you should pursue? No matter what stage of your career you find yourself in, career planning can help you establish a focused vision and achieve your full potential in your career. Read more <https://access.vault.com/recordurl?nid=263986&wid=274402&vid=1>

Subject: Webinar Invitation: First of Two Conversations for Singapore Design Awards 2021
Body:
Dear SUTD Community

 

Be the change you want to see to keep Singapore a green and liveable home. Mark your calendar for the first virtual conversation for Singapore Design Awards, happening on 2 September 2021, 4pm to 5.30pm. 

 

Featuring ASD Head of Pillar Prof. Tai Lee Siang as the Keynote Speaker, the event is organised by Design Business Chamber Singapore & the Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment.

 

A virtual event where designers can meet to learn more about sustainability, and how design can be an agent of change to meet the challenges that Singapore is facing in strengthening food supply and reducing waste. An open call for Singapore Design Awards, innovative projects will be selected for funding, project development and rapid prototyping.

 

Register now at https://mailchi.mp/2572a89822c0/singapore-design-awards-5637768 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmailchi.mp%2F2572a89822c0%2Fsingapore-design-awards-5637768&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C14b812f9f3e1433af6d408d968fa15e9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637656245872061649%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=F6T3S9AivZNI9IgYfnKUvn%2FeKxtianFXLhWNRCf3Mns%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 



 

Thank you

 

Sincerely

 

 



 

https://asd.sutd.edu.sg/ <https://asd.sutd.edu.sg/>

Subject: Seminar: Venture Creation: NUS Strategy for Deep Tech Start Ups and their access into the Greater Asian Markets
Body:
Dear All

 

We are pleased to invite you to an interesting seminar by Professor Freddy Boey from NUS, who will share with us on the topic of Venture Creation: NUS Strategy for Deep Tech Start Ups and their access into the Greater Asian Markets. 

 

Prof Boey is the Deputy President (Innovation & Enterprise) of the National University of Singapore (NUS), overseeing the University’s initiatives and activities in the areas of innovation, entrepreneurship and research translation, as well as graduate studies.

 

Pls click the link below to register if you are interested to attend.  

https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_F7eQiE4JSLm9ovLBRihmgQ

 

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

 <https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_F7eQiE4JSLm9ovLBRihmgQ>  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Talk Abstract

 

Over the past three years, NUS embarked on a broadened strategy to significantly increase the creation of NUS start-ups based on deep technology IP, through the creation of start-ups.  

 

Prof Freddy Boey will elaborate on this strategy and  introduce selected start-ups birthed from the strategy.   He will also present recent NUS collaborative expansion into China and ASEAN to access their huge markets. 

 

Speaker’s Biography

 

Professor Freddy Boey is the Deputy President for Innovation & Enterprise. He oversees the University’s initiatives and activities for innovation, entrepreneurship and research translation. 

 

An alumnus of NUS, Professor Boey was the Deputy President and Provost of Nanyang Technological University (NTU) from 2011-2017. During his tenure as the Provost, he helped transformed NTU into a world class Research University, jumping from 74th in 2011 to 11th in the world in the QS 2017 University World Ranking to be No.1 in Asia. NTU College of Engineering was also ranked 4th in the 2017 QS world subject ranking. He also led in building Singapore’s 3rd Medical School, the Lee Kong Chian Medical School, with Imperial College London. He was conferred the 2016 National Day Public Administration Gold Medal for this effort.

 

He was the Chair of NTU’s School of Materials Science and Engineering (MSE) from 2004 to 2010, transforming it into NTU’s top research school and became known as one of the world’s foremost MSE institution. Although MSE only started in 2000, it ranked 6th in QS world subject ranking and 2nd in US News world ranking in 2015 & 2016, with an outstanding reputation for generating start up technologies that can be commercialized. Professor Boey won the Singapore National Day Public Administration Silver Medal in 2010 for his achievement in building the School of MSE. 

 

A keen inventor, Professor Boey pioneered the use of functional biomaterials for medical devices in Singapore. He was conferred Singapore’s highest Scientific Award, the Singapore President Science & Technology Medal (PSM) for lifetime achievement, and the prestigious Imperial College London Faculty of Medicine Fellow award, both in 2013, for his biomedical research achievements. His research team also won the 2014 President’s Technology Award (PSTA) for using nanostructures with a novel drug delivery approach to combat blindness from glaucoma. 

 

He has developed 127 patents and founded several companies to commercialize his cardiovascular, ocular and surgical implants. His customizable hernia mesh has received US and China FDA approvals and received US & China funding as a US company. His fully biodegradable heart stent company, Amaranth, has been substantially funded by a Silicon Valley VC, EDB and the top US Medical Device company, Boston Scientific, for a series of advanced US FDA clinical trials in several hundred patients worldwide. His most recent company, Peregrine, is based on a nano based drug delivery system to treat Glaucoma, which has been successfully deployed in human trials. Prof Boey’s research has been published in over 347 top journals with 23,555 citations and he has an H-Index of 71. 

 

He previously served as director on the boards of the Government Technology Agency of Singapore and Defense Science Organisation. He remains a Director for the Health Sciences Authority and also contributes on many boards of nationally-funded research centres. He is a Fellow of the Institute of Materials (UK) and the Institution of Engineers Singapore, and a Founding Fellow of the Academy of Engineering, and had been a member of the National Cybersecurity R& D Laboratory and Singapore Rail Academy Board.

 

Important Notes:


•          All participants must be fully vaccinated, i.e. has received the full regimen of Pfizer-BioNTech/Comirnatry, Moderna or

             WHO EUL vaccines, with an additional two weeks for the vaccine to be fully effective.
•          Only full vaccinated participants are allowed to attend the event physically. Else, participants have to attend the event virtually. 
•          Masks must be worn at all times. Safe Management Measures, including safe distanced seating, will be enforced during the event. 

•          This webinar will be recorded for the benefit of those who missed the live session.

•          By registering for this event, you acknowledge that you have to comply with the appropriate Covid measures at the event. 

 

We look forward to having you at the seminar.  Thank you.

 

Best Regards

Office of Research

Subject: [REMINDER]: Webinar: Bogota’s TransMiCable: Building an Innovative and Healthy City from the Air - Friday, 27 August 2021, 10am
Body:
Dear all

 

On behalf of the Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities (LKYCIC), we are pleased to invite you to a webinar series on “Bogota’s TransMiCable: Building an Innovative and Healthy City from the Air”. This webinar will feature Luis A. Guzman, Associate Professor from Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá (Colombia).

 

Date:              Friday, 27 August 2021

Time:             10 am – 11 am 

 

Please find details in the attached e-flyer. If you are keen to attend, please click here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.sg%2Fe%2Flkycic-webinar-by-luis-a-guzman-bogotas-transmicable-tickets-164795077513&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce9a8dbe6f2bc41be206608d9684b10c7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637655494342262289%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wkGiGIcVtmvLYW%2BHq1HCI6xslJ%2Bib1nduDfsmNJwOR4%3D&reserved=0>  to register. Thank you.

 

Abstract

 

Cable cars provide urban mobility benefits for vulnerable populations. However, no evaluation has assessed cable cars' impact from a comprehensive perspective. TransMiCable in Bogotá, Colombia, provides a unique opportunity to 1) assess the effects of its implementation on the environmental and social determinants of health (microenvironment pollution, transport accessibility, physical environment, employment, social capital, and leisure time), physical activity, and health outcomes (health-related quality of life and respiratory diseases); and 2) use citizen science methods to identify, prioritize, and communicate the most salient negative and positive features impacting health and quality of life in TransMiCable's area, as well as facilitate a consensus and advocacy-building change process among community members, policymakers, and academic researchers. 

 

This project is innovative in its use of a mixed-methods, interdisciplinary research approach, and in its systematic engagement of citizens and policymakers throughout the design and evaluation process. This study will help to understand better how to maximize health benefits and minimize unintended negative consequences of alternative transport projects. 

 

About the Speaker

 

Luis A. Guzman is an Associated Professor at the School of Engineering at Universidad de los Andes (Bogotá, Colombia). He holds an M.Sc from the Universidad de los Andes, and a Ph.D. cum laude in Systems of Civil Engineering at the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (Spain). Dr. Guzman's research interests include urban mobility, transport, and land-use interaction and social, economic, and spatial analysis of inequalities related to urban transport and policy evaluation in Latin America. He is currently a researcher of national studies including the development models and tools regarding land occupation and land-use changes and its implications on mobility, transport planning, social equity, health, and urban sustainability.

 

Dr Rafael Martinez, Research Fellow at the Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities, will be moderating the Q&A session of this webinar. 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.sg%2Fe%2Flkycic-webinar-by-luis-a-guzman-bogotas-transmicable-tickets-164795077513&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce9a8dbe6f2bc41be206608d9684b10c7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637655494342272275%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1awp0frKcs5zPhptoydqUCeGSYn0LFHMWhqKudWXah0%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: PANELIST - ANGAN LECTURE BY WONG MUN SUMM - BRAC University
Body:
Dear SUTD Community

 

You are cordially invited to the 139th event of the Angan Lecture Series on ‘Form Follows Systems’ with architect Wong Mun Summ, Co-Founding Director of WOHA, and Professor in Practice, Department of Architecture, School of Design and Environment, National University of Singapore. The event is hosted by the Department of Architecture, School of Architecture and Design (SoAD), Brac University on Sunday 29 August 2021 at 5:00pm, Bangladesh time (GMT+06).

 

The program will include a presentation by Wong Mun Summ in the first part and a panel discussion with Q&A in the second part.

 

Erwin Viray, Professor and SUTD Sustainability Initiatives Lead, Singapore University of Technology and Design, and Fuad H Mallick, Professor and Dean, SoAD, BRAC University will join the event as panelists. The event will be hosted by Zainab Faruqui Ali, Professor, and Chairperson, Department of Architecture, SoAD, BRAC University.

 

 

The program will be broadcast LIVE from our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/soad.bracu).

 

Lecture Synopsis

In this lecture, Wong Mun Summ will give an insight into the practice’s “Systems Approach”, in which every project is viewed as part of a larger social, environmental and economic system. WOHA’s buildings are designed as active and productive systems that are integrated into their social, ecological, and urban context. With each project, the practice explores how it can optimize systems to create spaces that foster community, enable the stewardship of nature, generate biophilic beauty and versatility, activate ecosystem services, and build resilience.

 

You may refer to attached pdf or visit the Facebook event page https://fb.me/e/1YshG61nX <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffb.me%2Fe%2F1YshG61nX&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfec1d10fca534cca81f508d968336ee8%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637655392686862455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rbpqckjhAr24165fwMbdjkK70XaK%2BB3i0QcsX2YMuBA%3D&reserved=0>  for more information.

 

Thank you

 

Sincerely

 



 

https://asd.sutd.edu.sg/ <https://asd.sutd.edu.sg/>

Subject: Notice for Students (26 August 2021)
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 

Dear Students,

 

In line with the national stance of transiting to the endemic state and the Ministry of Education (MOE)’s latest Safe Management Measures (SMMs), our university will adopt the safe management measures to keep faculty, students and staff safe.

 

(A) Teaching Plan: 13 Sep to 22 Oct (Week 1 to 6) and 1 Nov to 17 Dec 2021 (Week 8 to 14 )

 

1.           Term 1 and Term 3 subjects will have on-campus lessons in the respective designated cohort classroom except:

*         A few classes may have specific requirements for online learning mode. The respective faculty/office will inform you for these classes.

 

2.           Term 6 Pillar subjects will have online classes from Week 1 to Week 6. Hybrid mode may resume progressively, subject to the latest advisory from the related government agencies.

 

3.           Term 10 subject(s) will have on-campus lesson. Thesis students will arrange appointment with their mentors to update progress, when necessary.

 

4.           PG subjects will have online classes during office hours and can be physical after 6pm from Week 1 to Week 6. Hybrid mode may resume progressively, subject to the latest advisory from the related government agencies.

 

5.           Mid-term and final examinations will be conducted on campus.

 

6.           Class size of all physical lessons is capped at 50 pax (including instructors).  Any classes with more than 50 pax (including instructors) will go online. The respective subject lead and pillar/cluster will inform the students for these classes of the arrangements, if any.

 

7.           Group discussion/activity is capped at 5 pax per group, (regardless of the individuals’ vaccination status), and with SMMs in place.

*         Faculty/Students should have their mask on at all times, and maintain a safe distancing of at least 1 metre between persons (or between groups of not more than 5 persons for group activities/team-based labs/projects/ASD studios). No intermingling between groups.

 

8.         Graduate students performing research who need to return to research-lab/facility, please continue to seek clearance via your advisors/project-PIs/lab-managers.  For those who need to access Graduate Student Clusters (GSC), follow up instructions from the Office of Graduate Studies on the SMMs will be provided in regards to its reopening.

 

Notes for Section A 

 

*         As the situation is fluid and teaching plan can change in a short span of time, please refer to the instruction from the faculty, pillars, clusters, departments or offices for the latest and specific arrangement. 

*         If you have an online lesson in-between two on-campus in-person lessons, or back-to-back between an online lesson & on-campus in-person lesson on the same day, 

a)            you shall go to interim study room/library/open spaces/ASD respective studios and designated rooms for online lessons/self-study, subject to availability and safe distancing measures

b)            return to hostel room, if you are a hostel resident.

*         Please refer to the attached PDF for the operating hours at the respective academic spaces and facilities. The operating hours is subject to changes in response to the evolving situation. Students shall refer to the latest notice from the respective departments or offices (e.g. Library/Fab lab)

 

(B) Safe management measures

 

The university will continue to adhere to safe management measures to keep our SUTD community safe.  As the situation continues to evolve, we will provide updates in response to new advisory from the related government agencies. Please continue to observe the measures on the days when you are on campus.

 

(I) COVID-19 vaccination

 

While COVID-19 vaccination is not mandatory, we encourage students who have not been vaccinated and are medically eligible for vaccination to sign up for it at www.vaccine.gov.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.vaccine.gov.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cbc5345d5a6b041ecd89408d968281a68%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637655344074002141%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=TLGYfsPonJ5O4WPDhYtre2W8LK0Guky0NFLuwGS5QqU%3D&reserved=0>  as early as possible.

 

(II) Before you come to campus

 

Please check in using the TraceTogether token or app before you are allowed entry onto campus. You should have your TraceTogether token or app with you throughout.

 

Please do not come onto campus if you or

*         your household members are unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice

*         your roommate is unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice (applicable to students staying in hostel’s twin-sharing room)

 

Please refer to the attached list of scenarios where Leave of Absence will be issued or students will have to apply for Leave of Absence via MyPortal.

 

When you are not able to attend classes due to reasons such as the above scenarios or medical reasons, please do:

*         inform your faculty of your absence

*         submit your leave of absence via MyPorta <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/psp/EPPRD/?cmd=login&languageCd=ENG> l> NavBar> Navigator> Self Service> Leave/Withdrawal Request> Leave of Absence Application.

 

(III) When you are on campus

 

1)    Masks must be worn at all times except when you are eating or drinking.

2)    Please check-in at Campus Centre or Lobby F for completion of TraceTogether-only SafeEntry at least 20 minutes before the scheduled class time. For those who are driving or riding in, you will check-in at Entrance C (2nd vehicular entrance along Changi South Ave 1).



 

3)    The start and end time of each class must be strictly adhered to.  If you are unwell with dry cough, fever and tiredness, do not come to class but visit the Public Health Preparedness Clinic (PHPC).

4)    You are required to do your daily health and contact declaration via the Daily and Travel Declaration System at https://tts.sutd.edu.sg <https://tts.sutd.edu.sg> .

5)    You will only be allowed on campus on the days when you are scheduled for classes and/or related academic activities.  The security will have the class list for verification.

 

(IV) Teaching venues

 

1)    You can only be on campus for the duration of the class instructions and related academic activities. 

2)    Venues designated for teaching will have the requisite social distancing measures in place.

3)    Freshmore students (Term 1 & Term 3) will be assigned in groups of not more than 5 students per group. Hence, Freshmore students will be assigned a group and a seat number in your respective Cohort Classroom. Please minimise your interactions by working within a fixed group of no more than 5 persons and occupying the assigned seat for lessons. More information on the assigned seating arrangement will be conveyed to freshmore students between 8 and 10 September 2021.

4)    The university would need to keep records of students’ seating arrangements (e.g. Faculty taking photos at the start/end of sessions) to allow affected students to be identified quickly in the event of a confirmed case and for subsequent contact tracing.

5)    Once the class instructions and related academic activities are over for the day, please do not loiter around the classroom. For those who are hostel residents, please return to the hostel; for the rest, please leave campus as soon as possible.

6)    Please observe personal and environmental hygiene with regular hand washing.

 

(V) Consumption of food

 

1)    Meals can only be consumed at the designated refreshment areas only (Canteen, F&B outlets etc) and should not be at student spaces and common areas. Individuals are to mask up immediately after eating, and leave the designated refreshment areas after finishing your meals.

2)    Please clear your table after the meal.

 

As these measures are to ensure the safety and wellbeing of everyone, compliance is mandatory.  Disciplinary actions will be taken against the student(s) for any violation.

 

 

Best regards,

Office of Student Administration

 <file:///C:/Users/rueyshyong_lim/Documents/Documents/download>

How to apply?

*	Proceed to Self Service > UROP/UTOP Details > Apply for UROP/UTOP Programme
*	Please contact the course lead to find out more on the teaching responsibilities. Shortlisted candidates may be contacted for an interview with the subject faculty.

 

Eligibility 

*	You should have taken the subject before 
*	Minimum grade requirement: B and above (depending on subject leads)

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

*	Please note that UTOP is fully voluntary (i.e. No remuneration is given to UTOP UTAs)
*	At the end of the course, eligible UTOPers will be awarded a UTOP certificate and your participation will be recorded in the Fifth-Row transcript upon successful completion of 26 contact hours.  
*	Students should not be applying for UTOP and other schemes (student@part-time work) under the same course at one time.

Subject: 3DC's upcoming plans and survey
Body:
Hi SUTD community,

As the new term is approaching, 3DC, SUTD’s Google-affiliated developer club, would like gather opinions on how we can better cater to those of you who wanna work in tech.

If you are:
- a freshie not sure if ISTD is for you
- someone who already enjoys coding but unsure about internships / career in tech
- an entrepreneur interested in tech startups

...then you're in for a treat!

We already have plans for workshops, club sessions and a whole range of tech talks hosted by both students and industry partners.

We would really appreciate it if you could spend just 3 minutes of your time to help let us know what YOU want to see, learn and hear from student teachers, alumni and industry veterans!

Link here: https://forms.office.com/r/b4NR2EjiZm <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2Fb4NR2EjiZm&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd1321901b99543dfdd6408d967b37852%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637654842999807153%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=oz39Tv%2BhZ9QH%2FS1dtn9Wz7PLjWM8ahMMu2JyXD%2Fo2x8%3D&reserved=0> 


Best Regards,
Bryce Goh
Vice-President (Incoming)
Digital Design and Development Club (3DC)
SUTD-Google Developer Student Club

Subject: Zoomtopia Sessions Announced - Set Your Agenda!
Body:

Sessions will dive into specialized content for primary, secondary, and higher education to understand how Zoom products support a number of education-specific applications, including distance and hybrid learning, student safety, and more.
 <https://assets2.brandfolder.io/bf-boulder-prod/qh7bhx8qnnj9gfq7fgsxs3b7/v/1004163007/original/21-0623-ZoomtopiaEmailHeader_Burgundy.gif> 	
A Virtual Experience	 
SEPT 13-14, 2021
Sponsors of Happiness	 
	
Register for Free <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fclick.zoom.us%2Fe%2F84442%2F-zcid-4888%2Fc3ljgf%2F3521818964%3Fh%3D4KdjCJi9CwiTKLtro0gFk6G_OAPoE3QgnRWvmp9Kr2U&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C27f1cb01fcad4308cb3408d9673b1342%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637654325715852285%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=kDoyHCCrda9yXcl3hW6rW789vSlCjXz0NTUz3Sn3U28%3D&reserved=0> 	 
Register for Free Today!	 
The countdown is on! With less than three weeks left until Zoomtopia 2021, we invite you to register now <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fclick.zoom.us%2Fe%2F84442%2FjFgzzFL-Ba5D3aBtDF-WBVNaaSO3pw%2Fc3ljgh%2F3521818964%3Fh%3D4KdjCJi9CwiTKLtro0gFk6G_OAPoE3QgnRWvmp9Kr2U&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C27f1cb01fcad4308cb3408d9673b1342%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637654325715852285%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=xWA9D%2Fk60n4n9GGi56nE6LZ%2Bn9yKkz%2BCFojyHTUUwGU%3D&reserved=0>  for our annual celebration of our customers, taking place virtually September 13-14.

This complimentary two-day experience will showcase an entire track dedicated to the education industry. Sessions will dive into specialized content for primary, secondary, and higher education to understand how Zoom products support a number of education-specific applications, including distance and hybrid learning, student safety, and more.

Subject: LOOP Design Awards 2021
Body:
Dear SUTD Community

 

We are pleased to announce that highly-decorated  “The Future of Us Pavilion” has been shortlisted in the 2021 LOOP Design Awards.

 

As an open platform to celebrate creativity and talent world wide, the LOOP Design Awards seek to honour remarkable works worldwide in the fields of Architecture, Interior Design, Landscape Design, Product Design and Architecture Photography industries.

 

Lets all rally behind ASD Prof. Thomas Schroepfer and his team at SUTD Advanced Architecture Laboratory and show your support by casting your vote online <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loopdesignawards.com%2Fproject%2Fthe-future-of-us-pavilion%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2a38642e047745d4367608d966aeec27%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637653723997475509%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Dm0pIeV8TQg6hB2JesiHeDOpc67AN7eg2oCu55gvdr4%3D&reserved=0>  for this iconic structure at Singapore’s Gardens by the Bay.

 



 

Thank you

 

Sincerely

 



 

https://asd.sutd.edu.sg/

Subject: Reminder: PhD Oral Defense Public Seminar - Towards Tightness with Pairwise Independence, Extremal Dependence and Robust Satisficing using Linear and Conic Duality
Body:
Dear all,

 

Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) would like to invite you to join us for our PhD Oral Defense Public Seminar. 

 

Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) 

PhD Oral Defense Public Seminar

 

 

Towards Tightness with Pairwise Independence, Extremal Dependence and Robust Satisficing using Linear and Conic Duality

 


Arjun Ramachandra


PhD Candidate

Supervisors: Prof. Karthik Natarajan, Asst. Prof. Napat Rujeerapaiboon, Prof. Melvyn Sim

 

Thursday, 26th August 2021, 4:00 pm – 5:00 pm

Zoom Link: https://us06web.zoom.us/j/89214457568 <https://us06web.zoom.us/j/89214457568?pwd=QnBkWUhGbjRSSW9OTVFrSTlEdXRNUT09> 

Password: 566972

 



 

Speaker Bio: Arjun is currently enrolled as a PhD candidate in the ESD pillar under the SUTD-NUS joint doctoral programme. He is jointly supervised by Prof. Karthik Natarajan from SUTD and Dr. Napat Rujeerapaiboon and Prof. Melvyn Sim from NUS. Prior to this, Arjun graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 2008 after pursuing the integrated master’s program in maths and computing. Subsequently, he worked as an associate system engineer with IBM India and later switched to academia, where he taught applied mathematics. His research interests lie at the interface of optimization and uncertainty that include investigating probability bounds using optimization techniques and robust satisficing. 

 

 

We look forward to seeing you at this seminar!

 

Best regards,

CHEN Sin Chee | Associate Programme Director (Graduate Studies) | Engineering Systems and Design (ESD)

Singapore University of Technology & Design | 8 Somapah Road | Singapore 487372

Subject: eDimension and Blue Integration with EASE
Body:
Dear Students,

 

We are continuously improving the security of our Learning Systems to provide you with a safer cyber environment. We are pleased to announce that eDimension and Blue will be integrated with SUTD’s Enhanced Access and Secure Entry (EASE).

 

With this integration, Multifactor Authentication (MFA) will be used when accessing eDimension and Blue (Course Evaluation). 

 

From 30 Aug 2021 9:00 am, you will be prompted for your EASE MFA in addition to your EASE ID and password when accessing eDimension and Blue. 

 

Please refer to the attached guides for your reference.

 

If you encounter any issue when accessing eDimension and Blue, please email to us at edi_admin@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:edi_admin@sutd.edu.sg> .

 

Regards,

eDimension Admin

Subject: [Capstone 2021 Sharing] Project S22 - Plant Buddy
Body:
Dear SUTD Family,

 

We would like to share with you about our Capstone project, Plant Buddy, that we have developed in collaboration with Panasonic.

Do find out more about our project through the link below and we hope that we could get your support to vote for our project!

 

https://capstone2021.sutd.edu.sg/projects/plant-buddy

 



 

We are very excited about or project, Plant Buddy, a smart interactive plant pot with a companion mobile app that educates and engages children in hydroponics urban farming. Over the last few months, our team designed Plant Buddy over multiple iterations by working closely with our users, children, through user testing sessions to assess various initial prototypes and concepts with them. Designing suitable for children was rather difficult, however, we are very happy to share the fruits of our labour. We have successfully built 5 Plant Buddy units which we had the chance to hand to 4 children for 8 days as part of a beta trial that yielded stellar results. Users rated the product 4.56 of 5, providing strong validation for the solution and our project.

Do have a look at what our partners, parents and children have to say about our product through the videos in our webpage!

We would really appreciate your support by voting for us through the link above!

If you are hoping to engage in a capstone that involves hydroponics/urban farming or hope to learn about how you might partner with Panasonic for a Capstone project next year, feel free to reach out 😊

 

Yours Sincerely,

Lee Jia Juen

Senior | Engineering Product Development

SUTD Technology Entrepreneurship Programme (STEP) 2020 

 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/>

Subject: A day in the life of a data scientist!

SUTD-AISGD


Day in a life of Data Scientist


 


@ Portcast.io


 

	

 <https://media2.giphy.com/media/unSNH4zXh1m7q9TbOR/giphy.gif?cid=20eb4e9dul893z02tnf3cqrhz6739uqz0ppx4c2utvfzm1ya&rid=giphy.gif&ct=s>
