Subject: NDA2021 Award Recipients
Body:
Dear SUTD Community and Board Members,

 

The annual National Day Awards (NDA) is a means of recognizing various forms of merit and long service to the nation. At the NDA investiture ceremony, Singaporeans and non-Singaporeans are honoured for their excellent contributions to the civil or military service, social and community work, or for excellent performance in their respective fields. Here are the SUTD recipients of the NDA 2021 Awards:

 

 

1.	Public Administration Medal (Gold)

Professor Chong Tow Chong - President

 

2.	Public Administration Medal (Silver)

Mr. Poon King Wang – Senior Director, Strategic Planning and Director, LKY CIC

 

3.	Public Administration Medal (Bronze)

Associate Professor Yow Wei Quin – Associate Head of Cluster (Research), HASS

 

4.	Commendation Medal

Miss Zerlina Tay – Deputy Director, Marketing & Communications

 

5.	Commendation Medal

Ms. Angelvin Chee Parma – Deputy Director, Career Development Centre

 

6.	Efficiency Medal

Mr. Tommy Lee – Senior Manager, Human Resources & Organization Development

 

7.	Long Service Medal

Mr. Allan Chan – Deputy Director, Undergraduate Studies

 

8.	Long Service Medal

Dr. Andrew Yoong Cheah Huei – Senior Research Fellow, iTrust

 

 

 

 

Let us extend our heartiest congratulations to them!

 

 

Cheers

Dr Jaclyn Lee

CHRO

Subject: Happy National Day from 9th ROOT & 5th SAC
Body:
Dear SUTD Family,

I hope that all of you are safe and healthy. 

 

We would like to wish everyone a very Happy National Day on behalf of 9th ROOT & 5th SAC! We have come so far since the pandemic last year, and as we look forward to the new normal, let us look past our differences and come together to celebrate our unity as One people, One nation, One Singapore. 

Let’s all celebrate this year at home / hostel by reminiscing with the national day songs from the yesteryears. 

We have specially curated a YouTube playlist <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FSGNATDAYSONGS&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C543fd280caa54f2e4ff408d95a983a44%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637640432238226922%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sxoI2tzeE2wZ2RxuZm%2Fm59stc3ro6uzQuC%2FOIIShSys%3D&reserved=0>  (http://tinyurl.com/SGNATDAYSONGS) so you can listen on repeat this holiday!!

 



 

With that, we would also like to take this opportunity to get to know more about your wellbeing during these transitioning times. 

9th ROOT & 5th SAC Cabinet discussed with Management and came up with a survey, covering topics such as Academic Life & Campus Facilities. This survey also acts as a follow up to some of the concerns that were raised during Spring 2021 DSM, where the minutes to that event were released last Friday, 6th August 2021.

We would appreciate if you can take some time to fill up the survey <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FSUTDWELLBEING2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C543fd280caa54f2e4ff408d95a983a44%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637640432238236919%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=zFtuz3TloXMjjj62tnQo1I%2BeA%2FP7yA4mMlLZCXqwWQw%3D&reserved=0>  (http://tinyurl.com/SUTDWELLBEING2021 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FSUTDWELLBEING2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C543fd280caa54f2e4ff408d95a983a44%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637640432238246910%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=e7PC3atGE%2F6IAzh8LLPeqHARsVwQd%2FNwYbe2mUVhJyQ%3D&reserved=0> ) and your responses will be duly looked into.

 



 

Once again, 

Happy 56th Birthday to Singapore, and we wish all of us in the big SUTD Family a safe and joyous holiday!

 

P.S. Our personal favorites are Home (1998), My Island Home (2006) and Reach Out For The Skies (2005)!

P.P.S. Let us know your favorites by sharing them on Instagram, tag us @SUTDLife and don’t forget to like our National Day Instagram post!



Best Regards,

 

Mohamad Arshad

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

President

9th Student Government

Unwavering • Accountable • Innovative

Subject: Summary of coverage: Highlights of SUTD
Body:
Hi All,

 

Here’s the news coverage: 

 

-          South China Morning Post did a feature on Singapore’s first male diver at the Olympic Games, ASD student Jonathan Chan. The article briefly mentioned that Jonathan is studying architecture in SUTD. 

-          EE Times Europe wrote an article about the various 6G research initiatives appearing around the world and mentioned Finland's 6G Flagship partnership with SUTD on the FCP.

-          Human Resources Online interviewed an industry insider on how SUTD is pivoting towards hiring more local talent to help tide over the talent shortage. The interviewee is CHRO Dr Jaclyn Lee.

-          Straits Times reported that some teenagers are creating social media accounts using pseudonyms to handle criticisms. The article included quotes from HASS faculty fellow Dr Andrew Yee.

-          Montreal AI Ethics Institute, a thought-leading institute on AI Ethics released Volume 5 of The State of AI Ethics, which featured a write-up by HASS head Prof Lim Sun Sun. Please see the attached document for her write-up.

________________________________

 

South China Morning Post, 6 Aug 2021, Tokyo Olympics: Jonathan Chan, Singapore’s first male diver at the Games, ready to make history (https://www.scmp.com/sport/article/3144055/tokyo-olympics-jonathan-chan-singapores-first-male-diver-games-ready-make <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.scmp.com%2Fsport%2Farticle%2F3144055%2Ftokyo-olympics-jonathan-chan-singapores-first-male-diver-games-ready-make&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C89241fa2deac4a9f71cc08d958c1573a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638409857132362%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gbERU62KRuSUW8ZbrDNiS6mzRwtNbqsj5LJpUtZyQuM%3D&reserved=0> )

 

Jonathan Chan will earn the distinction on Friday of becoming Singapore’s first male diver to compete at an Olympics, having become the first from his country’s to qualify for the Games on merit.

 

Chan will square off in the 10m platform preliminaries today at 1pm at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre against 28 other divers, most notably Great Britain’s gold medallist Tom Daley, who is seen as one of the favourites. Two days previously Freida Lim took part in the women’s event for Singapore at Tokyo 2020, finishing 30th.

 

Chan had an interesting route to the Olympics, which started when he was watching the Youth Olympic Games in 2010 in Singapore as a fan, according to an official interview with Olympics.com. Four years on and he was competing at the same event in Nanjing, China. He came 10th in the 10m platform and eighth in the mixed team event. He was also the flag bearer for Singapore.

 

He spoke about how diving wasn’t even his first choice, but his initial sporting love surely helped him when it came to honing diving skills.

 

“I was originally a gymnast,” the 24-year-old told Olympics.com. “I started gym when I was around six or seven years old, and then when I was 13, there was the YOG happening in Singapore, but we didn‘t have any divers at that point in time. My sister was one of those within the age range who could compete in YOG, so she started diving first, and then I went to try out the sport as well and realised I liked it better than gym. So, I swapped over.”

 

Chan is studying architecture at the Singapore University of Technology and Design (he is writing his finals during the Games because of Covid-19 delaying classes), and in September of 2019, Chan won the men’s 10m platform event in the Asian Diving Cup in Kuala Lumpur, beating favourites Wang Zewei, from China, and Korea’s Ri Kwon-hyok. Chan, who was 22 at the time, was vaulted into the local spotlight and dubbed “Singapore’s golden boy of diving”.

 

“I think nobody was expecting my Olympic qualification,” he said in an interview on Instagram. “Because the competition was in Malaysia, my whole family didn’t attend, they were like ‘small competition, never mind’. And I was really going in without expecting anything. I think maybe I was more relaxed I guess. Every dive I did that day was quite good. I just did everything and then by the time it ended they were like, ‘Oh, you’re first’”.

 

Singapore’s most famous Olympian is Joseph Schooling, who beat his childhood idol Michael Phelps in the 100m butterfly at Rio 2016, the first medal for the country. Schooling was unable to win a medal at Tokyo 2020.

 

Chan said he’s always thought about making a big splash in diving for Singapore, having trained for more than a decade in the sport. He was unable to train in an actual pool for three months owing to Covid-19 during the country’s strict lockdowns.

 

“It shows that what I put in over the past 10 or more years has finally paid off. To be the first diver to represent my country at this kind of event is such an honour. Honestly, it‘s a surreal experience, but at the same time I hope it inspires other future divers in Singapore to show that it is possible as long as you stick to it and put in the hard work. It’s not something that is out of reach, like how I thought it was when I first started diving, but it really can be done.”

 

 

EE Times Europe, 5 Aug 2021, Research Alliances Grow to Learn How 6G Will Play Out (https://www.eetimes.eu/research-alliances-grow-to-learn-how-6g-will-play-out/ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eetimes.eu%2Fresearch-alliances-grow-to-learn-how-6g-will-play-out%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C89241fa2deac4a9f71cc08d958c1573a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638409857142356%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Ur8CMgJJRJzO8aIovjYQLKBLJm9Y7YAedYMGOZp6E%2B4%3D&reserved=0> )

 

The last 18 months has highlighted the significance of our communications networks, and how many of us have become dependent on them to continue some form of normality, whatever that might be. So, as we slowly start coming out of lockdowns and governments continue to ease restrictions, it’s no surprise that a lot of research focusing on 6G, considered the next big thing for communications, is top of mind.

 

This week, two U.K. universities launched a virtual research hub to focus on 6G, and this is just one of many initiatives, alliances and partnerships we’ve seen announced around the world in recent weeks and months. That includes Finland’s flagship program tying up with a Singapore, the U.S. and U.K. leaders considering how to collaborate on 6G as part of a wider technology alliance, a Korean and Japanese alliance between LG and KDDI, a collaboration between Ericsson and MIT, a 6G research center in Texas with participation from Samsung, AT&T, Nvidia, Qualcomm and InterDigital, and a 6G research hub in Dresden and Munich funded by German government.

 

In parallel, the European Commission along with the European private sector 5G Infrastructure Association (5G IA) met in June to present a new €900 million European joint undertaking (JU) on smart networks and services (SNS) to define and implement research, innovation and deployment roadmaps that will enable Europe to take a leading role in 6G. The first calls for project proposals under this new SNS JU are expected to be launched later this year, with the first projects starting later in 2022.

 

The 5G IA published a white paper covering key areas of 6G research proposed, and explains how 6G is expected to play a key role in the evolution of the society towards the 2030s, as the convergence between the digital, physical and personal worlds will increasingly become a reality. Furthermore, 6G will support the European Green Deal’s objective of reaching climate neutrality for Europe by 2050. This and other objectives of 6G will also greatly contribute to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.

 

U.K. universities launch 6G Futures

 

This week, the University of Bristol and King’s College London launched a center to develop U.K. research in 6G. The new virtual hub, called 6G Futures, unites more than 400 world-renowned experts in telecommunications networks, cyber, artificial intelligence (AI), digital humanities, social sciences and arts from the two universities. Both institutions have played a pivotal role in bringing 5G to the mainstream. While they both have expertise in AI and machine learning, King’s specializes in mobile networks and the University of Bristol has particular expertise in wired/wireless technology and network layers.

 

The academic team leading 6G Futures are Professor Dimitra Simeonidou, director of the University of Bristol’s Smart Internet Lab and co-director of Bristol Digital Futures Institute; and Professor Mischa Dohler, Professor in wireless communications at King’s College. Simeonidou said, “6G will be inherently human-centric, and will establish a cyber-physical continuum by delivering real time sensory information, supporting haptics and holograms. This takes us far beyond future-forecasting: crucially, this is about having the specialist knowledge and expertise to transform visions into deliverable solutions, accelerate innovation, and make a positive difference to society worldwide.”

 

Dohler added, “The creation of this center is a notable moment for the UK technology sector. We will be developing novel architectures, incorporating federated exchange and self-synthesizing mechanisms, advance the internet of skills, and embed blockchain, quantum and federated AI technologies. But it’s not just pure tech – we’ll be working on co-creation with verticals toward some truly exciting and societally impacting use-cases, while contributing to policy, alliances and global standards.”

 

Simeonidou and Dohler’s bosses at the two universities said the center would fill a national leadership gap for 6G in the U.K. Phil Taylor, pro vice-chancellor for research and enterprise at the University of Bristol, said, “Not only will the focus be on technology but also on the development of solutions that could transform sectors spanning health, energy and transport. It will provide an opportunity for industry and international collaborators to come together with the best and brightest minds, here in the world-renowned tech clusters of London and Bristol.”

 

Reza Razavi, vice president & vice principal (research) at King’s, added, “If the UK is going to play a major role in realising the potential of 6G, we need a national center that brings together the very best minds in communications technologies, cyber, AI, digital humanities, the arts and social science.”

 

Germany invests €70m in 6G research hubs

 

Meanwhile in Germany, four 6G research hubs are being established, with an investment of €70 million over the next four years by the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF). Under this initiative, the Fraunhofer Heinrich Hertz Institute (HHI) will be coordinating the “6G Research and Innovation Cluster (6G-RIC)” research hub, a “6G-Life” research hub has been created in Dresden and Munich through a partnership between Technische Universität Dresden and the Technical University Munich.

 

A total of around 50 research partners from science and industry are involved in the four hubs, which aim to bundle national research activities in order to lay the technological foundations for future mobile communications generations. The main focus lies on technologies and key components that are developed and manufactured in Germany and Europe in order to achieve technological sovereignty and to ensure data security.

 

At Fraunhofer HHI, Professor Slawomir Stanczak, coordinator of the hub, said, “Within the 6G-RIC consortium, we can contribute our expertise in several research fields from fundamental research to implementation: mobile communications, artificial Intelligence, and optical data transmission and compression. By bringing together experienced, interdisciplinary partners in the research hub, we can strengthen Germany’s position in international initiatives on 6G.” The 6G-RIC consortium consists of a supra-regional association of eleven universities.

 

The 6G-Life hub led by Dresden and Munich will focus on human-machine collaboration, combing their preliminary work on areas like tactile internet, 5G communications networks, quantum communication, post-Shannon theory, AI, and adaptive and flexible hardware and software platforms. It will look at providing new concepts for security (quantum communication, post-quantum security), and latencies in communications networks.

 

Another aspect of the 6G-Life hub is to stimulate the startup landscape in Germany. The goal is to create at least 10 new startups through 6G-Life in the first four years as well as involve at least 30 startups in the objectives of the hub.

 

Finland’s 6G Flagship partners with Singapore and Japan

 

One of the more established programs in Europe is Finland’s 6G Flagship project. It has just announced a 6G research and development partnership with Singapore’s newly established Future Communications Research & Development Program (FCP). The FCP, which is hosted at the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) in Singapore, was announced in July with a U.S. $70 million investment as part of the country’s research, innovation and enterprise plan.

 

Professor Matti Latva-aho of the 6G Flagship program in Finland explained the importance of the new partnership with Singapore’s FCP. He said, “The development of global breakthrough technologies, like 6G, always requires international collaboration. Therefore, partnerships with forerunner countries, such as Singapore, are vital for succeeding in 6G competition. Our collaboration will serve all Finnish 6G development when we work with Singapore in themes where mutual benefits can be achieved.”

 

The Finnish program also signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Beyond 5G Promotion Consortium of the Japanese ministry of internal affairs and communications on mutual 6G technology cooperation. The key member organizations of the Japanese consortium include several Japanese telecommunications companies, operators and the conglomerate SoftBank. Professor Matti Latva-aho said, “Japan is a major global player in the development of wireless mobile technologies, and it is in Finland’s interest to expand the cooperation to themes where mutual competitive advantage can be achieved for 6G development. The importance of the collaboration is underlined by Japan’s decision earlier this spring to invest $2 billion in the development of 6G technologies.”

 

Ericsson and MIT collaborate on lithionics and zero-energy devices

 

MIT and Ericsson are collaborating on two major research projects on the design of state-of-the-art hardware that could power next generation 5G and 6G networks. This includes lithionics-based device research to enable neuromorphic computing, promising exponentially more energy efficient AI-algorithms than available today; and advances in hardware to enable “zero-energy” devices able to harvest energy directly from the received radio signal and use it to connect to the mobile network.

 

New feature-rich mobile networks could end up being complex structures for network operators to manage. Ericsson is researching cognitive networks which rely on AI to enable a secure, highly automized, data-driven network operation. To improve the compute power, speed and energy efficiency of cognitive networks, Ericsson Research and the MIT Materials Research Laboratory are collaborating to research new designs in lithionic chips enabling neuromorphic computing, offering exponentially more energy efficient AI processing. This could enable fully cognitive networks with reduced operation complexity and energy consumption compared to today.

 

In addition to research on lithionics, Ericsson and the MIT Research Laboratory of Electronics (RLE) are collaborating on research of mobile networks that connect trillions of sensors and other “zero-energy” devices around us. Powering these devices in a cost-efficient way, possibly directly via a radio signal, is a significant technology challenge. The research by Ericsson and MIT RLE may show how devices can harvest energy from radio signals and other sources, as well as how systems can be designed to utilize this low power to accomplish simple tasks, including how a mobile network may be designed to connect and control these devices.

 

Anantha P. Chandrakasan, Dean of MIT’s school of engineering, said “By combining our knowledge with Ericsson’s expertise in mobile technology, we aim to develop hardware that will power exciting new AI applications on the edge, and take significant strides in the next generation of mobile networks.”

 

University of Texas joins with Samsung, Nvidia, Qualcomm on 6G research

 

Going stateside, the University of Texas at Austin has launched 6G@UT, a new research center to lay the groundwork for 6G, along with industry. Founding 6G@⁯UT affiliates Samsung, AT&T, Nvidia, Qualcomm and InterDigital will each fund at least two projects for three years at the center. Researchers from the companies will work alongside UT faculty members and students to develop wireless-specific machine learning algorithms, advanced sensing technologies, and core networking innovations that will be the backbone of 6G.

 

6G@⁯UT director Jeffrey Andrews, a professor in UT Austin’s department of electrical and computer engineering, said, “Coupled with vast new sensing and localization abilities, 6G will be defined by an unprecedented native intelligence, which will transform the ability of the network to provide incredible services.”

 

The four key research directions for 6G@UT are:

 

*         Deeply embedded machine learning from the physical layer up through to the application.

*         Pervasive sensing for comprehensive situational awareness.

*         Enabling new spectrum and new topologies.

*         Flexible resource sharing, including of spectrum and computation resources. 

*          

The research group expects much of the innovation to lie at the intersection of these areas, in other words, the application of machine learning tools in conjunction with comprehensive sensing to enable efficient resource and spectrum sharing or highly directional beamforming. It also envisions an increasingly open and software-defined cellular network, building on the ORAN paradigm, that provides a platform for continuous and more rapid innovation compared to 5G, particularly for ML-related technologies.

 

 

Human Resources Online, 3 Aug 2021, Industry Insider: How SUTD's pivot towards hiring more local talent has helped tide over the talent shortage (https://www.humanresourcesonline.net/industry-insider-how-sutd-s-pivot-towards-hiring-more-local-talent-has-helped-tide-over-the-talent-shortage <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanresourcesonline.net%2Findustry-insider-how-sutd-s-pivot-towards-hiring-more-local-talent-has-helped-tide-over-the-talent-shortage&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C89241fa2deac4a9f71cc08d958c1573a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638409857142356%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sma8dcD8V%2FakgHe%2ByRFGjY9pL2GuggGZXI6aQHxdBB0%3D&reserved=0> )

 

The number one talent challenge this sector is facing

 

The key talent challenge faced by our sector is recruitment and retention of talents that are critical to drive the university’s strategy. SUTD is in the business of building talent needed to propel the country’s economy through the harnessing of core skills and capabilities in technology, design and sustainability. As these are very niche skills, we have embarked on an international as well as local acquisition plan to acquire talents in our key growth areas.

 

In addition, we also have developmental programmes to groom current faculty, administrative and research talents to fill in future roles.

 

Developments that are intensifying this challenge

 

The pandemic has brought about many challenges in our journey. Firstly, the closing of international borders has halted our ability to continue to bring in international talent that is able to fill certain niche roles that we are not able to recruit locally. Secondly, many of our international hires are feeling intensely homesick due to the ability to return home to visit loved ones. This has also resulted in attrition.

 

Best practices: Strategies that have worked in tackling this challenge

 

We have now shifted more of our hiring towards local talent. One of the more successful programmes that we have introduced is a Fellowship programme for newly graduated Singaporean PhD candidates to develop them into Faculty. It is called a Faculty Early Career Award and it has become a very successful programme for us.

 

We continue to recruit foreign talent to supplement the local talent pool and making arrangements for them to work from their host country. Although there is still a talent shortage, these strategies have helped tremendously.

 

The next big priority for HR professionals in this sector

 

Our next priority would be to develop a comprehensive workforce plan to anticipate talent needs and manpower supply for the next five years. This would help us to anticipate the type of talent shortfalls and for HR to develop long-term recruitment strategies to continue to attract top talents into our sector.

 

Next would be to continue to develop our talent internally and groom them for roles in future technology, sustainability and design. Developing our employer brand will be vital for these strategies to succeed.

 

How CHROs are proactively preparing for the future workplace

 

The role of human resources is rapidly evolving especially in this pandemic world. In fact, COVID-19 has made HR the most important role in social sustainability and integration.

 

In order to prepare for the future of work, we have also been actively managing our Workforce planning and capability development to help reshore and identify critical skills gaps.

 

As an HR leader, my key priorities would be to:

 

*         Attract a skilled workforce for current and future capabilities.

*         Retain valued employees to help propel growth.

*         Build capacity in the long run.

*         Provide strategic leadership necessary to model the right behaviours.

*         Develop an efficient and flexible workforce to cope with constant change.

 

Industry Insider: Dr Jaclyn Lee, Chief Human Resources Officer, Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)

Sector spotlight: Higher education

Based in: Singapore

 

 

Straits Times, 1 Aug 2021, Creating pseudo accounts to handle criticism (https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/community/creating-pseudo-accounts-to-handle-criticism <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.straitstimes.com%2Fsingapore%2Fcommunity%2Fcreating-pseudo-accounts-to-handle-criticism&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C89241fa2deac4a9f71cc08d958c1573a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638409857152350%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CqZMjHNORQJhb5Q42LFS8Pt2P%2BOG5z7IOzFBrmu7T08%3D&reserved=0> )

 

Some teenagers are creating social media accounts using pseudonyms - to bash themselves or support comments posted on their "official" accounts.

 

Social worker Eric Sng has encountered at least four teenagers engaging in such activities.

 

The head of Shine Children and Youth Services' community outreach team ResiL!ence, started in October last year, has been working with young people for over 12 years.

 

Reasons for this behaviour are complex, he said, adding that some might be feeling down and want to double down on themselves.

 

Leaving negative comments might invite others to join in on the self-criticism, or could also be a form of reverse psychology to spur others to share words of encouragement.

 

Others who create pseudo accounts to defend themselves on their social media profiles told Mr Sng that this anonymity helps them respond to critical comments as it is "better to have others protect you than to stand up for yourself".

 

Dr Annabelle Chow, principal clinical psychologist at Annabelle Psychology, said that these pseudo accounts could be used to generate hype among their friends by creating controversy or as an indirect way of having the inner version of themselves affirmed.

 

Dr Emily Ortega, head of psychology at the Singapore University of Social Sciences, added that false identities also help avoid responsibility for words or actions.

 

She said: "But I guess (singer-songwriter) Taylor Swift best explains this - 'say it in the street, that's a knockout, but you say it in a tweet, that's a cop-out'."

 

More commonly, young people set up a public account to showcase a more measured, positive side, and a private account known to closer friends, where they share private matters.

 

"While a private account can be a space for young people to feel safe, it can cut both ways as these spaces are usually not accessible to caring adults who can offer appropriate guidance and look out for warning signs of distress that sometimes peers may be unable to offer or overlook," said Mr Sng.

 

Associate Professor Andy Ho, who specialises in public mental health at the Nanyang Technological University, said that young people and children will inevitably be exposed to mean and ill-spirited comments as they socialise and forge relationships online.

 

Dr Andrew Yee of the Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) said parents and educators should find ways to reach out and help young people better understand the inherent features of social media platforms and what they do to their experience of the digital world.

 

"On top of that, it is important to help young people identify, recognise and regulate their emotions from a young age," added the SUTD fellow, who is researching how technological environments shape health and well-being.

 

 

Montreal AI Ethics Institute, Jul 2021, The State of AI Ethics Volume 5 (attachment)

 

 

Thanks & regards

Melissa Koh

Office of Marketing & Communications

How to apply?

*         Sign into Myportal <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/>  > NavBar (top right corner) > Navigator

*         Proceed to Self Service > UROP/UTOP Details > Apply for UROP/UTOP Programme

*         Please contact the course lead to find out more on the teaching responsibilities. Shortlisted candidates may be contacted for an interview with the subject faculty.

 

Eligibility 

*         You should have taken the subject before 

*         Minimum grade requirement: B and above (depending on subject leads)

 

IMPORTANT NOTE

*         Please note that UTOP is fully voluntary (i.e. No remuneration is given to UTOP UTAs)

*         At the end of the course, eligible UTOPers will be awarded a UTOP certificate and your participation will be recorded in the Fifth-Row transcript upon successful completion of 26 contact hours.  

*         Students should not be applying for UTOP and other schemes (student@part-time work) under the same course at one time.

 

(Contact hours is defined as teaching interaction. Up to 1/3 of the total contact hours can be considered towards course preparation/admin work.) 

 

We look forward to receiving your applications!

From: Corinna Choong
Sent: Friday, July 23, 2021 5:06:41 PM
Subject: Support our very own SUTD Olympian! 

 

Dear SUTD Family,

 

The pinnacle of sports, the Olympic Games, starts today.  As you get ready to support your favourite athletes or events,  you may not know that we have an Olympian in our midst.

 

He is Jonathan Chan, Singapore’s golden boy in diving, the first diver from Singapore to qualify for the Olympics.  In addition to training for the Games, Jonathan is also a Senior from the Architecture & Sustainable Design pillar. 

 



 

Let’s support him in this highly stressful yet glorious time.  Jonathan departs Singapore on 28 July for Tokyo, representing Singapore and also SUTD.  He will be participating in the Men’s 10m Platform event.  Catch him in action on 6 and 7 August!

 

If you would like to follow Jonathan’s progress, follow the SUTD social media channels.  We will be posting Jonathan’s upcoming events and providing links to catch the competitions, share post-event news and results, as well as event rerun links if they are available. 

 

Do follow now. The first post is up! It featured Jonathan teaching Faheem from the Sunrise Show, the basics of diving, and links to Team SG’s schedule!  

 

Facebook <https://www.facebook.com/sutdsingapore/posts/10159253983120977> 

Twitter <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Fsutdsg%2Fstatus%2F1418005372216823809&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf8cd6af9e573486dd86208d9589f591e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638264211450026%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1mvY1O9Nzxc7LlaXKEHvfsP3GCJF214n8IN0GfziIVI%3D&reserved=0> 

Instagram <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fp%2FCRnJk50pJxV%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf8cd6af9e573486dd86208d9589f591e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638264211460025%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ZZotXg693CICmd2m%2BznZhuRhNn3zN%2FfnPEkQx6AgIDs%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Dear Jonathan,

 

Our very warmest wishes for your upcoming competition!  Your dedication to your sport and studies is a fantastic feat.  May you have a fabulous time in Tokyo, and we are super proud of you! 

 

Do keep healthy, have a positive mindset and enjoy every minute of this life-changing experience.

 

All our best,

Your SUTD family

Subject: [SUTD Virtual Event] DESIGN and AI in the DATA DRIVEN WORLD - 7 & 8 Sep 2021
Body:
Dear SUTD Freshmores (Class of 2024)

 

The Design and Artificial Intelligence (DAI) programme invites you to join us at this upcoming “DESIGN and AI in the DATA DRIVEN WORLD” virtual event that’s happening on 7 & 8 Sep 2021.

Come find out the potential of Design and AI! Listen to industry experts and gain hands-on experience in creating AI algorithms in our workshop. Take part in our challenge and win up to $1000 of shopping vouchers!! 

 

If you are unsure of what the DAI programme is about, this virtual event will actually give you a glimpse into what you'll learn in the DAI programme. :)

 

For virtual event's programme, speakers' profile, challenge terms and conditions, please visit: https://www.sutd.edu.sg/About/happenings/Events/2021/9/Design-and-AI-in-the-Data-Driven-World 

Click HERE <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPYKnopgObZ5JlAP9wLaW6BxUMVpCVjVXUEg0UDRLRFowR1YwUkpXN0JaSi4u&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf3bdfceeb6e944f55d0708d9589c6fc3%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638251240713692%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vF2ByI1Ofh5t4Ca%2Fd1V7iS3hfvSmz2w122G%2FSLwnD%2Bo%3D&reserved=0>  to REGISTER. (Zoom meeting details will be emailed to you by 25 August 2021)

 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPYKnopgObZ5JlAP9wLaW6BxUMVpCVjVXUEg0UDRLRFowR1YwUkpXN0JaSi4u&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf3bdfceeb6e944f55d0708d9589c6fc3%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638251240723685%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=B0YWxZroOYPYgd2MrBx3QLSSI5nzJupFA%2Bv%2FSa%2B688g%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Spring 2021 DSM Updates
Body:
Dear SUTD Family,

Hope everyone is coping well.

The responses by Senior Management Members (SMM) to the spring Dialogue with Senior Management (DSM) have been consolidated into the infographic attached. Please take note that a SUTDents' Wellbeing survey will be sent out shortly. Some of the questions in that survey will be related to two responses under Query 3 Campus and Canteen Concerns, so do fill in that detailed survey.

We would like to thank the SUTD community for supporting our virtual DSM. We aim to strengthen the communication between the management and the SUTD community with your participation in the SUTDents' Wellbeing survey. It will assist us and the SMM to understand the community better. Additionally, we hope to raise awareness about the rationale behind some of SMM's actions, and likewise, for SMM to have a better perception of SUTDent sentiments.

On behalf of ROOT and the 5th Student Association Council (SAC),

Project Director of Spring DSM 2021

Clement Loh	  <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 	 
Director of Student Engagement
	
9th Student Government 	 
Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

Subject: [SparkOn! SUTD] Calling for articles writer
Body:
Hello fellow SUTDents!


We are the SparkOn! SUTD committee from 9th ROOT. 

Have you always wanted to help your juniors settle into SUTD Family but wondering how you can do so? 

Look no more! ROOT has the perfect avenue for you to do so now!

We would like to invite you to write articles or contribute ideas for SparkOn! SUTD. For more information, do refer to the graphics attached.

In short, ROOT is curating a set of articles that all incoming, existing students and alumni can refer to for guidance. You can choose to write an article on one of our topics or simply sharing some interesting insights based on your SUTD experience so far that can make life easier or better for SUTDents! 

Before we go on, we refer to the email sent out earlier on 28th July 2021: "Call for volunteers to help in writing articles". 
We would like to clarify that this event "SparkOn! SUTD" and the committee are not affiliated to "DiscoverSUTD". We express our apologies if any confusion were caused.

If you are interested to help, please fill up the attached form so we can contact you with further details to proceed. 

Thank you and we are eager to hear what you have to share! 


 

Google form <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FH72cLcsJCAXncCLQ9&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C7e14b3ae2ef1414f565708d9588fb8f2%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638196686597917%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=j7Cq%2FI7p79QuXjEE6qgNCsx3earzQOz6VTVZ8%2B8QFyo%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Invitation to ISTD COIL Seminar Series on the topic of “Hypercasual game design and development” - Mr Coburn Kong (Zoom)

Subject: Weekly Discovery: Vibrating Shoes Help Low-Vision People Navigate City Streets, Neural Networks Copy Dragonfly Brains, Barcelona named UNESCO World Capital of Architecture for 2026 & more 2 AUGUST – 6 AUGUST 2021
Body:
Weekly Discovery
We SHARE to inspire and ignite ideas! 

 

2 AUGUST – 6 AUGUST 2021

 

 

The Library publishes 9 alerts focusing on Topics relevant to growth and research areas to SUTD. 

 

Stay up to date by subscribing to any of these 9 Topical Reports - CLICK HERE TO SUBSCRIBE NOW <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPY4N9Bppv-lDrynkQwwfyzxUQUxVOTQxUkwzRTJTMVQ1WjU2OFZRQkdPQi4u&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928274451%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=o12TCdEN8A8OoH22HucjvNyMHUx0dPDigswSSk1tZ3c%3D&reserved=0> 

 <https://mylibrary.sutd.edu.sg/node/1489> 

 

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

Fast, Efficient Neural Networks Copy Dragonfly Brains <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fspectrum.ieee.org%2Ffast-efficient-neural-networks-copy-dragonfly-brains&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928284437%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YDTe7vKQ7xDF3qzsFOBGG5OIz%2BfgScsWKtjiXRn0pUo%3D&reserved=0> 

 

ARCHITECTURE

Barcelona named UNESCO World Capital of Architecture for 2026 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.archdaily.com%2F966002%2Fbarcelona-named-unesco-world-capital-of-architecture-for-2026&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928284437%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=SfkEm02TqpJJR6xFykLbGBTbzi5QUY8X%2Fyp3AcRNoi8%3D&reserved=0> 

 

AUTONOMOUS DISCOVERY

Berkeley Lab’s CAMERA Leads International Effort on Autonomous Scientific Discoveries <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eurekalert.org%2Fnews-releases%2F923776&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928294436%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CeEukybzdDGKBO7o3nEZ0w%2BG4a0MrS3yxoNOuSyveS4%3D&reserved=0> 

 

BOATS

Boats Should Be Sleek—But Only Up to a Point <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fspectrum.ieee.org%2Fboats-should-be-sleek-but-only-up-to-a-point&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928294436%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=hf%2BQ6nxIlC6faWuR7YR1OFsk9ek1S65YGwYc2okwisU%3D&reserved=0> 









"An insect-inspired AI could make missile-defense systems more nimble”

“Joining Copenhagen and Rio de Janeiro, Barcelona has been named as the UIA's 2026 World Capital of Architecture by UNESCO…Barcelona and Beijing were both contenders for the 2026 title, but the Catalan city took the lead with its winning bid titled “One today, one tomorrow”, which explores the city’s approach to sustainability and the future of the built environment.”

“Experimental facilities around the globe are facing a challenge: their instruments are becoming increasingly powerful…At the same time, these tools demand new, advanced algorithms to take advantage of these capabilities and enable ever-more intricate scientific questions to be asked — and answered.”

“Boats Should Be Sleek—But Only Up to a Point.The length-to-beam ratio has risen over the centuries, but there are still practical limits.”

Source: IEEE Spectrum <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fspectrum.ieee.org%2Ffast-efficient-neural-networks-copy-dragonfly-brains&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928304432%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=uBbEBiFcgi2r5ePr4%2F%2FSumnTxmn1lEbw%2FwreOgWHyx0%3D&reserved=0>  (30 July 2021)

Platform Teaches Nonexperts to Use Machine Learning <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.cornell.edu%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2Fplatform-teaches-nonexperts-use-machine-learning&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928344405%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=R069F%2BD%2F6%2FQNXFLf4B5eQbU9X0jtiXXnhaE8Ki586nQ%3D&reserved=0> 









“An international research team led by a Göttingen University alumnus has now shown that using solar-panels to produce microbial protein – which is rich not just in proteins but also in other nutrients – is more sustainable, efficient and environmentally friendly than growing conventional crops.”

“Honda has announced on its News Room website the establishment of a startup called Ashirase, Inc.— the first new business venture to originate from the company's IGNITION program. Ashirase will produce an in-shoe navigation system to help people with low vision navigate in public spaces.”

“The answer, mounting research suggests, can influence everything from your predisposition to diabetes, heart disease and depression to the optimal time for you to take medication. But unlike routine blood tests for cholesterol and hormone levels, there’s no easy way to precisely measure a person’s individual circadian rhythm.”

“New award-winning research from the Cornell Ann S. Bowers College of Computing and Information Science explores how to help nonexperts effectively, efficiently and ethically use machine-learning algorithms to better enable industries beyond the computing field to harness the power of AI.”

Source: Gottingen University <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.uni-goettingen.de%2Fen%2F135974.html%3Fid%3D6354&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928344405%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=0%2BXpaWVsHEJJtJEaz8SGS7me%2F2l1V9UC09O6ChkqG5k%3D&reserved=0>  (30 July 2021)

MATERIAL SCIENCE

Scientists Synthesize a Material Which Can Completely Replace Natural Gypsum in the Construction Industry <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fen.misis.ru%2Funiversity%2Fnews%2Fscience%2F2021-08%2F7437%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928364395%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2KmLnk6IHSUFSmFzAyBz%2BAPtBzwiODymLC8LnXAyiww%3D&reserved=0>

NANOMATERIAL

SYSTEMS INTELLIGENCE

Systems Intelligent Organisations Succeed – Regardless of Structures <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aalto.fi%2Fen%2Fnews%2Fsystems-intelligent-organisations-succeed-regardless-of-structures&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4257766ef154fb7f25908d958867339%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637638156928384387%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=B9tFbzLlQ4cP48L48yxnHcQxCcbQEx7W1RgPuKZWKsc%3D&reserved=0> 









“An international team of scientists has proposed a method of production of high-quality gypsum binders based on synthetic calcium sulfate dihydrate produced from industrial waste. Tests of the obtained material have shown that it not only meets all the requirements for materials of this class, but also surpasses binders based on natural gypsum in several parameters.”

“By combining a CeO2 catalyst with atmospheric carbon dioxide, researchers have developed an effective catalytic process for the direct synthesis of polycarbonate diols without using dehydrating agents.”

“Researchers at the University of Central Florida have designed for the first time a nanoscale material that can efficiently split seawater into oxygen and a clean energy fuel — hydrogen. The process of splitting water into hydrogen and oxygen is known as electrolysis and effectively doing it has been a challenge until now.”

“Aalto University researchers have created a new metric for a successful organisation capable of learning.”

Subject: Scheduled System Maintenance – 08 Aug 2021
Body:
Dear Students, 

 

We would like to inform you that a scheduled system maintenance for patching has been scheduled on 08th Aug 2021. During this maintenance, there shall be disruption to services availability as explained in the table below.

 

Date & Time

Affected Websites, Systems and Software

Impact

Date: 08th Aug 2021 (Sunday)

 

Time: 12:00 AM to 07:00 AM

 

Systems

 

*	Library My Account and Library eResources
*	Hostel Management System
*	Student Claim System (SAP Concur)
	
	

 

Websites

 

*	SUTD Website: https://www.sutd.edu.sg <https://www.sutd.edu.sg> 
*	SUTD Library: https://library.sutd.edu.sg <https://library.sutd.edu.sg> 
*	Student Self Help Portal: https://studentselfhelp.sutd.edu.sg <https://studentselfhelp.sutd.edu.sg> 
*	IT Service Desk Portal: https://itservicedesk.sutd.edu.sg <https://itservicedesk.sutd.edu.sg> 

 

 

Services and Software License

 

*	Printing Services
*	Software: Altium Designer, Arcgis, COMSOL, Coventor, CST, DesignBuilder, Matlab, Mathematica, Rhino, RhinoCAM, Solidworks

 

From 12:00 AM – 07:00 AM:

 

The services pertaining to the systems as indicated will not be available during the patching window.

 

Please note that the email is not affected by this maintenance. We will do our utmost to have these systems and services up and running as quickly as possible. 

 

If you have any questions on this maintenance, please contact the IT Service Desk at 6499-4500 or email to help-it@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:help-it@sutd.edu.sg> 

 

Thank you for your attention.

 

Best Regards,

SUTD IT Service Desk

Recruitment Talk 
Do not miss this talk on how digitalisation and artificial intelligence (AI) can help to address the current challenges involved in the complex decarbonisation process. It will concentrate on one of the projects – ‘The World Avatar’, which intends to capture the idea of representing every aspect of the real world in a digital "avatar" world using knowledge graph and AI technologies.

‘The World Avatar’ will be recruiting permanent and internship roles.
Read more <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oYpIi4rq17hVyPioz5RNQXjCJ4GoOD_B/view?usp=sharing> 

23 Aug 2021 | 1600 – 1700 Hrs | 
Virtual Platform

 Apply by 16 August 2021

 <https://forms.gle/WLS9a6BpXxw3TQdc7>  
Students from CSD, EPD & ESD 







	
Other Opportunities 	


 
 

Today at Apple - Students Create 
Launched globally in 2017, Today at Apple is a part educational and part inspirational program that they run in-store and virtually, through different free sessions, to inspire and excite everyone to explore their passions. Join these free sessions to spark your creativity and build new skills so you can stand out on campus and beyond. Get inspiration from homegrown creators online and learn how to take projects further with Apple Creatives at your Apple Store. Read more <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1W_ShHreL0X0DSZsUW9z1lHfXhxt6nQF7/view?usp=sharing> 

 <https://www.apple.com/sg/today/collection/students-create/?cid=rmc-sg-cdm-email-taa-bts21>  
All Students

SEMICON Southeast Asia Hybrid 
The premier electronics manufacturing event will be hosted on a virtual platform from 23 – 27 August. 

Register for your complimentary student virtual pass!

23 – 27 Aug 2021 | Virtual Platform 

 <https://www.gevme.com/SEMICON-SEA-2021>  
Students from EPD 


	
Career Tips & Advice	

 

How to Build Your Personal Brand and Why It’s So Important
The goal of personal branding is to develop an image that conveys a message—ideally one that will boost your career. What follows is a discussion about what personal branding is, why it's so important, and the methods to use to develop your personal brand. Read more <https://access.vault.com/recordurl?nid=263043&wid=274402&vid=1> 


Click HERE  <http://access.vault.com/career-insider-login.aspx?aid=274402>  for full access and more career resources on Vault.com.
The service is free of charge for SUTD students and Alumni.
4 Tips for Finding a Great Job After a Pandemic Gap
Landing a job after a long employment gap can be daunting. And the pandemic left many people unemployed—as well as overwhelmed and wondering what comes next. The good news is as we transition into a post-pandemic era, more and more job opportunities are becoming available each day. Read more <https://access.vault.com/recordurl?nid=262932&wid=274402&vid=1>

Subject: PhD Oral Defense Public Seminar - Towards Tightness with Pairwise Independence, Extremal Dependence and Robust Satisficing using Linear and Conic Duality
Body:
Dear all,

 

Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) would like to invite you to join us for our PhD Oral Defense Public Seminar. 

 

Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) 

PhD Oral Defense Public Seminar

 

 

Towards Tightness with Pairwise Independence, Extremal Dependence and Robust Satisficing using Linear and Conic Duality

 


Arjun Ramachandra


PhD Candidate

Supervisors: Prof. Karthik Natarajan, Dr. Napat Rujeerapaiboon, Prof. Melvyn Sim

 

Thursday, 26th August 2021, 4:00 pm – 5:00 pm

Zoom Link: https://us06web.zoom.us/j/89214457568 <https://us06web.zoom.us/j/89214457568?pwd=QnBkWUhGbjRSSW9OTVFrSTlEdXRNUT09> 

Password: 566972

 



 

 

Speaker Bio: Arjun is currently enrolled as a PhD candidate in the ESD pillar under the SUTD-NUS joint doctoral programme. He is jointly supervised by Prof. Karthik Natarajan from SUTD and Dr. Napat Rujeerapaiboon and Prof. Melvyn Sim from NUS. Prior to this, Arjun graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 2008 after pursuing the integrated master’s program in maths and computing. Subsequently, he worked as an associate system engineer with IBM India and later switched to academia, where he taught applied mathematics. His research interests lie at the interface of optimization and uncertainty that include investigating probability bounds using optimization techniques and robust satisficing. 

 

 

We look forward to seeing you at this seminar!

 

Best regards,

CHEN Sin Chee | Associate Programme Director (Graduate Studies) | Engineering Systems and Design (ESD)

Singapore University of Technology & Design | 8 Somapah Road | Singapore 487372

Subject: <Call for Application> Fully sponsored TF-NUS LEaRN Youth Asian Leaders Initiative
Body:
Dear Student,

 

 

We are excited to invite you to participate in the inaugural TF-NUS LEaRN Youth Asian Leaders Initiative (YALI), a fully sponsored exclusive virtual programme by Temasek Foundation and National University of Singapore. 

 

Be part of the distinguished network of 120 local NUS/NTU/SMU/SUTD and ASEAN student leaders to interact, discuss and engage in Internationalisation at Home, over 10 weekly online (Zoom) sessions between September to November 2021! 

 

Participants will receive exclusive TF-SUTD LEaRN gifts (tshirt, totebag, notebook, bottle etc), and a certificate of completion which will value add to your resume.

 

 

APPLY NOW <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FWsLup7FPNw&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C0b1f8dcbd79c440c403f08d957f3be02%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637526743477957%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=toDwAcBnKWks6HS6Ri1vnnLcWXbaVF1AzZ3KprZPMcc%3D&reserved=0>  BY 16 AUGUST 2021!

 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FWsLup7FPNw&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C0b1f8dcbd79c440c403f08d957f3be02%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637526743487950%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Oony9OttPXLdXygnvOvzgZQ4SKYpgkIaGMsQy57U%2BFQ%3D&reserved=0> 

 


Programme content:

 

*         Developing holistic resilience (physical, mental, social, and emotional), intrapersonal and intercultural skills and understanding

*         Preparing you for the future of work in Asia

*         Building necessary skills and mind sets to finding and securing employment

*         Interactive discussions for you to network with peers from the ASEAN region

*         Participants will enjoy full sponsorship of Programme fees 

 

Participants and mode of delivery:

 

*         120 participants (60 local NUS, NTU, SMU and SUTD students and 60 ASEAN students), only 10 slots for SUTD students

*         10 weekly online (Zoom) sessions between September to November 2021 

*         Full schedule and course outline as attached

 

Programme requirements:

 

*         Participants must join a programme-related Facebook group for networking purposes

*         Participants must submit an experience report of at least 500 words

*         Participants must achieve at least 80% attendance

*         If all is fulfilled, participants will receive a certificate of completion which will value add to your resume

 

Selection criteria:

*         Academic performance

*         Co-curricular records and community involvement

*         Successful applicants will be informed via email, where they will be guided on the next steps.

*         Any queries? Connect with us at global@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:global@sutd.edu.sg>  

 

 

APPLY NOW <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FWsLup7FPNw&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C0b1f8dcbd79c440c403f08d957f3be02%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637526743487950%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Oony9OttPXLdXygnvOvzgZQ4SKYpgkIaGMsQy57U%2BFQ%3D&reserved=0>  BY 16 AUGUST 2021!

 

 

Warmest Regards

 

Office of International Relations

Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)

Subject: [Call for Application] 2021 ZJU Alibaba Design Hackathon
Body:
Dear Students,

 

Call for application: 2021 ZJU Alibaba Design Hackathon – Campus Asia Design Workshop

 

Exciting opportunity to show off your design skills & to work with International students and companies such as Alibaba! 

 

We are pleased to inform you that Zhejiang University (ZJU) is inviting our students to participate in their 2021 ZJU Alibaba Design Hackathon – Campus Asia Design Workshop!

 

Better Responsibility Initiative – Design for Good Earth (BRIDGE) *Attached the full info sheet FYIP.

 

Hackathon background - Since the United Nations proposed the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, the significance and importance of the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) have been increasingly growing and wide spreading. The outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 has particularly started to make people think more about what on earth the “normal” world would be. 

 

In view of this situation, Zhejiang University is hosting BRIDGE (Better Responsibility Initiative - Design for Good Earth) Sustainable Design Action this summer. The BRIDGE Action is a design hackathon workshop focusing on working toward the SDGs and bringing together the design talents from universities and industries around the world to address the SDGs using the design language, attempting to "construct" a bridge to a sustainable future through the lens of design.

 

 

There are 3 stages for the workshop: Vision, Design, Action. ZJU is inviting us to join the Design Hackathon & the Action stage.

 

*         Design Hackathon Date: 4 Sep –11 Sep 2021

Available slots: 10 students

The best group will be awarded the trophy from ALIBABA DESIGN. All the participants will be awarded the certificate.

 

*         Action stage: Sep 12 – Dec 2021 (Optional)

The extremely outstanding students/teams have the opportunities to work with expertise mentors to improve the design proposals and put it into practice. 

 

Due to the long duration, we make it optional for students to join the Action stage however, if you are selected, do consider the pros of participating in such projects with companies like Alibaba, Cainiao, Tmall, etc..

 

Keen students please submit your name, Pillar, student ID, contact number via email by 11 Aug (Wednesday), before 5 pm.

 

2020 ZJU Alibaba Design Hackathon video: Here! <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Ftv%2FCSLXo9DHqj9%2F%3Futm_medium%3Dcopy_link&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd19b85296ad04803479708d957c80769%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637340012414851%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=f%2F%2FFme8IQIt4K4NP%2F7SMwTTPfuxLfThz6Dh7%2FHJ2D4Y%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Tentative schedule:





 

Thank you.

 

Warm regards,

Office of International Relations

 

Any queries? Connect with us at global@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:global@sutd.edu.sg>  

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fsutdsummer%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd19b85296ad04803479708d957c80769%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637340012414851%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4DpqcLzZ3H6RUuxd%2BhhbNfxVIvSU9X5W8tk8LnoQ5vw%3D&reserved=0>         <https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrhQNW4JY6XGx789gma9lXA?view_as=subscriber>       <https://wearesutd.sutd.edu.sg/exchange/design-and-technology-experience/summer-sponsored/>       <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Global/Summer-Programmes/glp>        <mailto:global@sutd.edu.sg>

Subject: [Request for support] Sharing MSC Maritime Digital Challenge with Your Students

Dear School Partner, 

 

The Singapore Maritime Foundation <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.smf.com.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807186555%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=JdxfZnRFzZp1esqt%2FES1FhizfIpCFPfiIW5u0tbXn1U%3D&reserved=0>  is organising the MSC Maritime Digital Challenge <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.maritimesgconnect.com%2Fwhats-happening%2Fmmdc2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807196551%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PHNamJzUkyxjHzmv1K4qNfC%2Fpzn%2FRbaEfyWNBmd1GT8%3D&reserved=0>  – a case competition for tech-savvy students to pit their skills against real-world challenges posed by leading maritime companies. Competing teams stand to win $3,500 cash prizes, secure internships & be mentored by industry professionals. 

 

Please may we seek your help to share this event by forwarding the EDM appended to full-time students from your institution across all disciplines and years of study. 

 

Thank you. 

 

Best regards,

Chu Wen

________________________________

Join the MSC Maritime Digital Challenge <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.maritimesgconnect.com%2Fwhats-happening%2Fmmdc2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807216540%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UuA%2B%2Fy2jh3lOEArD%2BX0hWvViFdMdl8e0LkvJQ1gXuOg%3D&reserved=0>  (MMDC) – Pit your skills against real-world challenges from leading maritime companies. Stand a chance to win $3,500, secure internships & be mentored by industry professionals. Register by 19 Aug at www.maritimesgconnect.com/whats-happening/mmdc2021 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.maritimesgconnect.com%2Fwhats-happening%2Fmmdc2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807216540%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=s0g3LOMd4GDCPiEMQcF9nX7vQZjbADQ8U8zZT0q8gBQ%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.maritimesgconnect.com%2Fwhats-happening%2Fmmdc2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807226542%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=SNC5qUB09Dc1yOReJckzFSF4QCH1l9w98fzaRE9cnbQ%3D&reserved=0> 

 

The competition is open to full-time undergraduates and polytechnic students across all disciplines and all years of study. 

 

Simply register in teams of 2 to 5 via this link <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.maritimesgconnect.com%2Fwhats-happening%2Fmmdc2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807226542%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=SNC5qUB09Dc1yOReJckzFSF4QCH1l9w98fzaRE9cnbQ%3D&reserved=0>  before 19 August 2021, 1700 hrs. Each team member must register individually. 

The first 10 teams to register and submit their proof of concept for the Preliminary Round receives one $10 gift voucher per team member.

 

The MSC Maritime Case Challenge <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.maritimesgconnect.com%2Fwhats-happening%2Fmmdc2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807236526%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=o%2BllW9oPYbALv3vW2y8yv%2F2e4MYaD%2FYzZbfuqFaJM7I%3D&reserved=0>  is brought to you by the Singapore Maritime Foundation <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.smf.com.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf51f960b8e6a4a7ca82d08d957aae616%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637637213807236526%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Dl%2Bvl1AZeLZG3ux7DJ45mx41%2B0ZJIIpF32y%2FhvLJosA%3D&reserved=0> . The participating companies for the 2021 edition are Eastport Maritime, Kanda (in collaboration with Eastern Pacific Shipping) and Torvald Klaveness.

 

Questions? Contact us at msc@sgmf.com.sg <mailto:msc@sgmf.com.sg> . 

 

We look forward to seeing you at the Information Session on 23 Aug.

 

Best regards,

The Maritime Singapore Connect (MSC) Office

Subject: Want to create videos? Check out the @SUTDProductionsBot
Body:
Hi there fellow film enthusiasts! 

 

SUTD Productions has just released our very own telegram bot for you to join and follow us on our creative journey. 

 

This bot is a one-stop platform for you to share your wildest video project ideas and connect with other people to produce them. You can also view other people's ideas and join their production team. Once enough people have opted into your idea, we will contact you via Telegram to begin. Ideate - find a team - get filming! 🎬
