Subject: FW: The new $10,000 VPS Innovation in Sustainability Scholarship 2021
Body:
Dear Freshmore students,

 

Are you passionate about Sustainability?

You might be interested to find out more about the VPS Innovation in Sustainability Award with $10,000 scholarship.

 

Submission deadline is midnight of 31 August 2021.

Please refer to the email below for more details.

 

Regards,

Mei Xuan

On behalf of Prof. Ricky Ang

 

________________________________

From: Awards <awards@vpsveritas.com <mailto:awards@vpsveritas.com> >
Sent: Thursday, July 29, 2021 2:05 PM
To: Ricky Ang
Subject: The new $10,000 VPS Innovation in Sustainability Scholarship 2021

 

External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vpsveritas.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9c2153ec90394846541408d952f7394f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637632044084444505%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=al3ngqxaXa2T4IMIGAd8nXIvjdxCfBfPAv3XZNHtMAo%3D&reserved=0> 

 

	

 

Find out more about our new and exciting global initiative

and how one of your students could win a $10,000 scholarship

The VPS Innovation in Sustainability Awards 2021:

Rewarding creative, responsible thinking with a $10,000 scholarship

 

	

 

 

Dear Prof. R. Ang Lay Kee,                                                                      

 

We found your contact details through your institute’s website. We are getting in touch today to invite your students to enter the VPS Innovation in Sustainability Awards 2021.

 

This new global initiative has been created by VPS – world leaders in marine fuel and oil sustainability – to discover fresh, new thinking in the world of environmental responsibility. We are looking for the young innovators of today who will be making a change to our world tomorrow by delivering practical responses to environmental challenges.

 

We will reward the winner of the VPS Innovation in Sustainability Awards 2021 with a $10,000 scholarship. There are also runners-up prizes of work placements within the VPS global network, plus the potential for VPS to partner with selected entrants to fund initial feasibility studies (and beyond).

 

An introduction to VPS

Millions of tons of fuel and oil are used every year for international shipping and power generation. Through our innovative, high tech testing processes, VPS is helping to reduce thousands of tonnes of CO2, NOx and SOx emissions produced from these industries every year.

 

VPS – Aligned to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals

Our working practices in Marine and Power/Renewables are closely aligned to four of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Now we are looking to recognise and reward the innovative work of students in one or more of these four key areas:

 

 

	

 



 

Your concept must show how it improves the quality of coastal air through the reduction of shipping emissions.

 

	

 



 

Your concept must show how it advances greener marine fuels technology and/or improves the reliability of electricity supply, generation and monitoring devices.

 

	

 



 

Your concept must show how it improves the reliability of electricity supply, generation and monitoring devices, and/or improves marine fuel, lubrication and power station efficiency.

 

	

 



 

Your concept must show how it helps reduce ocean acidification and/or reduces marine pollution from vessels.

 

	

 

How to enter

The first stage of this process is for you to kindly forward this email to the students whose work is focused on creating sustainable working practices, products and/or concepts in the above area(s). If they are interested in taking part, these selected students can then complete a short entry form <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vpsveritas.com%2FEntry-Form.html&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9c2153ec90394846541408d952f7394f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637632044084454495%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ijxgXIS4xYz9o8qzt%2FaqRneV5IsTLX8GYE%2B4e0PURns%3D&reserved=0>  outlining their proposal and its feasibility. Our team of expert judges will then review all entries and create a shortlist for the next round.

 

Please note there are no fees to pay at any stage of this initiative. It is entirely funded by VPS as part of our ongoing commitment to a more sustainable world.

 

All entry forms must be submitted by midnight on 31st August 2021. The winner and runners-up will be personally notified in November prior to the final online award ceremony in December.

 

If you or your students have any questions, please email directly at awards@vpsveritas.com <mailto:awards@vpsveritas.com> 

 

We will respond to your emails as soon as we can. We will also call you over the next few days to ensure you have received this email.

 

Thank you for your time.

 

Malcolm Cooper

Chief Executive Officer

 

E  malcolm.cooper@vpsveritas.com <mailto:malcolm.cooper@vpsveritas.com> 

M +44 7872 816 533 | www.vpsveritas.com <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.vpsveritas.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9c2153ec90394846541408d952f7394f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637632044084454495%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=hO7nVNr8%2BqfxmCLm6gjP4jDwUthHGxEuqI9Ku4jAHW0%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.vpsveritas.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9c2153ec90394846541408d952f7394f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637632044084464488%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=lyshsAqVczCymd96oMB4Ob1UVtYpB7aHX5hqFsevHEA%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: (Invitation) The Young SEAkers Inauguration Day 2021 - 7 August 2021
Body:
<https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Flink.theyoungseakers.com%2Finauguration&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cbf489dc701b448cb4a8908d9523dd6ab%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637631247986110327%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=hCzBHXusXdPGCnyGiFtJJ2h1u7SPGb%2FwU6AdULVnBLM%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Dear SUTD Students,

 

We would like to share with you an invitation to join The Young SEAkers (TYS) as they celebrate their Inauguration Day on 7th August 2021. TYS will be celebrating their milestones alongside the 30th anniversary of ASEAN-China dialogue relations.

 

TYS Inauguration is a half-day hybrid event, where youths and young working professionals in the ASEAN region will gather and hear from esteemed panellists on their insights on the future opportunities and challenges in the ASEAN-China region.

 

TYS aims to empower youths to envision the future they want for the region in the next 30 years and create their own narrative on the direction of ASEAN-China relations. TYS is excited about the positive outlook of ASEAN’s future, and they hope this will be the start of many conversations, where TYS will act as a safe and nurturing platform for likeminded ASEAN youths to take positive actions. 

 

Reserve your spot to attend TYS Inauguration Day 2021 virtually at link.theyoungseakers.com/inauguration <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Flink.theyoungseakers.com%2Finauguration&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cbf489dc701b448cb4a8908d9523dd6ab%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637631247986110327%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=hCzBHXusXdPGCnyGiFtJJ2h1u7SPGb%2FwU6AdULVnBLM%3D&reserved=0> 

 

PS: Follow TYS on their social media as they will announce their Guest of Honour soon!

 

Website: www.theyoungseakers.com <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theyoungseakers.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cbf489dc701b448cb4a8908d9523dd6ab%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637631247986120316%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jycswzMG0aH32i2zqLYtjDwkhi1GZdgujNGvm4Sa63g%3D&reserved=0> 

Facebook: @TheYoungSEAkers

Instagram: @helloseakers

LinkedIn: @theyoungseakers

Subject: [DiscoverSUTD 2021] Call for volunteers to help in writing articles
Body:
Hi SUTDents, 

 

 

Have you always wanted to help your juniors settle into the SUTD Community but wondering how you can do so?

Look no more! ROOT has the perfect avenue for you to do so. ROOT is working on compiling a set of articles that all incoming, existing and alumni students can refer to for guidance. You can choose to write an article or simply provide some interesting and insightful points that will be beneficial to include in articles for fellow SUTDents. 

 

Please fill up the attached survey and we will contact you with further details on how to proceed.

 

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeFyWTUpmK93k9QiHaQHZmjx36pwDPI1eOfYchN6l-W3zILOg/viewform <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLSeFyWTUpmK93k9QiHaQHZmjx36pwDPI1eOfYchN6l-W3zILOg%2Fviewform&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C01d10dc738bd4d0bf1fc08d951b1e29f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630646806117574%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=SWT4tlVbYAUXCt2Q6E0e0Pqg87egHbe3bKD6pP6EiYI%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Best Regards,
Pamela

 

Pamela Lim Shu Hui

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

Orientation Programs Director

8th Student Government

Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

Zoom Academy 2021 is tomorrow!

 <http://click.zoom.us/l/84442/2020-05-20/blf6y1/84442/140392/title_marker_40x8.png> 	
 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fclick.zoom.us%2Fe%2F84442%2Fmpaign-zoomacademy21-zcid-4779%2Fc3lcnc%2F3483680416%3Fh%3D0e_FFa4MNLSIoEKYa3eGx6AZTIIvOTP4LMgd7a4K7RE&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3bc2112f1d0f4a7a5dcd08d951b1b5f1%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630645996835512%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=lcnGQNnx68zsR4evGUYxILGOYjbELuKOjYd0KpK3wDs%3D&reserved=0> 	 
Zoom Academy 2021 is coming up! Tomorrow, educators, administrators, and other education professionals from all across the world will gather to practice new skills, discuss the future of hybrid learning, and more!

We’ve also put together some exciting new training for educators, IT admins, and school leaders. Earn badges on our interactive Zoom Academy platform and prepare for the next phase of teaching and learning.

Take a look at this year’s agenda and register before it's too late!

Spread the word and connect with the Zoom Education community <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fclick.zoom.us%2Fe%2F84442%2F2021-07-27%2Fc3lcn9%2F3483680416%3Fh%3D0e_FFa4MNLSIoEKYa3eGx6AZTIIvOTP4LMgd7a4K7RE&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3bc2112f1d0f4a7a5dcd08d951b1b5f1%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630645996845505%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=5DBWA5VSu9QHlzVo%2FKJUd5QboqPfMMW%2F6%2FXb%2FF7EWzs%3D&reserved=0>  ahead of Zoom Academy.	 
Register Today <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fclick.zoom.us%2Fe%2F84442%2Fmpaign-zoomacademy21-zcid-4779%2Fc3lcnc%2F3483680416%3Fh%3D0e_FFa4MNLSIoEKYa3eGx6AZTIIvOTP4LMgd7a4K7RE&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3bc2112f1d0f4a7a5dcd08d951b1b5f1%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630645996845505%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=VRzCDnYFaV%2Bu5ue9FFpwIB0SnTtsgAl9nlTDgscAoxA%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Datature Open Source app - Portal
Body:
Hey everyone 👋  We are Datature <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdatature.io%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C65ae0d3b86f04760589508d951a05b9a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630572217585669%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PRtdI5tPwR%2BeAwNZA8vcHTLrN0lCyXpuB7mX6a8F4Zw%3D&reserved=0> , a Singapore startup that helps developers, universities researchers and students build better deep-learning models for projects and experiments!

We launched Portal, an open-source app on GitHub <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fdatature%2Fportal&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C65ae0d3b86f04760589508d951a05b9a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630572217595663%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vOUNJjcazqxPVTrBsYESZAkgkY2IzZ%2BpIBclJ7nr68I%3D&reserved=0>  that helps engineers like yourselves inspect your deep neural networks easily within your browser 🔎

 



 

	
	



 

We are all sick of wrangling a bunch of cv2 or matplotlib codes to test models - especially on videos. We created Portal to help teams, engineers, and researchers like you interactively test models on images and videos, inference thresholds, IoU values and much more.

 

	

 


Bring #OpenSource and #SG To The Moon 🚀


If this is a space you are watching or something you might use - do support us on our ProductHunt page here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdatature.io%2Fportal&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C65ae0d3b86f04760589508d951a05b9a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630572217605662%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=h6SDyGeEse%2FdYEU1j4Ea5qIKZDCacv8KQBBpQy3Ar94%3D&reserved=0> !

Let's put 🇸🇬  + open-source on the top of the list ✌

 

👇👇

 

	

 

Make Us Stronks Here! <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdatature.io%2Flaunch&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C65ae0d3b86f04760589508d951a05b9a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630572217605662%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=MmXslNJP%2F0fLb0ot3O%2B5c8G7Wx0lKnct1neYVL3IyuQ%3D&reserved=0> 

	

 

--



Denzel Lee | CTO

+65 9739 9898

Found8 High Street Centre, 1 North Bridge Road

	
Datature specializes in computer vision and converting your use cases into production-ready applications. Find out more about what we do here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdatature.io%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C65ae0d3b86f04760589508d951a05b9a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630572217615648%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vq6YWg9F8gUaPAwLFDSd6R9NwQ0nZCgQNtl86NGIda8%3D&reserved=0> !

Subject: INVITATION - RIBA Future Architects Information Event – Singapore (22 Sept 2021)
Body:
Dear Students

 

The RIBA Singapore Chapter Educational Group and RIBA International have come together to create a special deliver this information and sharing session specifically for Future Architects in Singapore. 

 

Hosted by RIBA Singapore Chapter's Education Group, there will be an introduction to the Singapore Chapter and their role in supporting the Global Architecture community in Singapore and internationally.

 

RIBA Future Architects Information Event provides an introduction to a large range of RIBA services and resources available to architecture students anywhere in the world to inform your studies, inspire your work and advance your career. The event will also offer advice on the various routes to becoming a RIBA Chartered member for those who haven’t studied in RIBA accredited schools overseas or UK schools, with the benefit of being part of a global community. 

 

The event will cover the below topics:

 

• What is the RIBA mission?

• Key RIBA programmes and projects

• RIBA architecture collections

• Online digital resources for architecture students

• Benefits for student and graduate membership

• Routes to becoming a RIBA member

 

Apart from the information on the benefits of student membership, FREE to those studying at a RIBA validated school, you will hear from three past graduates on their experiences following graduation and into practice.

 

You will also learn about RIBA Future Architects, our community for future and emerging architects, including advice and information about studying architecture and exclusive events and opportunities. The network is designed to support, inspire and provide a voice as you transition from study to practice.

 

Background of RIBA:

 

RIBA’s mission is to advance architecture and RIBA international and RIBA Chapters support a global community of architects to promote excellence in architecture. Through our work we champion better buildings and places, stronger communities and a sustainable environment.

 

The RIBA Singapore Chapter Educational Group and RIBA International have come together to create a special information and sharing session specifically for Future Architects in Singapore. Hosted by RIBA Singapore Chapter's Education Group, there will be an introduction to the Singapore Chapter and their role in supporting the Global Architecture community in Singapore and internationally.

 

RIBA Future Architects Information Event would also provide an introduction to a large range of RIBA services and free resources available to architecture students anywhere in the world to inform your studies, inspire your work and advance your career. The event will also offer advice on the various routes to becoming a RIBA Chartered member for those who haven’t studied in RIBA accredited schools overseas or UK schools, with the benefit of being part of a global community

 

You may find out more information and register your interest via the below link:

 

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/riba-future-architects-information-event-singapore-tickets-162293691801 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.co.uk%2Fe%2Friba-future-architects-information-event-singapore-tickets-162293691801&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce9508fc2d84a4a24edc008d95186e6ec%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630462211369283%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Tnx%2FIilVJMYlY57GV8Z0uF7sAcMEEi134egaRYfq8iI%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Thank you

 

 

Sincerely

Subject: [TODAY 3pm] Wed Seminar: Design Optimization for Circularity
Body:
It’s TODAY! Come Join us virtually!

 

Date| 28 Jul 2021 (Wednesday)

Time| 1500 – 1600 

 

Title| Design Optimization for Circularity

Speaker| Peter Ortner, Assistant Professor, Architecture and Sustainable Design, SUTD.

 

Click HERE  <https://dmand.sutd.edu.sg/news-events/events/wed-seminar-series-sustainability-and-circular-economy/> to register and Join us at Zoom Meeting: https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/j/6027282021 <https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/j/6027282021> 

Meeting ID: 602 728 2021

Passcode: 0728SUTD#

 



ABSTRACT

This lecture asks how designers can reduce the waste produced by their buildings and products by implementing computational optimization within a design for circularity framework. Circular Economy is an idea that proposes moving from a ‘take-make-use-dispose’ linear economy toward a zero-waste future, where waste outputs are safely recycled as inputs for new products. In recent years there has been a proliferation of frameworks for circular design, which assist designers to develop products for a circular economy. These frameworks, however, remain generic and provide limited guidance on how to implement computational design techniques like optimization. In parallel, a variety of circularity indicators for products have also been introduced to provide quantitative assessment of attributes that reflect or contribute to a circular economy. To date no single circularity indicator has become standard and many indicators present an incomplete or biased reflection of circularity. Building on an overview of existing circular design frameworks and circularity indicators, this lecture proposes a method for introducing evolutionary multi-objective optimization into design for circularity. Examples from case studies are shared to illustrate the framework’s ability to generate both better performing designs and to assist the designer in navigating contradictions between circularity objectives.

ABOUT THE SPEAKER

Peter Ortner is Assistant Professor and MArch and PhD Coordinator for Architecture and Sustainable Design at the Singapore University of Technology and Design. Peter’s research leverages computational techniques to create sustainable buildings and urban designs. His current research introduces optimization into the process of design for circularity and urban design, augmenting the ability of the architect to contribute to zero-waste, carbon neutral cities. Predicting urban metabolism data during design process is also an on-going research pursuit. In recent research Peter has applied computational design to challenges of urban resilience and automated mobility. His doctoral research at the EPFL built on insights from critical data studies and computational design to elucidate the changing role of architecture and architect in complex, data-driven urban systems.

2021 June & July Wednesday Seminar Series on Sustainability and Circular Economy

A Better World by Design is our motto in Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) that is reflected in our teaching and research. A Better World in the 21st century must include sustainable development and human activities. Sustainability is a complex system-level challenge that requires innovation and collaborations at all fronts. In this online seminar series, speakers from SUTD and international institutions will share recent progresses on sustainability research topics, with a focus on achieving a circular economy. Topics range from the role of design in achieving a circular economy, circularity in manufacturing, our built environment, life cycle analyses and urban metabolism.

Click HERE  <https://dmand.sutd.edu.sg/news-events/events/wed-seminar-series-sustainability-and-circular-economy/> to register. For more enquiries, please contact dmand@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:dmand@sutd.edu.sg>  

NOTE: By registering for this event, your consent shall be granted to DManD Centre for the collection of your personal data. We only ever use and disclose your personal data to communicate with you regarding the events for informational, and not promotional, reasons. In addition, the organizer may use all photographs and videos taken during the event, keeping and distributing such materials for our events, activities and publications.

See you online soon!

 

Thanks and regards,

Bernadette Teo

DID: 6499 8721

 



 

8 Somapah Road Singapore 487372 www.sutd.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce87187c71af64bd270a808d9516a53ce%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637630340110586062%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2E%2B6SWpE6R31tupnoQl7k3qM%2B3s5UMfrtQpRt3Xxde0%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: (Join Us Today) SUTD FIRST Industry Workshop 2021 is happening at 9.00am, Wednesday 28 July 2021
Body:
Hi SUTD Community,

FIRST 2021 is here!

You are cordially invited to our upcoming Virtual FIRST (Fostering Industrial Research Success Together) Industry Workshop today, 28 July 2021. Themed “University-Industry Collaboration: Entrepreneurship and Innovation”, FIRST 2021 (https://www.sutd.edu.sg/FIRST) will dive into new frontiers in academia and industry collaboration through keynote presentation, forum panel discussion, and industry showcase.
Be prepared to hear leading experts, Mr. Chaney Ho,  Co-Founder and Executive Director of Board, Advantech (Taiwan), 
Dr. David Ong, Senior Partner, Naef Group Spiele AG & Chairman, Singapore Mentorship Committee, and 
our very own Dr. Mohan Rajesh Elara, Assistant Professor, EPD Pillar, deliver impactful keynote addresses on:

*	Building Supply Chain Management Resilience in the De-Globalization Age
*	Reimagining Unicorns of the Future
*	The Rise of Self-reconfigurable Maintenance Robots

We also have industry/academia experts from the likes of Huawei International, Mistletoe, A*STAR, Uni Connect, 
and SUTD’s representative lead a virtual forum panel discussion that centres on University-industry collaboration.

Join us as we delve deep into discussions on advancing translational research based on 
sustainable frameworks. It’s all happening on Wednesday, 28 July 2021, at 9.00 am online. 
Doors open from 9.00 am onwards.

This event is free for all, so book your spot today! 

Click To Register! <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021> 

*If you have already registered, you will be receiving an email with the webinar link a few days before the event.*

We shall see you there!
	
 <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>   <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021> 	

 <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>  <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>

To view the projects available next term, follow the instructions below:

 

1.       Login to MyPortal <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmyportal.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C90a5f2ca9be749d2667008d950e14236%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637629751963111499%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=63kn8KF994VBq2Z1zobHLF6mkTH9xZAphfKl%2FkXXA4g%3D&reserved=0>  >  Go to Navbar ( @ top right corner) > Navigator > Self Service 

2.       Proceed to UROP/UTOP Details > Apply for UROP/UTOP Programme (Save this page for quick access next time. Go to Action  (beside Navbar) > Save to Homepage/Favourites)

3.       Click on View all to view list of projects available

4.       Select the project and apply online

5.       Application outcome will be sent via email. 

6.       Student proposers should also submit your application!

 

Please note that UROP is fully voluntary. No remuneration shall be given during the project period. 

Students will be eligible for UROP certification upon satisfactory completion of the project and participation will be recorded in the Fifth Row Transcript.

 

 

UROP Plus (UROP+)

UROP Plus Programme is opened for Term 6 students only! Please refer to the infographic attached for more information. 

 

For enquiries, please contact urop@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:urop@sutd.edu.sg>  or visit http://www.sutd.edu.sg/UROP <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2FUROP&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C90a5f2ca9be749d2667008d950e14236%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637629751963121495%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rU0kADb01GD0Z4kWfjEhT5Qcv8QetXEelShfSc952%2Fo%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Looking forward to your application!

 

Best regards

Huang Weilin (Ms)

Undergraduate Research and Teaching Opportunities Programme

Office of Undergraduate Studies (3.702)

D: +65 6499 4526

Subject: SUTD Venture Building Program Facebook Live Part 2
Body:
***NOTE: This program is only recommended for Final-Year undergrads, Graduate Students, Alumnis & PhDs

Good day everyone 😊

 

After receiving positive responses to our first Venture Building Program Facebook Live last Friday, we have decided to host 2 more rounds of live sharing sessions on Facebook to allow people to learn more about what makes the program in SUTD unique! If you wish to understand more about entrepreneurship or aspire to build your own startup but do not know where and how to start, then this is the perfect opportunity for you! 



Come JOIN US on two 1 hour live sessions to learn more about what makes VB Programme by SUTD unique through the programme graduates and distinguished industry experts themselves!

🔴 3 Aug (Tues, 5 - 6pm) Session: Programme sharing with 2 distinguished industry mentors

🔴 11 Aug (Wed, 1.30 - 2.30pm) Session: Programme sharing with 1 Venture Building Startup Team & 1 Industry Expert Mentor

 

 For those who have missed the first live, you can catch it on https://www.facebook.com/SUTDVIE/videos/210326200886845 <https://www.facebook.com/SUTDVIE/videos/210326200886845/?__cft__%5b0%5d=AZUgkx4S5SBLiFWvW9aokpJOk3emyL4Vv20GXRF5H7wPA782Z4GIpnGUW6hnBHvtPLlAB9VxgCoNx4qM_qzxJF852qXTS2omgu7Gc83TNlbc9Khz7-GI_pskVRVh7hW4kHYcDHNbIWi9yYnR0UjBuXJnvrjKbbP-XgI6zekJi_t2hUhKz1jRQCdWF5PTeAVOER4&__tn__=-UK-R> !

Subject: Revised  Student Exco and Cohort Advisor  programmes
Body:
Dear Student Reps,

 

Thank you for your commitment and contributions serving as Student Exco members over the past Term 1 and 2. We hope you have an enjoyable and  enriching experience in taking up the student leadership position in SUTD . 

 

With the adoption of the new academic calendar in which Freshmore Term 1 and Term 3 are overlapped in the Fall Term, and the regrouping of the Freshmore Term 3 students into new different cohorts according to your choice of the elective subjects under the new Freshmore curriculum, it is necessary to make certain revisions on the Student Exco Programme and Freshmore Cohort Advisor Programme accordingly to better adapt to these changes without compromising to your learning experience and growth during your Freshmore journey.

 

Revisions of Student Exco and Cohort Advisor programmes for Term 3 effective from Sept 2021:

 

1.       Cohort Advisor will serve only the first two terms, i.e. Term 1 and Term 2, not in Term 3.

 

2.       Student Exco of each cohort group will only be formed in Term 1 and Term 2, not in Term 3.

In Term 3, Office of Undergraduate Studies (UGS) will work with you to identify 2 to 3 student reps from each new cohort group, either by nomination or self-nomination, to manage the cohort classroom facilities and resources, such as the library books, AV system, stationery and etc, and UGS will take care of the Freshmore Term 3 students’ welfare in the areas of cohort classroom logistics matters.

 

3.	Keep the Best Class Spirit Award of $300 to be awarded after Term 2.

 

4.       Retain the cohort funding of $250 in Term 3. Funding utilization is subject to the UGS approval.

 

5.	Discontinue the Cleanest Cohort Classroom Award in Term 3.

 

6.	Discontinue the Cohort Classroom Design Competition.

 

 

Thanks.

Best regards

Lim Bee Foong

Manager, Office of Undergraduate Studies

Subject: Intro workshop
Body:
Hi SUTDents! 

 

Are you interested in joining a maker club related to aerospace and aeromodelling?

Do you want to learn about Multi-Rotors and how they fly?

Ever did robotics in Secondary/JC/poly and wish robots could ascend into the third dimension instead of being confined to the ground?
If your answer to any of those questions is yes, then look no further! Multi Rotor SUTD is SUTD’s only aerospace related multi-disciplinary 5th row. 

By joining Multi Rotor SUTD, you can gain a wealth of knowledge and many maker skills that will help you throughout your journey as a SUTD student.

 

Multi-Rotor SUTD is holding its annual 5th row introductory session! Join us to learn about the club and what we do.

This intro session is also an introduction to drones. You will not only get to learn how they fly, but also how we design them. 

There will be several 1-2 hour online sessions in the afternoon between 2nd to 5th August. Timings are flexible so just join us even if you aren’t sure if you can make it.

If the situation permits, we will have physical sessions in September where you get to build and fly your very own drone so do sign up to receive updates!

 

Slots are limited so if you are interested, do sign up <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FzT2ZMDxMEg&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C478f073c24d5445cdf7408d94ffe3d1a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637628775729929886%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8NpTzLUqWZohmcIVFo17Ct579vbnxh5lidkAkhT34dw%3D&reserved=0>  now!

Registration will close on 1 Aug 2021 (Tues) 11:59 PM

 

We hope to see you there! :)

 

Most supercalifragalisticexplodealipodociously,

Multi-Rotor Society

Design Build Fly

Subject: Don’t miss out…. 2 more days to SUTD FIRST Industry Workshop 2021 - Wednesday, 28 July!
Body:
Hi SUTD Community,

Are you ready?

You are cordially invited to our upcoming Virtual FIRST (Fostering Industrial Research Success Together) Industry Workshop this Wednesday, 28 July 2021. Themed “University-Industry Collaboration: Entrepreneurship and Innovation”, FIRST 2021 (https://www.sutd.edu.sg/FIRST) will dive into new frontiers in academia and industry collaboration through keynote presentation, forum panel discussion, and industry showcase.
Be prepared to hear leading experts, Mr. Chaney Ho,  Co-Founder and Executive Director of Board, Advantech (Taiwan), 
Dr. David Ong, Senior Partner, Naef Group Spiele AG & Chairman, Singapore Mentorship Committee, and 
our very own Dr. Mohan Rajesh Elara, Assistant Professor, EPD Pillar, deliver impactful keynote addresses on:

*	Building Supply Chain Management Resilience in the De-Globalization Age
*	Reimagining Unicorns of the Future
*	The Rise of Self-reconfigurable Maintenance Robots

We also have industry/academia experts from the likes of Huawei International, Mistletoe, A*STAR, Uni Connect, 
and SUTD’s representative lead a virtual forum panel discussion that centres on University-industry collaboration.

Join us as we delve deep into discussions on advancing translational research based on 
sustainable frameworks. It’s all happening on Wednesday, 28 July 2021, at 9.00 am online. 
Doors open from 9.00 am onwards.

This event is free for all, so book your spot today! 

Click To Register! <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021> 

*If you have already registered, you will be receiving an email with the webinar link a few days before the event.*

We shall see you there!
	
 <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>   <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021> 	

 <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>  <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>

Subject: [Restricted] Updated Notice for students (23 July 2021)
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 

Dear Students,

Further to the notice sent on 21 July, with the rapidly evolving situation, our university will adopt the following teaching plan for the continued safety and well-being of students and staff. 

 

(A) Teaching Plan from Monday, 26 July 2021 (Week 11) to Friday, 13 August 2021 (Week 13) 

 

 

1.             (a) Term 8 and Term 9 (MArch) classes, including HASS electives and ILP classes (bridging lessons for early matriculated students) and PG classes will convert to online learning mode. 

(b) Separate arrangement will be made for Essential in-person sessions such as labs, ASD Studios and Capstone projects with the necessary SMMs in place. The detailed arrangement, will be made known to you by the respective faculty, pillars, clusters, departments or offices.  

(c)  The modes of the Final examinations will be determined by end of next week and will adjust further based on the situation at that time.

 

Best regards,

Office of Student Administration

 <file:///C:/Users/rueyshyong_lim/Documents/Documents/download> 

 

 

From: Student Admin 
Sent: Wednesday, July 21, 2021 8:44 PM
Subject: [Restricted] Notice for students (July 2021)
Importance: High

 

Message Classification: Restricted

 

 

Dear Students,

In line with the Phase 2 (Heightened Alert) national stance and the Ministry of Education (MOE)’s latest Safe Management Measures (SMMs), our university will adopt the following measures for the continued safety and well-being of students and staff. 

 

(A) Teaching Plan from Thursday, 22 July 2021 (Week 10) to Wednesday, 18 August 2021 (Week 14) 

 

1.	(a)  Term 8 and Term 9 (MArch) classes, including HASS electives and ILP classes (bridging lessons for early matriculated students) and PG classes will be conducted on campus.

(b)   These on campus classes include quizzes, projects, labs and learning activities.

(c)   Mid-term and final examinations will be conducted on campus.

(d)   A few subjects have specific requirements for physical / online learning mode. 

 

2.           Class size of all physical lessons is capped at 50 pax (including instructors).  Any classes with more than 50 pax (including instructors) will go online. The respective subject lead and pillar will inform the students for these classes of the arrangements.

3.           Group discussion/activity is capped at 2 pax per group, with SMMs in place.

a)    Faculty/Students should have their mask on at all times, and maintain a safe distancing of at least 1 metre between persons (or between groups of not more than 2 persons for group activities/team-based labs/projects/ASD studios). No intermingling between groups.

b)    Capstone Project teams and groups will adhere to the special arrangement:

                              i.        up to 5 students max per group

                             ii.        1 metre social distancing between sub-groups within a project team

                            iii.        2 metres social distancing between project teams at all time.

                            iv.        No intermingling between project teams and groups.

 

4.           Graduate students performing research are to work-from-home by default. However, for those who cannot effectively perform research work from home, (e.g. as you need to access specialized-systems / lab-equipment), need to seek clearance from your advisors/project-PIs/lab managers when you would like to return to campus. Further updates will be provided separately by the Office of Graduate Studies on the SMMs for working in labs.  

 

5.           Freshmore and Junior students are on Vacation / Internship / Summer Programme during the term. If there is a need to come to campus for any physical activities/events, the students shall get the approval from IMT through the programme and activity owner (e.g. Faculty, Pillar, OIR, CDC, UGS, OSL) at least two weeks before the physical activities/events.

 

Note for (1) to (5): 

 

*         As the situation is fluid and teaching plan can change in a short span of time, please refer to the instruction from the faculty, pillars, clusters, departments or offices for the latest and specific arrangement. 

*         If you have an online lesson in-between two on-campus in-person lessons, or back-to-back between an online lesson & on-campus in-person lesson on the same day, 

a)            you shall go to interim study room/library/open spaces/ASD respective studios/Term 8 respective capstone rooms and designated rooms for online lessons/self-study, subject to availability and safe distancing measures

b)            return to hostel room, if you are a hostel resident.

*         Please refer to the attached PDF for the operating hours at the respective academic spaces and facilities. The operating hours is subject to changes in response to the evolving situation. Students shall refer to the latest notice from the respective departments or offices (e.g. Library/Fab lab/Capstone Office)

 

(B) Safe management measures

 

The university will continue to adhere to safe management measures to keep our SUTD community safe.  As the situation continues to evolve, we will provide updates in response to new advisory from the related government agencies. Please continue to observe the measures on the days when you are on campus. You will need to do the following:

 

(I) Before you come to campus

 

Please check in using the TraceTogether token or app before you are allowed entry onto campus. You should have your TraceTogether token or app with you throughout.

 

Please do not come onto campus if you or

*         your household members are unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice/Health Risk Warning

*         your roommate is unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice/Health Risk Warning (applicable to students staying in hostel’s twin-sharing room)

 

New: Students and staff who have been put under the Ministry of Health's (MOH's) Health Risk Warning (HRW) will be placed on Approved Absence (AA)/ Leave of Absence (LOA), and will only be allowed to return to campus after their exit Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) swab test result is negative. Students and staff who have been put under Health Risk Alert (HRA) will be able to return to campus, but should limit their social interactions as an added precaution, monitor their health and see a doctor promptly if they feel unwell. Please refer to the attached “Response to health alerts from MOH (21 July 2021)” for more information on the scenarios where students must declare to the university.

 

When you are not able to attend classes due to the above or medical reasons, please do:

*         inform your faculty of your absence

*         submit your leave of absence via MyPorta <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/psp/EPPRD/?cmd=login&languageCd=ENG> l> NavBar> Navigator> Self Service> Leave/Withdrawal Request> Leave of Absence Application.

 

(II) When you are on campus

 

1)    Masks must be worn at all times except when you are eating or drinking.

2)    Please check-in at Campus Centre or Lobby F for temperature screening and completion of TraceTogether-only SafeEntry at least 20 minutes before the scheduled class time. For those who are driving or riding in, you will check-in at Entrance C (2nd vehicular entrance along Changi South Ave 1).



 

3)    The start and end time of each class must be strictly adhered to.  If you are unwell with dry cough, fever and tiredness, do not come to class but visit the Public Health Preparedness Clinic (PHPC).

4)    You are required to do your online temperature and daily health and contact declaration via the Temperature and Travel Declaration System at https://tts.sutd.edu.sg <https://tts.sutd.edu.sg> .

5)    You will only be allowed on campus on the days when you are scheduled for classes and/or capstone project discussion.  The security will have the class list for verification.

 

(III) Teaching venues

 

1)    You can only be on campus for the duration of the class instructions and project discussions. 

2)    Venues designated for teaching will have the requisite social distancing measures in place.

3)    The university would need to keep records of students’ seating arrangements (e.g. Faculty taking photos at the start/end of sessions) to allow affected students to be identified quickly in the event of a confirmed case and for subsequent contact tracing.

4)    Once the class instructions and project discussions are over for the day, please do not loiter around the classroom. For those who are hostel residents, please return to the hostel; for the rest, please leave campus as soon as possible.

5)    Please observe personal and environmental hygiene with regular hand washing.

 

(IV) Consumption of food

1)    Food must be consumed at the allocated seats in the designated refreshment area only (cordoned off area at the canteen). Individuals are not allowed to have any social interactions while eating, mask up immediately after eating, and leave the designated refreshment area after finishing your meals.

2)    Please clear your table after the meal.

 

As these measures are to ensure the safety and wellbeing of everyone, compliance is mandatory.  Disciplinary actions will be taken against the student(s) for any violation.

 

 

Best regards,

Office of Student Administration

 <file:///C:/Users/rueyshyong_lim/Documents/Documents/download> 

 

Message Classification: Restricted

Subject: Support our very own SUTD Olympian!
Body:
Dear SUTD Family,

 

The pinnacle of sports, the Olympic Games, starts today.  As you get ready to support your favourite athletes or events,  you may not know that we have an Olympian in our midst.

 

He is Jonathan Chan, Singapore’s golden boy in diving, the first diver from Singapore to qualify for the Olympics.  In addition to training for the Games, Jonathan is also a Senior from the Architecture & Sustainable Design pillar. 

 



 

Let’s support him in this highly stressful yet glorious time.  Jonathan departs Singapore on 28 July for Tokyo, representing Singapore and also SUTD.  He will be participating in the Men’s 10m Platform event.  Catch him in action on 6 and 7 August!

 

If you would like to follow Jonathan’s progress, follow the SUTD social media channels.  We will be posting Jonathan’s upcoming events and providing links to catch the competitions, share post-event news and results, as well as event rerun links if they are available. 

 

Do follow now. The first post is up! It featured Jonathan teaching Faheem from the Sunrise Show, the basics of diving, and links to Team SG’s schedule!  

 

Facebook <https://www.facebook.com/sutdsingapore/posts/10159253983120977> 

Twitter <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Fsutdsg%2Fstatus%2F1418005372216823809&data=04%7C01%7Czerlinatay%40sutd.edu.sg%7C4b338c605d2c4d330c0c08d94d05a08e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625508830818010%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=r7BmRQwGd1XZasSDpBa%2FJVySuHpuUvZcTWkFbKMhYN4%3D&reserved=0> 

Instagram <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fp%2FCRnJk50pJxV%2F&data=04%7C01%7Czerlinatay%40sutd.edu.sg%7C4b338c605d2c4d330c0c08d94d05a08e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625508830818010%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ZchALqaGJqpkOQy01wmI7TFzn2VwdjDZW3Ajbf9hN1k%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Dear Jonathan,

 

Our very warmest wishes for your upcoming competition!  Your dedication to your sport and studies is a fantastic feat.  May you have a fabulous time in Tokyo, and we are super proud of you! 

 

Do keep healthy, have a positive mindset and enjoy every minute of this life-changing experience.

 

All our best,

Your SUTD family

 

 

Photo credit: adrianseetho

 

 

 

Corinna Choong

Senior Director

Marketing and Communications

 

 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/> 

T: (65) 63036612

Subject: Talent @ SWITCH Entrepreneurship Exposure Series
Body:
Hi everyone 😄 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Femojipedia.org%2Fgrinning-face-with-smiling-eyes%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C6e6e7d42383a4687ca3308d94db862b0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626278729280909%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cydopun05XLCmZFU6gn18SUmuwDU5r%2BsXBfpxic46O0%3D&reserved=0> , 

 

Singapore Week of Innovation & Technology (SWITCH) in partnerships with National Youth Council (NYC) & SCAPE SG will be organising the Talent @ SWITCH Entrepreneurship Exposure Series (EES) where you can learn from top industry experts. Through a series of 5 bi-weekly sessions from August to October, you will come to understand more about the global startup ecosystem and the formula to launching a successful startup! Registration is now opened until 1 August 2021.

 

Along with the EES Series, sign up for the Talent @ SWITCH Mentorship Programme to get an industry professional as your mentor, and the Talent @ SWITCH Youth Challenge to solve challenges issued by organisations! Limited slots are available. 




👉 You can find more information on the programs in the attached files ‼️ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Femojipedia.org%2Fdouble-exclamation-mark%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C6e6e7d42383a4687ca3308d94db862b0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626278729290901%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=mFKbhOE06xHhmSp37s8BLDBYt7V0fYgG9bY8sLN96x8%3D&reserved=0> 


 

 



 

 

 

Kindest Regards,

Venture, Innovation & Entrepreneurship

 

 <https://entrepreneurship.sutd.edu.sg/>       <https://www.facebook.com/SUTDVIE/>          <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fsutd.vie%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C6e6e7d42383a4687ca3308d94db862b0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626278729290901%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Hf80VlHBScK0cnCUOdBSQ2GeK1TJ5MAAhV%2BqyFsX5a0%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Follow up actions - Advisory on Covid-19 case on SUTD Campus
Body:
Dear SUTD Community

 

As a further update to our earlier note, we have continued to intensify our sanitizing efforts to places beyond areas visited by the contractor who had tested positive for Covid 19.  The cleaning exercise will continue throughout the weekend and will include classrooms and office spaces.

 

The contractor mainly worked in the outdoor open spaces and the common areas. The areas visited are as follows:

 

-              Canteen

-              Building 1 open space on ground floor

-              Building 2 open spaces level 3 to 7

-              Lifts in Building 2 Lobbies E & F

-              Green space next to eco-pond

-              Tennis Court

-              Lift in Sports & Recreation Centre

 

Our cleaning crew has sanitized all of the above areas. Every passenger and service lift on campus has been sanitized, although the contractor only used the service lifts. Likewise, we are sanitizing all restrooms on campus.  The canteen will also be closed tomorrow, Saturday,  24 July 2021, to facilitate another round of deep cleaning.  Residents on campus can still order takeaways from the various F&B outlets or order delivery. We apologize for the inconvenience. Our priority is to keep the community safe.

 

All close contacts with the contractor have been placed under quarantine for the next 14 days and will undergo periodic mandatory testing. To date, no other cases have been identified.

 

Thank you, and stay safe.

 

Best Regards,

 

Tow Chong

 

From: President 
Sent: 23 July 2021 8:58 am
Subject: Advisory on Covid-19 case on SUTD Campus 

 

Dear SUTD Community

 

We regret to inform you that a supervisor of our landscaping contractor has tested positive for Covid-19 on 22 July 2021.  The affected supervisor has been in quarantine since 8pm on 21 July 2021 and was last on campus on 21 July 2021 from 8am to 6pm. All persons who had contact with him were asked to isolate themselves and stay away from the campus for 2 weeks from 23 July 2021.

 

Office of Campus Facilities has taken measures to sanitize and do deep cleaning of all passenger lifts and areas visited by the supervisor.  

 

We wish to assure you that the University will continue to monitor the situation and apprise the community of any further developments that may arise. Please continue to remain vigilant in observing safe management measures as well as to seek prompt medical attention if you feel unwell.

 

Thank you, and stay safe.

 

Best Regards,

 

Tow Chong

Subject: Weekly Discovery: 3D-Printed Pressure Sensor Embedded With A Temperature Sensor, Hydrogen Battery "Sponges" Store Solar for the Grid, Wearable Sensors With Wide-Ranging Strain Sensitivity & more 19 - 23 July 2021
Body:
Weekly Discovery
We SHARE to inspire and ignite ideas! 

 

19 - 23 July 2021

 

 

The Library publishes 9 alerts focusing on Topics relevant to growth and research areas to SUTD.

BATTERIES

Hydrogen Battery "Sponges" Store Solar for the Grid <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fspectrum.ieee.org%2Fenergywise%2Fenergy%2Fbatteries-storage%2Fhydrogen-batteries-solar-energy&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7C17cd7781876b4eb90c1b08d94a8bfb9c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622787351010324%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=6va6eyDqmQRMWIJ5CJpJxgoLX4rfsTkyvJXTj71Zz1E%3D&reserved=0> 









“In a new study, scientists from South Korea take things to the next level with a multi-directional pressure sensor fabricated using 3D-printed conductive polymer composites and paired with a temperature sensor for resistance calibration. The low cost of such 3D-printed sensors could enable large-scale production of robotic grippers and tactile sensors..”

“A team of researchers at USC is helping AI imagine the unseen, a technique that could also lead to fairer AI, new medicines and increased autonomous vehicle safety.”

“Today's chemical batteries can produce only low voltages, so you need to connect a lot of them in series to get a high voltage and also many in parallel so that they are both manufacturable and still able to deliver high power.”

“Dozens of solar farms in the country’s southeastern region are slated to use “hydrogen batteries” in coming years. The dual-purpose devices can fit inside of shipping containers and pack a bounty of technologies: lithium batteries, electrolyzers, fuel cells, and canisters of a hydrogen-metal compound.”

Source: DGIST <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdgist.ac.kr%2Fen%2Fhtml%2Fsub06%2F060202.html%3Fmode%3DV%26no%3Da16c2729c181630b7a90bd712488e1aa%26GotoPage%3D1&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7C17cd7781876b4eb90c1b08d94a8bfb9c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622787351020279%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8IFgxFjyN0LMqCr5TC9LJ8UDtfuCjKBw%2BegzoPUTJIc%3D&reserved=0>  (8 July 2021)

“Vermont scientists create tool to explore billions of social media messages, potentially predict political and financial turmoil.”

“Engineers at UC Riverside have unveiled an air-powered computer memory that can be used to control soft robots. The innovation overcomes one of the biggest obstacles to advancing soft robotics: the fundamental mismatch between pneumatics and electronics.”

“Scientists map the part of the brain that "links" similar objects, leading to new insights about how the brain processes information out of context…By using machine-learning and brain imaging, researchers measured the extent of the "co-occurrence" phenomenon and identified the brain region involved. The findings appear in Nature Communications.”

“A team of researchers from Stanford University and the University of Leuven in Belgium has further elucidated an intriguing process that could be an important step toward a methanol fuel economy with abundant methane as the feedstock, an advance that could fundamentally change how the world uses natural gas.”

Source: University of Vermont <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.uvm.edu%2Fnews%2Fstory%2Finvention-storywrangler&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7Ce51ec1a719a342091a4408d94a865206%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622763020623879%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ocuFedkge38Bd605CEbcGZ6A034pYMeFTKcCf89IBQ4%3D&reserved=0>  (16 July 2021)

Source: Stanford University <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fenergy.stanford.edu%2Fnews%2Finternational-team-scientists-turns-methane-methanol-room-temperature&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb39fd35a1f3246d339a308d94d862dc9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626061203342421%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=S%2FyQMGTeJZxC1lYuCn0UBo%2Flv0alqnvNcju%2Bp9EVrFk%3D&reserved=0>  (15 July 2021)

 

PHYSICS

Scientists Create Rechargeable Swimming Microrobots Using Oil And Water <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.qmul.ac.uk%2Fmedia%2Fnews%2F2021%2Fse%2Fscientists-create-rechargeable-swimming-microrobots-using-oil-and-water.html&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7C17cd7781876b4eb90c1b08d94a8bfb9c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622787351000367%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Q9ZBcI78GVMy5gs0lM5zcSD5JuNf5iVBo%2FiWAuH9wv8%3D&reserved=0> 

 

ROBOT

Contact-aware robot design <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.mit.edu%2F2021%2Fcontact-aware-robot-design-0719&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7Ce51ec1a719a342091a4408d94a865206%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622763020603967%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UdkW1xTmfl20UazoO7KvWPEjo95xHeBMMHSYwl%2FmG%2Bo%3D&reserved=0> 

 

ROBOTICS

University of Maryland Engineers 3D Printed A Soft Robotic Hand That Can Play Nintendo <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Feng.umd.edu%2Fnews%2Fstory%2Funiversity-of-maryland-engineers-have-3d-printed-a-soft-robotic-hand-that-can-play-nintendo&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb39fd35a1f3246d339a308d94d862dc9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626061203342421%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=p1L65py6xaej6LFjPitG2RP8%2FlCqmYGmGc9qx6tmHSU%3D&reserved=0> 

 

WEARABLES

Wearable Sensors With Wide-Ranging Strain Sensitivity <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fterasaki.org%2Finstitute%2Fnews%2Fpr%2Fwearable-sensors-with-wide-ranging-strain-sensitivity.html&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb39fd35a1f3246d339a308d94d862dc9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626061203352415%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=kUuJhisOxGh67Z2TJ7MuPeWVAmQcwKDLu%2F69OSaOlFo%3D&reserved=0> 









“By combining oil drops with water containing a detergent-like substance, the scientists found they could produce artificial swimmers that are able to swim independently and even harvest energy to recharge.”

“Their system uses software to manipulate the design, simulate the robot doing a task, and then provide an optimization score to assess the design and control.”

“The feat demonstrates a promising innovation in the field of soft robotics, which centers on creating new types of flexible, inflatable robots that are powered using water or air rather than electricity”

“Some of these sensors can detect high-level (40-100%) strains, such as those associated with the movements of fingers and limb joints, others detect mid-level (10-40%) strains, as found in swallowing and facial movements and still others are sensitive to low-level (<1%-10%) strains observed in wrist pulses and vocal cord vibrations.”

Source: Queen Mary <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.qmul.ac.uk%2Fmedia%2Fnews%2F2021%2Fse%2Fscientists-create-rechargeable-swimming-microrobots-using-oil-and-water.html&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7C17cd7781876b4eb90c1b08d94a8bfb9c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622787351020279%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gVoK%2FrtBQXUyW1brCsC%2FIk7zaGvgs0NfrUq%2FYZEpAc0%3D&reserved=0>  (15 July 2021)

Source: MIT <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.mit.edu%2F2021%2Fcontact-aware-robot-design-0719&data=04%7C01%7Cjessie_tang%40sutd.edu.sg%7Ce51ec1a719a342091a4408d94a865206%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637622763020623879%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vxCRcPRFPfv3Jg9EMSgGlKwM0%2F8zHlkm72E23Slgtk4%3D&reserved=0>  (19 July 2021)

Source:  UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Feng.umd.edu%2Fnews%2Fstory%2Funiversity-of-maryland-engineers-have-3d-printed-a-soft-robotic-hand-that-can-play-nintendo&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb39fd35a1f3246d339a308d94d862dc9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626061203362413%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ytbY9iTU56KbrIoPifnNqjsk2fh111YOY%2BLoAGVKYiQ%3D&reserved=0>  (16 July 2021)

Source: TERASAKI INSTITUTE FOR BIOMEDICAL INNOVATION <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fterasaki.org%2Finstitute%2Fnews%2Fpr%2Fwearable-sensors-with-wide-ranging-strain-sensitivity.html&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb39fd35a1f3246d339a308d94d862dc9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637626061203362413%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Ffm9wAXt11BI4u%2BtATgVtuXXXLtIMXkCiJjpjWijQdg%3D&reserved=0>  (15 July 2021)

This program will connect young women who are within 1 year of graduating from a Singapore university with a Facebook employee.  Read more <https://passthevision2021.splashthat.com/> 

 <https://passthevision2021.splashthat.com/>  
Apply by 23 July 2021

Senior Female students from
EPD, ESD & ISTD


	
Career Tips & Advice	

 

How to Answer the ‘Failure’ and ‘Success’ Interview Questions
When you tell compelling stories in interviews, you create connections with your interviewers in ways that just listing your accomplishments (no matter how extraordinary) can never do. Stories connect people to each other because our brains love to follow stories. Stories engage us nearly automatically, trigger our attention, and stay with us—they’re memorable. Read more <https://access.vault.com/recordurl?nid=262364&wid=274402&vid=1> 


Click HERE  <http://access.vault.com/career-insider-login.aspx?aid=274402>  for full access and more career resources on Vault.com.
The service is free of charge for SUTD students and Alumni.
How to Network Internally and Why It’s Important
When you think of networking, you might envision a room full of people who don’t know each other, making small talk, sipping cocktails, exchanging business cards, hoping to eventually making long-lasting connections. But networking can be much more than that. While networking can occur externally (connecting with people outside your company), it can also take place internally (with those inside your company). In both cases, your goal is to make strong connections with people who'd be happy to chat with you and help you. Read more <https://access.vault.com/recordurl?nid=262157&wid=274402&vid=1>

Subject: Advisory on Covid-19 case on SUTD Campus
Body:
Dear SUTD Community

 

We regret to inform you that a supervisor of our landscaping contractor has tested positive for Covid-19 on 22 July 2021.  The affected supervisor has been in quarantine since 8pm on 21 July 2021 and was last on campus on 21 July 2021 from 8am to 6pm. All persons who had contact with him were asked to isolate themselves and stay away from the campus for 2 weeks from 23 July 2021.

 

Office of Campus Facilities has taken measures to sanitize and do deep cleaning of all passenger lifts and areas visited by the supervisor.  

 

We wish to assure you that the University will continue to monitor the situation and apprise the community of any further developments that may arise. Please continue to remain vigilant in observing safe management measures as well as to seek prompt medical attention if you feel unwell.

 

Thank you, and stay safe.

 

Best Regards,

 

Tow Chong

Subject: [Join Us Now] The SUTD FIRST Industry Workshop 2021 is happening next week on 28 July!
Body:
Hi SUTD Community,

Are you ready?

You are cordially invited to our upcoming Virtual FIRST (Fostering Industrial Research Success Together) Industry Workshop on 28 July 2021. Themed “University-Industry Collaboration: Entrepreneurship and Innovation”, FIRST 2021 (https://www.sutd.edu.sg/FIRST) will dive into new frontiers in academia and industry collaboration through keynote presentation, forum panel discussion, and industry showcase.
Be prepared to hear leading experts, Mr. Chaney Ho,  Co-Founder and Executive Director of Board, Advantech (Taiwan), 
Dr. David Ong, Senior Partner, Naef Group Spiele AG & Chairman, Singapore Mentorship Committee, and 
our very own Dr. Mohan Rajesh Elara, Assistant Professor, EPD Pillar, deliver impactful keynote addresses on:

*	Building Supply Chain Management Resilience in the De-Globalization Age
*	Reimagining Unicorns of the Future
*	The Rise of Self-reconfigurable Maintenance Robots

We also have industry/academia experts from the likes of Huawei International, Mistletoe, A*STAR, Uni Connect, 
and SUTD’s representative lead a virtual forum panel discussion that centres on University-industry collaboration.

Join us as we delve deep into discussions on advancing translational research based on 
sustainable frameworks. It’s all happening on Wednesday, 28 July 2021, at 9.00 am online. 
Doors open from 9.00 am onwards.

This event is free for all, so book your spot today! 

Click To Register! <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021> 

*If you have already registered, you will be receiving an email with the webinar link a few days before the event.*

We shall see you there!
	
 <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>   <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021> 	

 <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>  <https://ez-rsvp.com/e/sutd-2021>

Subject: [Restricted] Notice for students (July 2021)
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 

Dear Students,

In line with the Phase 2 (Heightened Alert) national stance and the Ministry of Education (MOE)’s latest Safe Management Measures (SMMs), our university will adopt the following measures for the continued safety and well-being of students and staff. 

 

(A) Teaching Plan from Thursday, 22 July 2021 (Week 10) to Wednesday, 18 August 2021 (Week 14) 

 

1.           (a)  Term 8 and Term 9 (MArch) classes, including HASS electives and ILP classes (bridging lessons for early matriculated students) and PG classes will be conducted on campus.

(b)   These on campus classes include quizzes, projects, labs and learning activities.

(c)   Mid-term and final examinations will be conducted on campus.

(d)   A few subjects have specific requirements for physical / online learning mode. 

 

2.           Class size of all physical lessons is capped at 50 pax (including instructors).  Any classes with more than 50 pax (including instructors) will go online. The respective subject lead and pillar will inform the students for these classes of the arrangements.

3.           Group discussion/activity is capped at 2 pax per group, with SMMs in place.

a)    Faculty/Students should have their mask on at all times, and maintain a safe distancing of at least 1 metre between persons (or between groups of not more than 2 persons for group activities/team-based labs/projects/ASD studios). No intermingling between groups.

b)    Capstone Project teams and groups will adhere to the special arrangement:

                              i.        up to 5 students max per group

                             ii.        1 metre social distancing between sub-groups within a project team

                            iii.        2 metres social distancing between project teams at all time.

                            iv.        No intermingling between project teams and groups.

 

4.           Graduate students performing research are to work-from-home by default. However, for those who cannot effectively perform research work from home, (e.g. as you need to access specialized-systems / lab-equipment), need to seek clearance from your advisors/project-PIs/lab managers when you would like to return to campus. Further updates will be provided separately by the Office of Graduate Studies on the SMMs for working in labs.  

 

5.           Freshmore and Junior students are on Vacation / Internship / Summer Programme during the term. If there is a need to come to campus for any physical activities/events, the students shall get the approval from IMT through the programme and activity owner (e.g. Faculty, Pillar, OIR, CDC, UGS, OSL) at least two weeks before the physical activities/events.

 

Note for (1) to (5): 

 

*         As the situation is fluid and teaching plan can change in a short span of time, please refer to the instruction from the faculty, pillars, clusters, departments or offices for the latest and specific arrangement. 

*         If you have an online lesson in-between two on-campus in-person lessons, or back-to-back between an online lesson & on-campus in-person lesson on the same day, 

a)            you shall go to interim study room/library/open spaces/ASD respective studios/Term 8 respective capstone rooms and designated rooms for online lessons/self-study, subject to availability and safe distancing measures

b)            return to hostel room, if you are a hostel resident.

*         Please refer to the attached PDF for the operating hours at the respective academic spaces and facilities. The operating hours is subject to changes in response to the evolving situation. Students shall refer to the latest notice from the respective departments or offices (e.g. Library/Fab lab/Capstone Office)

 

(B) Safe management measures

 

The university will continue to adhere to safe management measures to keep our SUTD community safe.  As the situation continues to evolve, we will provide updates in response to new advisory from the related government agencies. Please continue to observe the measures on the days when you are on campus. You will need to do the following:

 

(I) Before you come to campus

 

Please check in using the TraceTogether token or app before you are allowed entry onto campus. You should have your TraceTogether token or app with you throughout.

 

Please do not come onto campus if you or

*         your household members are unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice/Health Risk Warning

*         your roommate is unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice/Health Risk Warning (applicable to students staying in hostel’s twin-sharing room)

 

New: Students and staff who have been put under the Ministry of Health's (MOH's) Health Risk Warning (HRW) will be placed on Approved Absence (AA)/ Leave of Absence (LOA), and will only be allowed to return to campus after their exit Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) swab test result is negative. Students and staff who have been put under Health Risk Alert (HRA) will be able to return to campus, but should limit their social interactions as an added precaution, monitor their health and see a doctor promptly if they feel unwell. Please refer to the attached “Response to health alerts from MOH (21 July 2021)” for more information on the scenarios where students must declare to the university.

 

When you are not able to attend classes due to the above or medical reasons, please do:

*         inform your faculty of your absence

*         submit your leave of absence via MyPorta <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/psp/EPPRD/?cmd=login&languageCd=ENG> l> NavBar> Navigator> Self Service> Leave/Withdrawal Request> Leave of Absence Application.

 

(II) When you are on campus

 

1)    Masks must be worn at all times except when you are eating or drinking.

2)    Please check-in at Campus Centre or Lobby F for temperature screening and completion of TraceTogether-only SafeEntry at least 20 minutes before the scheduled class time. For those who are driving or riding in, you will check-in at Entrance C (2nd vehicular entrance along Changi South Ave 1).



 

3)    The start and end time of each class must be strictly adhered to.  If you are unwell with dry cough, fever and tiredness, do not come to class but visit the Public Health Preparedness Clinic (PHPC).

4)    You are required to do your online temperature and daily health and contact declaration via the Temperature and Travel Declaration System at https://tts.sutd.edu.sg <https://tts.sutd.edu.sg> .

5)    You will only be allowed on campus on the days when you are scheduled for classes and/or capstone project discussion.  The security will have the class list for verification.

 

(III) Teaching venues

 

1)    You can only be on campus for the duration of the class instructions and project discussions. 

2)    Venues designated for teaching will have the requisite social distancing measures in place.

3)    The university would need to keep records of students’ seating arrangements (e.g. Faculty taking photos at the start/end of sessions) to allow affected students to be identified quickly in the event of a confirmed case and for subsequent contact tracing.

4)    Once the class instructions and project discussions are over for the day, please do not loiter around the classroom. For those who are hostel residents, please return to the hostel; for the rest, please leave campus as soon as possible.

5)    Please observe personal and environmental hygiene with regular hand washing.

 

(IV) Consumption of food

1)    Food must be consumed at the allocated seats in the designated refreshment area only (cordoned off area at the canteen). Individuals are not allowed to have any social interactions while eating, mask up immediately after eating, and leave the designated refreshment area after finishing your meals.

2)    Please clear your table after the meal.

 

As these measures are to ensure the safety and wellbeing of everyone, compliance is mandatory.  Disciplinary actions will be taken against the student(s) for any violation.

 

 

Best regards,

Office of Student Administration

Subject: [28/7 3pm] Wed Seminar: Design Optimization for Circularity
Body:
Greeting from DManD Centre! You are cordially invited to Wednesday Seminar Series on Sustainability and Circular Economy!

 

Title| Design Optimization for Circularity

Speaker| Peter Ortner, Assistant Professor, Architecture and Sustainable Design, SUTD.

 

Date| 28 Jul 2021 (Wednesday)

Time| 1500 – 1600 

 

Click HERE  <https://dmand.sutd.edu.sg/news-events/events/wed-seminar-series-sustainability-and-circular-economy/> to register. 



ABSTRACT

This lecture asks how designers can reduce the waste produced by their buildings and products by implementing computational optimization within a design for circularity framework. Circular Economy is an idea that proposes moving from a ‘take-make-use-dispose’ linear economy toward a zero-waste future, where waste outputs are safely recycled as inputs for new products. In recent years there has been a proliferation of frameworks for circular design, which assist designers to develop products for a circular economy. These frameworks, however, remain generic and provide limited guidance on how to implement computational design techniques like optimization. In parallel, a variety of circularity indicators for products have also been introduced to provide quantitative assessment of attributes that reflect or contribute to a circular economy. To date no single circularity indicator has become standard and many indicators present an incomplete or biased reflection of circularity. Building on an overview of existing circular design frameworks and circularity indicators, this lecture proposes a method for introducing evolutionary multi-objective optimization into design for circularity. Examples from case studies are shared to illustrate the framework’s ability to generate both better performing designs and to assist the designer in navigating contradictions between circularity objectives.

ABOUT THE SPEAKER

Peter Ortner is Assistant Professor and MArch and PhD Coordinator for Architecture and Sustainable Design at the Singapore University of Technology and Design. Peter’s research leverages computational techniques to create sustainable buildings and urban designs. His current research introduces optimization into the process of design for circularity and urban design, augmenting the ability of the architect to contribute to zero-waste, carbon neutral cities. Predicting urban metabolism data during design process is also an on-going research pursuit. In recent research Peter has applied computational design to challenges of urban resilience and automated mobility. His doctoral research at the EPFL built on insights from critical data studies and computational design to elucidate the changing role of architecture and architect in complex, data-driven urban systems.

2021 June & July Wednesday Seminar Series on Sustainability and Circular Economy

A Better World by Design is our motto in Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) that is reflected in our teaching and research. A Better World in the 21st century must include sustainable development and human activities. Sustainability is a complex system-level challenge that requires innovation and collaborations at all fronts. In this online seminar series, speakers from SUTD and international institutions will share recent progresses on sustainability research topics, with a focus on achieving a circular economy. Topics range from the role of design in achieving a circular economy, circularity in manufacturing, our built environment, life cycle analyses and urban metabolism.

Click HERE  <https://dmand.sutd.edu.sg/news-events/events/wed-seminar-series-sustainability-and-circular-economy/> to register. For more enquiries, please contact dmand@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:dmand@sutd.edu.sg>  

NOTE: By registering for this event, your consent shall be granted to DManD Centre for the collection of your personal data. We only ever use and disclose your personal data to communicate with you regarding the events for informational, and not promotional, reasons. In addition, the organizer may use all photographs and videos taken during the event, keeping and distributing such materials for our events, activities and publications.

See you online soon!

 

Thanks and regards,

Bernadette Teo
