Subject: Tele-ROOT
Body:
Hello SUTD Students!

 

Have you ever had any burning issues or feedback you would like to raise up? Or do you want to be kept updated of the current issues that have already been brought up? Well, regardless of which one you want, ROOT has a solution for you. ROOT has rolled out its every own ROOT Telebot so you can raise up issues as and when you want. You can also use it to check the repository of feedback that has already been mentioned. 

 

Attached in this email will be a brief manual on how to use the bot and the link to the Telebot itself! But do not worry too much, the bot is user-friendly and very intuitive, with instructions in every step! Now you may be wondering where does all this feedback go? Is this simply a venting platform for students? Well, they are valid questions but fret not! Each feedback sent through the bot will be routed to ROOT where we will collate, organize, and use this collected feedback for the Dialogues with Senior Management. We hope this initiative by ROOT will help increase the voices of students like you who would be able to make a better world in SUTD (by design)! 

 

You can access the bot via this telehandle @SUTD_ROOT_bot or via this link https://t.me/SUTD_ROOT_bot <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2FSUTD_ROOT_bot&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C8947a8fd4f634f7c052b08d97ebdb40b%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680176097066740%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=BWEHW1x3tuNPQdNLSA9yRupWS7wpWEjuuQS91JRdEnU%3D&reserved=0> . If there are any issues with the bot, feel free to message the administrators of the bot Oakar @oakkarr and Darren @deeenosaur on Telegram (: Thank you for reading this email and have a great weekend ahead!

 

On Behalf of 9th ROOT,

 

Darren Teng 

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

Director of Student Engagement 

9th Student Government 

Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

Subject: SUTD Floorball Introductory Session (Updated Dates)
Body:
Hello Everyone!!


SUTD Floorball will be having our introductory sessions on 29th September (Wednesday) and 1st October (Friday), due to the suspension of physical fifth rows activities this week. There will be 2 timeslots on each of the days, one from 7:15 - 8:45pm and another from 9:00 - 10:30pm. Those who have signed up previously do not have to sign up again as we have re-allocated you to the new dates above.

For those who are interested in trying out Floorball, you can join our telegram group (https://t.me/joinchat/NGDsZTH_zT5jOTBl <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fjoinchat%2FNGDsZTH_zT5jOTBl&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cc9a8ce9ac6614fa7961a08d97e909b7c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679982462491775%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Lnds9lPENrwiBZapCvfyyUVIFSmvDqNmuxo8LNZQKdE%3D&reserved=0> ) and indicate your attendance on this google sheet (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MjQyEI73vninWnvJr9AGjWMQwwADJ5Yzvf96iftcR_c/edit?usp=sharing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fspreadsheets%2Fd%2F1MjQyEI73vninWnvJr9AGjWMQwwADJ5Yzvf96iftcR_c%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cc9a8ce9ac6614fa7961a08d97e909b7c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679982462491775%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8EkP9lSe3cU%2Bo9J6mfdjtuKdw3W%2FDjCYBZjMUyjB%2BnQ%3D&reserved=0> ). We welcome you to sign up as individuals to meet new friends around the school or together with your friends as a group (maximum of 4). 


In the meantime, here is a video showing a glimpse of our weekly training to help you better understand SUTD Floorball as a fifth row.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-uMEnblu878

www.youtube.com

As usual, you can contact any of us if you have any questions. Thank you and we can't wait to meet you!

Subject: SUTD Touch Rugby Recruitment
Body:
Hi SUTD! 

 

Touch Rugby is looking for more members to join us this year!

 

What is Touch Rugby🏉?

Touch is a fast-paced game that involves strategic gameplay and pushes you to think on your feet! It is also different from contact rugby, so don't worry about getting tackled to the ground :) 

 

Why should I join?

*	If you're looking for a fun sport to pick up AND get fit at the same time, look no further 👀

*	We are always on the lookout for competition opportunities for both our guys and girls team!!

*	Make new friends! 

We’ll be organizing intro sessions to Touch Rugby in Week 3 (27 Sept, 1 Oct) from 7.20pm - 9pm. We will also have supper afterwards to get to know each other more and to answer all your burning questions, whether it is about training or school life!! If you are unable to come down on any of these dates, feel free to join in any of our training sessions on other weeks :)

 

No experience is required and all you need to bring along are your sports shoes/boots, water bottle and yourself (jio your friends along too!)

 

Sign up at this link: https://forms.gle/YvYmo1vd68ygA1bt8 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FYvYmo1vd68ygA1bt8&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfd597afbc0df485b8d6a08d97e8de7ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679970419844291%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=X9l0HUpMfTb47ZRB81iPCjXuA67%2BzcEkWFibuhPqCQw%3D&reserved=0> 




Join our telegram chat for more information: https://t.me/joinchat/IJxNk9bWeiszOTFl <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fjoinchat%2FIJxNk9bWeiszOTFl&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfd597afbc0df485b8d6a08d97e8de7ff%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679970419854283%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=W46njFZ5sFXq4RZajODQkWHIXDYmcpwZJ6Z%2FHKbkfsg%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: COME JOIN SUTD'S FIRST EVER POKEMON SHOWDOWN TOURNAMENT
Body:
CALLING ALL POKÉMON TRAINERS!!

 


We are excited to announce that we are organising SUTD’s first ever Pokémon Tournament!


 


No time to play? No worries! Participants are given a time frame to schedule their Pokémon Battle with their opponent at their own time for each round!


Additionally, a Pokémon for Dummies guide has been attached so everyone can come in and have fun together!


 


So what are you waiting for? Compete with your friends and stand a chance to win a 3D Printed Pokémon Pot by Little Printings!


 


Sign up here!: tinyurl.com/SUTDpokemonshowdown2021 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FSUTDpokemonshowdown2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2f44e28646f640b3bd1908d97e8bd33f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679961706064210%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1Us7oKNLECygRFymrS%2FHuMQDnN6XkC1oYpHh%2FWxGBqs%3D&reserved=0>  
or scan the QR code in our poster!


Join our Telegram Group to stay updated!: https://t.me/sutdpokemon <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fsutdpokemon&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2f44e28646f640b3bd1908d97e8bd33f%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679961706074207%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sRnEPVadb3RbsChUjA%2BCG34pJkCxoIF4FXCl7BiZQcs%3D&reserved=0> 
(or just to chill there and share anything Pokémon :O)


 


Sign Up Deadline: 26 Sep, Sunday 10pm
Start of Tournament: 27 Sep, Monday





Trainer! Your very own Pokémon legend is about to unfold. The Champion title awaits!




Go forth with glory :)  , 


Jie Wei & Valu

Subject: RE: Additional Leave of Absence (LOA) measures
Body:
Dear Students,

 

1.       If you are returning from overseas, please note that it is mandatory to stay away from campus for 14 days (from the date of arrival to Singapore) regardless of the country you are coming or returning from. For those entering from category III and IV countries, there is no longer a need to serve the additional 7 days LOA after completion of your 14 days SHN.

 

2.       For those returning from category I and II countries, you are required to email the following (eileenlim@sutd.edu.sg <mailto:eileenlim@sutd.edu.sg> ) before entering campus:

 

*         Flight arrival date and time

*         Polymerace Chain Reaction (PCR) test on the 7th day of arrival 

*         Antigen Rapid (ART) test on the 14th day of arrival

 

Please refer to ICA's website for the country categorisation <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsafetravel.ica.gov.sg%2Fstpl%2Fshn-and-swab-summary&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9f1864825a0f4d4d537b08d97e8862e5%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679947001491680%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UUqOsYHjzvcOz3Ic%2BZpVyzNVTCFhLkAv2fuGzSMFPdk%3D&reserved=0> .

 

To keep everyone safe on campus, the University takes a serious view of any non-compliance on this matter. 

 

Thank you.

 

Regards

Eileen LIM

Associate Head Registrar Services

Office of Student Administration

D: +65 6499 4642  F: +65 6779 5161 W: www.sutd.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9f1864825a0f4d4d537b08d97e8862e5%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679947001491680%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=OFOqb6bXcC%2FpQhajFjBfo7dDzxIq%2Ft6ftoZF2ZHNmS0%3D&reserved=0>  A: 8 Somapah Road, Building 3 Level 2, S(487372)

From: Student Admin 
Sent: Monday, 5 July 2021 2:39 pm
To: *All Students <*AllStudents@sutd.edu.sg>
Cc: Student Admin <studentadmin@sutd.edu.sg>
Subject: Additional Leave of Absence (LOA) measures

 

Dear Students,

 

1.    In view of the greater transmissibility of the current variant and to safeguard the University community, additional Leave of Absence (LOA) measures will be implemented.

 

2.    With immediate effect, students coming from higher risk countries/regions[1] will be required to serve additional 7-day LOA after completion of the Stay-Home Notice (SHN). Students will be required to stay away from campus activities and not engage in social activities until the end of the LOA. Students should not attend face-to-face lessons during the LOA and should engage in online learning whenever possible. Students will be able to resume normal activities on the morning of Day 22 of their arrival.

 

For students returning from non high risk countries/regions[1], it is mandatory to stay away from campus for 14 days (from the date of arrival to Singapore) regardless of the country coming or returning from. Students will be able to resume normal activities on the morning of Day 15 of their arrival.

 

3.    With effect from 7 July 2021, the following LOAs will be implemented:

 

Scenario

Description

Students or household members of students who have to undergo a mandatory COVID-19 testing due to a COVID-19 cluster

*       Individuals would have to declare to their institutions if they or their household member is required to undergo mandatory COVID-19 testing due to exposure to a COVID-19 cluster

*       LOA will be lifted upon a negative COVID-19 test result

*       This will not apply to individuals who are working in sectors, such as healthcare and aviation, where mandatory RRT is required 

Students staying in the same household as individuals (6 years old and above) with flu-like symptoms 

*       This is an expansion of the current LOA policy for students staying in the same household as adult individuals (18 years old and above) with flu-like symptoms, in view that the delta variant has greater impact on younger children. Moving forward, individuals would have to declare if their household members (6 years old and above) have flu-like symptoms

*       Individuals would need to furnish proof of the MC of the household member (if MC is available)

*       LOA will be lifted upon report of a negative PCR/ART test or at the end of the MC, whichever is earlier

*       If the household member is not on MC, the LOA will be capped at 5 days

Students with ARI symptoms and are on medical leave, but do not have a COVID-19 test result 

*       Individuals to be placed on LOA for 5 days after expiry of medical leave, if they do not have a COVID-19 test result

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

[1] As of 30 June 2021, high risk countries/regions refers to all countries/regions, except for Australia, Brunei Darussalam, Hong Kong, Macao, Mainland China and New Zealand.

 

Thank you.

 

Regards

Eileen LIM

Associate Head Registrar Services

Office of Student Administration

D: +65 6499 4642  F: +65 6779 5161 W: www.sutd.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9f1864825a0f4d4d537b08d97e8862e5%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679947001501676%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wXdWLUCViq0FEnSnOQYCfvlg1xrhNZ20o5mfceIJeMA%3D&reserved=0>  A: 8 Somapah Road, Building 3 Level 2, S(487372)

Subject: SUTD's Social Media Report (6 - 19 Sep)
Body:
Dear SUTD community

 

This is the latest edition of the SUTD Social Media Report, covering the social media posts created on our various accounts for the period 6 to 19 September.

 

If you have any interesting activities that will showcase SUTD’s mission, brand, talents and achievements, do reach out to Terence Chia at terence_chia@sutd.edu.sg 

 

Please share any posts that interest you on your accounts and help us create a greater awareness of our stories.

 

Best regards

Zerlina

Office of Marketing & Communications

________________________________

From: Ng Woon Yang <woonyang_ng@sutd.edu.sg>
Sent: Thursday, September 23, 2021 5:00:53 PM
Cc: Chen Yuxin <yuxin_chen@sutd.edu.sg>; Rury Narita Binte Omar <rury_narita@sutd.edu.sg>
Subject: [Restricted] Resumption of Fifth Row Activities 
 

Message Classification: [Restricted]

 

Dear Sports Club Leaders

 

Fifth Row activities will be resuming on Sat 25 Sep 2021 and we wish to remind everyone of a few important points:

 

1.       Declaration of Participants (applicable for activities held on SUTD campus)

 

Declaration of all participants who wish to take part in your activities must be done before all sessions. This will enable us to check if they are eligible to return to campus during this period.

 

If you have more than one group of 5 persons training at the same time, we also need you to declare the groupings. Use tab 2 of the same template.

 

For clubs/IGs with indoor unmasked activities, please read through the “Declaration Instructions for Indoor Unmasked Activities.pdf” enclosed before filling in the template. You are required to submit all necessary documents with the declaration list.

 

Enclosed is the template (OSL_ClubName_Declaration_2021T3_Date) for submission to us. For clubs/IGs that do not have indoor unmasked activities, you may ignore the Vaccination Status column (column D) in the template.

 

The declarations are due 3 working days before each of your training sessions/activities.

 

2.       Submission of Attendance (applicable for all face-to-face activities regardless of venue)

 

Enclosed is the template for submission of actual attendance (OSL_ClubName_Attendance_2021T3_Date). The attendance is due the next day after each of your training sessions/activities.

 

3.       Safety

 

All are reminded to comply with prevailing COVID-19 controls and Safe Management Measures. On top of these, extra care should be exercised in planning your training load/activities. Bear in mind that participants may not be physically conditioned for heavy loads/intense training due to lay-offs caused by recent suspensions. Also ensure that you have a properly equipped first aid kit on-site.

 

Do feel free to discuss with us if you face any difficulties or require additional support for your club/IG.

 

Thank you.

 

Ng Woon Yang

Office of Student Life

 

 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/> 

T: (65) 6499 8759

	
8 Somapah Road

#01-301

Singapore 487372

Subject: RE: Credit Suisse Global Coding Challenge 2021 -  Sign up today
Body:
Virtual Events





 

Invitation

Credit Suisse Global Coding Challenge 2021

 

 

For details about questions, languages, prizes, and more, follow the link

 

Register now <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.credit-suisse.com%2Fpwp%2Fhr%2Fen%2Fcodingchallenge%2F%23%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2e09c61b895f405ef33408d97e6b481d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637679821930587770%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=B30kVfqM3nBR2kGFtd6Oer3IBoyrCVt24qr9lvcNIY4%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 

Credit Suisse is back with the annual Credit Suisse Global Coding Challenge and registrations are now open to all university students across the globe! The competition will run from September 27 to October 10, 2021. Students across the globe will attempt to code their most efficient algorithms to nine coding problems ranging from EASY to ADVANCED. Solutions are scored by our automated evaluator and students are placed on regional and global leaderboards.

 

The student at the top of our global leaderboard will be crowned our Global Coding Champion and walk away with a MacBook Pro. Exciting prizes also up for grabs in the other categories include the iPhone, iPad Pro and much more. Top 100 participants on the leaderboard will be rewarded with attractive goodies and incentives. In the past editions, following the competition, those who had done well had joined our prestigious Summer Internship or Technology Analyst positions.

 

Sign up today and refer your friends as well. 

 

We look forward to your university’s active participation against the best universities around the globe!

 

For any further queries reach out to us on : support.codingchallenge2021@credit-suisse.com <mailto:support.codingchallenge2021@credit-suisse.com> 

	
 

	
Disclaimer

Credit Suisse is committed to providing a professional and inclusive work environment where all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer.

 

Regards,

Davina Tham
Employer Relations
Career Development Centre

“Researchers from Osaka University used laser ultrasonics to image ultrasmall internal defects in 3D-printed materials, thus introducing a means of non-contact quality control”

“Imagine having your own digital personal chef; ready to cook up whatever you want; able to tailor the shape, texture, and flavor just for you; and it’s all at the push of a button. Columbia engineers have been working on doing just that, using lasers for cooking and 3D printing technology for assembling foods.”

“Aerospace engineers at the University of Cincinnati have come up with a new nozzle design for F-18 fighter planes to dampen the deafening roar of the engines without hindering performance.”

“Chemical engineers at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign now understand how water molecules assemble and change shape in some settings, revealing a new strategy to speed up chemical reactions critical to industry and environmental sustainability. The new approach is poised to play a role in helping chemical manufacturers move away from harmful solvent catalysts in favor of water.”

Source:  OSAKA UNIVERSITY <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fresou.osaka-u.ac.jp%2Fen%2Fresearch%2F2021%2F20210916_3&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfbab3eb957cf4f6265ba08d97f078cc0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680493210974580%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=zl2CNajOy%2BTUKJb7rluOlM9WHb1wN%2F9bHS6kkbUNuxE%3D&reserved=0>

Ten Apartments With Adaptable And Reconfigurable Layouts <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dezeen.com%2F2021%2F09%2F18%2Ften-apartments-adaptable-reconfigurable-layouts-lookbook%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfbab3eb957cf4f6265ba08d97f078cc0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680493211014559%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2%2FWQ6olSAjnJF1IehvJhpW%2Fir0XdBNs4BPSY88twCT8%3D&reserved=0> 









“The existential threat of COVID-19 has highlighted an acute need to develop working therapeutics against emerging health threats. One of the luxuries deep learning has afforded us is the ability to modify the landscape as it unfolds -- so long as we can keep up with the viral threat, and access the right data.”

“Curtin University research has identified a new, cheaper and more efficient electrocatalyst to make green hydrogen from water that could one day open new avenues for large-scale clean energy production.”

“New research from the College of Engineering aims to ease the process of chemical recycling – an emerging industry that could turn waste products back into natural resources by physically breaking plastic down into the smaller molecules it was originally produced from.”

“For our latest lookbook, we've selected 10 adaptable flats from the Dezeen archive that can be reconfigured with moving walls or furniture…Adaptable apartments use sliding partitions and smart storage solutions to divide spaces, or incorporate reconfigurable rooms so that they can serve multiple purposes.”

Source: MIT CSAIL <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.csail.mit.edu%2Fnews%2Fdeep-learning-helps-predict-new-drug-combinations-fight-covid-19&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfbab3eb957cf4f6265ba08d97f078cc0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680493211014559%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4epL4YMCHDhhDbtVzioS3GFxqPTEXlbVrBTIYPl4j7k%3D&reserved=0>  (16 September 2021)

SENSORS

Unlimited Digital Sensing Unleashed For Imaging, Audio, And Driverless Cars <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.imperial.ac.uk%2Fnews%2F230093%2Funlimited-digital-sensing-unleashed-imaging-audio%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfbab3eb957cf4f6265ba08d97f078cc0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680493211044540%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=uId%2B0msPEm0Tj0FbZZe6kWw1EOYti9hFm4LGrEPgVqg%3D&reserved=0>

TURBULENT FLOW

Fiber Tracking Method Delivers Important New Insights Into Turbulence <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.oist.jp%2Fnews-center%2Fpress-releases%2Ffiber-tracking-method-delivers-important-new-insights-turbulence&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfbab3eb957cf4f6265ba08d97f078cc0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680493211054542%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=k5bP31xEsnYphb2xyXkzTq28rAh5%2B%2FXsWm7osBuHXEk%3D&reserved=0> 









“Physics researchers at the University of Bath discover a new physical effect relating to the interactions between light and twisted materials – an effect that is likely to have implications for emerging new nanotechnologies in communications, nanorobotics and ultra-thin optical components.”

“A new technique could unleash the potential for digital sensors like cameras to sense all light intensities, and microphones to sense all audio ranges”

“New research from the College of Engineering aims to ease the process of chemical recycling – an emerging industry that could turn waste products back into natural resources by physically breaking plastic down into the smaller molecules it was originally produced from.”

“…a new technique for measuring turbulent flows has been developed by an international collaboration of scientists from the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology Graduate University (OIST) in Japan, along with the University of Genova, Italy, KTH Stockholm, Sweden and ETH Zurich, Switzerland. By using fibers rather than particles – the usual method of measurement – the researchers could get a more detailed picture of turbulent flows.”

Source: University of Bath <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bath.ac.uk%2Fannouncements%2Fthe-nanophotonics-orchestra-presents-twisting-to-the-light-of-nanoparticles%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cfbab3eb957cf4f6265ba08d97f078cc0%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680493211054542%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2%2Fog8wNpbPy1zw%2BJXYjY24JATNmLUG08NeuP9PD8BKU%3D&reserved=0>  (20 September 2021)

(17 September 2021)

Subject: [REMINDER]: LKY CIC Brown Bag Lunchtime Talk: Trusting Cultural Similarities when Sharing Knowledge - Monday, 27 September 2021
Body:
Dear all

 

On behalf of the Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities (LKYCIC), we are pleased to invite you to a Brown Bag Lunchtime Talk on “Trusting Cultural Similarities when Sharing Knowledge” by Dinithi N. Jayasekara, Research Fellow, Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities.

 

Date:              Monday, 27 September 2021

Time:             12.00 pm to 1.00 pm

Venue:           Via Zoom
                         Meeting ID: 957 6830 7507 

                         Passcode: BBL2709! 

 

If you are keen to attend, please click here <https://lkycic.sutd.edu.sg/news-and-events/events/brown-bag-lunch-talk/lky-cic-brown-bag-lunchtime-talk-trusting-cultural-similarities-when-sharing-knowledge/>  to register. Thank you.

 

 <https://lkycic.sutd.edu.sg/news-and-events/events/brown-bag-lunch-talk/lky-cic-brown-bag-lunchtime-talk-trusting-cultural-similarities-when-sharing-knowledge/> 

 

Best regards

 

Yusra Nadzirah

Senior Officer

 

 <https://lkycic.sutd.edu.sg/> 

T: (65) 63036600

Subject: ASD Pillar Talk !!!
Body:
HEY FRESHIES!

Hope the first two weeks of school have been going well. As part of SUTD’s curriculum, freshmores will have to decide on their pillar year in term 3. What better time to know more about the ASD Pillar than now!!!



Do you have any burning questions about SUTD's Architecture and Sustainable Design pillar✨? Is it really true that ASD students are always sleep deprived? 😴

If you have ever thought of those questions, why not come to our ASD Pillar Talk 🎙!





First, our Pillar Head, Prof. Tai will be giving an introduction to the possibilities and opportunities ASD opens up for students!

Next, Prof. Carlos will also be sharing about his SUTDIO experience and more, so come on down to find out more!

Finally, our Term 6 and Term 9 students, Valent and Yin Jie, will be sharing about their ASD experience and their journey.

 

Date & Time: 28 September 2021, 2-3pm

Venue: Zoom (Link will be sent to your emails next week 😊)
Register through this link <https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJwkc-mtqDwpE9VROlthSTi6Rx_Y2v0QsZvG>  today ‼️
Feel free to ask any questions through this slido link <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.sli.do%2Fevent%2Fcz2yclkm&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3732aefe065444a8ac1d08d97f129fdf%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637680540674240106%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=MQ6bSCamqdM%2FD46efF8CnIBGEaAvxQu9y8AtPitEm9U%3D&reserved=0>  too

Hope to see you soon!



Best Regards,

 

Megan Lee Xian Ying 

 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/> 

ASD Junior Representative

5th Student Association Council

Unwavering . Accountable . Collaborative

Subject: Invitation to Inter-varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Youth Conversation, 26 Oct, 4:30-7pm
Body:
Dear SUTD students,

 

The National Youth Council is organising an Inter-varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Youth Conversation and is inviting SUTD to participate.

 

The Singapore Green Plan 2030 (Green Plan) is a national sustainability movement that seeks to rally bold and collective action to tackle climate change. It comprises 5 key pillars (City in Nature, Energy Reset, Sustainable Living, Green Economy, Resilient Future), and sets out concrete sectoral plans and targets for the next 10 years. The Green Plan is a living plan, which will evolve and be refined over time. One of its key priorities is to mobilise and empower the Public, Private and People sectors and Singaporeans to co-create solutions for sustainability. As part of this national engagement process, the National Youth Council is planning organising a series of Singapore Green Plan Conversation to hear students’ views on the Green Plan, and how we can build a city of green possibilities together, while taking into account Singapore's context. We have previously conducted two of such sessions, and summaries of these can be found here: https://youthopia.sg/converse/sggreenplan/ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyouthopia.sg%2Fconverse%2Fsggreenplan%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C8ecb95fbc2e14b2edc9108d9824a8a07%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637684079204999657%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cPUr7AytsSpEg4mxvuKtjCkg%2F40pmgV8GU2OvN20jrQ%3D&reserved=0>  

 

Inter-Varsity Singapore Green Plan 2030 Youth Conversation

Date: Tuesday, 26 October 2021

Time: 4.30pm – 7.00pm 

Mode: Virtual (via Zoom)

 

Tentative Programme

Time

Activity 

4.30pm

Introduction by emcee

4.35pm

Presentation by Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment (MSE) on Singapore Green Plan 2030

4.45pm

Breakout Sessions (10 breakout rooms, 12 students each)

Facilitated by Students from Environmental Groups of IHLs and/or NYC Staff

Breakout topics: City in Nature, Energy Reset, Sustainable Living, Green Economy, Resilient Future

5.40pm

Break

5.45pm

Large Group Sharing 

5x5 min sharing

6.05pm

Panel Dialogue using Pigeonhole

6.50pm

Call to Action and Closing by Minister of State Alvin Tan, MCCY & MTI

6.55pm

Close of event

 

This will be a good opportunity to meet students from other IHLs and participate in a meaningful conversation about our common future.

 

Registration is limited to the first 20 students. Both undergrad and graduate students are welcome. Please register your interest in this form before 6 October, Wed: https://forms.office.com/r/c8bs7u9jCM <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2Fc8bs7u9jCM&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C8ecb95fbc2e14b2edc9108d9824a8a07%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637684079205009653%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=RAVR2zTilzX9Q8mCuYFFpu9K1RNRr9aASK9IasifPN0%3D&reserved=0>  

 

We look forward to hearing your voices!

 

Best,

Lynette.

 

Lynette Cheah, Ph.D.

Associate Professor, Engineering Systems and Design

Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)

Associate Editor, Journal of Industrial Ecology

https://mobility.sutd.edu.sg <https://mobility.sutd.edu.sg>

Subject: LKY CIC Brown Bag Lunchtime Talk: Housing Shortage and Population Growth on a Regulated Rental Market - Friday, 22 October 2021, 12PM
Body:
Dear all

 

On behalf of the Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities (LKYCIC), we are pleased to invite you to a Brown Bag Lunchtime Talk on “Housing Shortage and Population Growth on a Regulated Rental Market” by Fredrik Hansson, Research Fellow, Lee Kuan Yew Centre for Innovative Cities.

 

Date:              Friday, 22 October 2021

Time:             12.00 pm to 1.00 pm

Venue:           Via Zoom
                         Meeting ID: 997 8274 6292

                         Passcode: BBL2210! 

                   https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/j/99782746292

 

If you are keen to attend, please click here <https://lkycic.sutd.edu.sg/news-and-events/events/brown-bag-lunch-talk/lky-cic-brown-bag-lunchtime-talk-housing-shortage-and-population-growth-on-a-regulated-rental-market/>  to register. Thank you.

Subject: RE: Virtual Book Launch - Divine Custody: A History of Singapore’s Oldest Teochew Temple
Body:
Dear SUTD Community

 

We are pleased to share that Associate Professor Yeo Kang Shua’s latest book, Divine Custody: A History of Singapore’s Oldest Teochew Temple is officially launched and can be purchased via https://nuspress.nus.edu.sg/products/divine-custody-a-history-of-singapores-oldest-teochew-temple?_pos=1&_sid=e03024d5d&_ss=rlast <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnuspress.nus.edu.sg%2Fproducts%2Fdivine-custody-a-history-of-singapores-oldest-teochew-temple%3F_pos%3D1%26_sid%3De03024d5d%26_ss%3Drlast&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C09c7434a3bbb49bf859e08d98235fe2a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683991008606147%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wPm6gnPE3Odj5D%2BDatXsnXXzsHgcd8d7uycLTvyD0S8%3D&reserved=0>  

 

Get your copy now with the discount code "divcust20" which is valid till 2 Oct 2021.

 

Thank you

 

Sincerely

From: ASD

Subject: Virtual Book Launch - Divine Custody: A History of Singapore’s Oldest Teochew Temple

 

Dear SUTD Community,

Subject: HASS Research Talk Series titled “Archiving ourselves: How do SUTD students write history papers?"
Body:
Dear SUTD

 

HASS cordially invites you to our HASS Research Talk Series titled “Archiving ourselves: How do SUTD students write history papers?" co-presented by Dr Sandeep Ray and two ISTD seniors, Han Xing Yi and Velusamy Sathiakumar Ragul Balaji.

 

HASS Research Talk Series

Date: 6 October 2021, Wednesday  

Time: 3.00pm – 4.00pm

 

Zoom details 

Join Zoom Meeting https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/j/95585291658

Meeting ID: 955 8529 1658

Passcode: HASSWED$3

Subject: recROOTment
Body:
Hello SUTDents!

 

It has come to our attention that the previous email(s) can be a bit confusing. As ROOT believes in transparency and accountability, we apologise for our mistake. To clear some doubts:

 

1) The link to apply to join ROOT is https://forms.office.com/r/y3mTWBmRsw <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2Fy3mTWBmRsw&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460465299%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cV2WJQyF%2Bn4LdlxtTyGEVMPthIeSnMgHS3KmIomhKHM%3D&reserved=0> 

 

2) We will be holding a Tea Sharing Session to share more about what we do, for you to ask us your burning questions and most importantly just hang out with us! The dates will be on 29 Sep: 430pm - 730pm and 1 Oct: 2pm - 5pm on Teams. https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3azMy1lCoiIJesy8QCXEOt52mhyur5etD8WSCrNeolhrg1%40thread.tacv2/1632748370444?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%223476b776-e990-4f72-b950-62489831623d%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22b0f5254e-5a19-4c7e-a9af-6a9d5e802e44%22%7d <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/ap/t-59584e83/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteams.microsoft.com%2Fl%2Fmeetup-join%2F19%253azMy1lCoiIJesy8QCXEOt52mhyur5etD8WSCrNeolhrg1%2540thread.tacv2%2F1632748370444%3Fcontext%3D%257b%2522Tid%2522%253a%25223476b776-e990-4f72-b950-62489831623d%2522%252c%2522Oid%2522%253a%2522b0f5254e-5a19-4c7e-a9af-6a9d5e802e44%2522%257d&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460475294%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Yrwl%2B%2Bv%2ByUhCQimLVKwXlwTh8jrcKXY1ryDXFeuPc88%3D&reserved=0> 

 

We hope to see you there! And join us in creating your ROOT journey!

 

On behalf of 9th ROOT,

 

Darren Teng 

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

Director of Student Engagement 

9th Student Government 

Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

 

 

 

 

From: Student Government - Student Relations 
Sent: Monday, 27 September 2021 3:33 am
Cc: Student Government - President <president@studentgov.sutd.edu.sg>; Student Government - Events <events@studentgov.sutd.edu.sg>
Subject: recROOTment

 

	

Hello SUTDents!

 

Its recruitment season for ROOT and we are looking for the next batch of students who are interested in joining the ROOT family! RecROOTment will take place in 2 phases: A Sharing Session (Roots of ROOT) in Week 3 and an informal interview in Week 4. Do not worry too much about the interview as it is merely just a platform for us to know you better! 

 

For those who are on the fence on whether to join or if you are just simply curious what ROOT does, do join the Sharing Session (Roots of ROOT) on either 29 Sep (4:30pm – 7:30pm) or 1 Oct (2pm – 5pm) of the days and we will answer as many of your questions as possible. We strongly recommend attending the sharing session so you will have a clearer picture of the job scope that ROOT entails. We have prepared refreshments but due to the shift to online lessons, we will be reserving the refreshments for the Week 4 as we foresee most of you guys will be home this week! 

 

For those who want to join ROOT, do fill up the sign-up form by 3 Oct! You can sign up by scanning the QR code in the poster below. We still strongly encourage attending the Sharing Session so you have a better inkling of what each department does, who knows, you may end up changing your mind on which department you want to join! 

 

The Teams link for the Sharing Session will be sent soon so do look out for it!! For any queries on recROOTment, feel free to contact me @deeenosaur! 

 

 <https://mcusercontent.com/cdf4c8daed833f2680a6536ac/images/b046302f-e493-7629-ff24-6e8e9e3e31d9.png> 


Hey SUTDents!


Join our ROOT Family! (Details for sign-up is below!)

ROOT aims to create an active and lively school culture and environment by supporting Fifth Rows development as well as by organizing Orientation and other student welfare related events.

We perform different functions in your upcoming student life, from Feedback & Communications, Fifth Row Management,  Marketing to Event Planning. With a passion to serve, there is always a role for you! (You can define your own!) Find out more about us here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fstories%2Fhighlights%2F18254462620011351%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460485286%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=BXBVZ4ovKJ26upqwmC0b4SGKmsnnV4QWT8H%2FX0XXwmY%3D&reserved=0> !
 

Attend our tea session to find out more!
Stand a chance to win Gongcha vouchers. Refreshments provided*

 

 

*Refreshments will be reserved for interview sessions in Week 4 due to shift to online learning in Week 3

 

	

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPRot717yK7JEh4AUz3yfxftUQkQ0TFlKQ0tKRTU0NkNQNFc5RjZNV1BGTyQlQCN0PWcu&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460485286%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=X%2F%2BChV7y11oYT4V9B7vuaE%2BatPMOkSvWXLeHMlsFk3Q%3D&reserved=0> 

Join us on Teams as we
Spill the Tea about the other side of
Student Government.
29 Sep: 4:30pm – 7:30pm // 1 Oct: 2pm - 5pm

 

	

 


Hear from our members
themselves!!
 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fstories%2Fhighlights%2F18254462620011351%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460495283%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ZJOUH7o9SQfUHFkGmSFm3PmTPQUXJd0vzZa1Dn1msAU%3D&reserved=0> 

	

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fstories%2Fhighlights%2F18254462620011351%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460505275%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qV4pFvCrWvw1PRqv9upbKvzGSD4OA1CPftRV7l7DFaE%3D&reserved=0> 

 



 

See you there! 
RecROOTment Team 
9th ROOT

 

 

 

 

	

 

Here’s 3 reasons why you should not join us:

 <https://mcusercontent.com/cdf4c8daed833f2680a6536ac/images/151789e5-1485-4b20-9bd4-0e2951ec5134.png> 

Immediate Recognition & Appreciation

Don’t expect to see the fruits of your labor immediately but there are always seniors and peers that will recognize and appreciate your efforts.

 <https://mcusercontent.com/cdf4c8daed833f2680a6536ac/images/6f42ac07-c7ca-468a-9b2a-4e1fb6d2f001.png> 

Too Flexible Hours

Some weeks, we chill and eat and some weeks we work hard. If you require a fixed schedule, you might wanna reconsider.

 

Discover More <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/>  

 <https://mcusercontent.com/cdf4c8daed833f2680a6536ac/images/c5f015ed-1213-4c61-bc9a-82868428c9ca.png> 

Listening


ROOT members are always ready to listen.. If you are one who prefers to do the talking, but refuses to listen, you might wanna rethink.

Reach out to us! 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Finstagram.com%2Fsutdlife%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460685173%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2FdWGFl3uN4NhbfuQwYyeAZloVI6Braty8C5A8cX0uU0%3D&reserved=0> 

 <mailto:communications@studentgov.sutd.edu.sg> 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Froot.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cef2517ab84264b47477108d981c7be46%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683517460695165%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=xA%2BFRVj6uCXPB05mZcgacvGCFx19OwNHIdENwLbgXbE%3D&reserved=0>

Darren Teng

Subject: Pre-GRASS Survey
Body:
Hi SUTDents!

 

Our 2021 Fall GRASS Feedback session is back! 

 

What is GRASS? 

Every Spring and Fall term, GRASS is organised by ROOT as a lead-up to the Dialogue with Senior Management (DSM). 

 

Pre-GRASS Feedback Form allows ROOT to have a better understanding of SUTDents' concerns and sentiments and facilitate a more effective discussion during the upcoming GRASS session.




Feel free to raise any issues that you would like to have covered during DSM, do fill in this GRASS Feedback form <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FARLf8pzmhd&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce2cc94a076d24e14790008d981c37548%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683499153818600%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=yFAG1L6BwngfBXI7IuuQ7Gj3r3XjBilPapi%2BkEClAVA%3D&reserved=0> .

 

The Fall Term 2021 Virtual GRASS session will be held on Week 4: 

*	Date: 8th October
*	Venue: On Zoom! (link to be sent out closer to the date)
*	Timing: 1500 - 1700
*	The sign-up form will be sent out later in the week!

 

Feel free to join us during this session to discuss and allow us to get a better understanding of the issues you are facing! In the meantime, the GRASS Feedback form <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FARLf8pzmhd&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce2cc94a076d24e14790008d981c37548%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683499153828599%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=iGO5cvWkr7KTNNRXg4xMY%2BdDVFax%2FVuK2FuTgNindt0%3D&reserved=0>  is open right now!

 

 

Best Regards, 

Theresa Lam

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

Director of Student Engagement

9th Student Government 

Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

Subject: Re: Makerspace Club SUTD Introductory Session 2021
Body:

🛠️🛠️✨Hello Freshies and SUTDents!✨🛠️🛠




Unfortunately, due to the current COVID situation, we have decided to cancel the first session. Instead, we will be live streaming our intro session (workshop not included) during our second session that will be held physically in campus.




While sign-ups for the second session are now closed, you can still sign up for the virtual introduction session here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2Fq2c05FxHpN&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cda5923b115eb4f8e3a3808d981c0d017%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683488008120605%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=0CwUS0Y6nfWGH7gPIAKXLV74oIenXaKbrWbwDr%2B%2FJcY%3D&reserved=0> !

However, fret not as we will be reaching out and giving the materials to those that have signed up for the first session so that you can build it during your own time.




You may check whether you have successfully reserved a slot for the upcoming physical stationery case workshop on 29/9 here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fspreadsheets%2Fd%2F1xAJR-19i9Ys_MnLaDyVqJX2W7W9RkGWplxoI76dF3bc%2Fedit%3Fusp%3Dsharing&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cda5923b115eb4f8e3a3808d981c0d017%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683488008130613%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9CD4rqdYxL9vxZGP0FOWYUS0%2B2WmoCm1WC9Y09xB6Iw%3D&reserved=0> ! From: Student Club - Makerspace
Sent: Monday, 13 September 2021 12:46 pm
Subject: Makerspace Club SUTD Introductory Session 2021 
 

🛠️🛠️✨Hello Freshies and SUTDents!✨🛠️🛠️





Looking for a place to participate in cool projects both software and hardware? Interested in being part of a maker community?




Then SUTD's Makerspace Club is here for you! Bring your tinkering dreams come to life as here in Makerspace we make anything and everything. No matter how big or small, be it hardware, software or crafts, Makerspace provides it.




We will be holding our Introductory Session this coming DiscoverSUTD 2021 and would like to invite anyone interested in maker culture to come and sign up! Create your very own personalised stationery holder and learn more about Makerspace and the future projects we have in store for you!




More importantly, we are also looking forward to brainstorming about ideas that YOU have for projects that we can work on future!
















Details 

Week 2, 24th Sept (4:25pm - 5:30pm) 
Week 3, 29th Sept (3:25pm - 4:30pm) 
Venue: Think Tank 26

Subject: Design Odyssey (DO) DiscoverSUTD Workshop
Body:
Hi SUTDents!!!

 

Ever had an idea for a solution to benefit the society, but you don't know where to begin? How about having a dream to help those who really need help in our midst, but you do not know how to help them? 

 

Well, Design Odyssey’s (DO) DRIVE program is that one thing you can look forward to if you do not know where to start! Haven't heard about us before? You might be wondering, hmmm why such a complex naming?  It's simple! DO is the place where you are guided to uncover the root causes of the problems where you want to be the spark for change. A unique program by DO , DRIVE is where you can learn to Discover, Define, Develop and Deliver innovative solutions that help improve our society and the environment! 

 

Now that classes are online, you may feel that you are missing out on the fun, but fret not!!! Come join us for our virtual workshop during the Discover SUTD season to get a taste of what you can look forward to doing in DRIVE! SUTDents of all levels and years are welcome! You will also get a chance to meet like-minded individuals with whom you can share ideas and collaborate, while also getting a head start and insight into design thinking! We will also be answering all your questions about us :) So what are you waiting for? Join us now and stand the chance to receive UglyFood ice cream vouchers 🥳!!!!

 

Workshop: Introduction and Ideation

 

Date: 1 Oct 2021 (Friday)

Time: 3pm- 5:30pm

Venue: Zoom

 

Sign up now for the workshop here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fpages%2Fresponsepage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPTtI_CxEKk5Atq9WZiRjmXdUNzdTTkxPWVVIOFlDWTVKVkg4R1VTUFVEOS4u&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C62bec16a20ac4f848a1408d981ac0282%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683398735722655%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=E3iOF1nHrA44usdScqrTgC1t7kpmUgfl1iQwxj91Q%2Bw%3D&reserved=0>  😊! Hope to see y’all there!!!

 

Curious to know more about DO and DRIVE? Check out our video here: https://youtu.be/jrvaNGuXen4 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FjrvaNGuXen4&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C62bec16a20ac4f848a1408d981ac0282%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683398735732644%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YlrY7PubZ0bM%2BaimfUhWNqDtmpXE2wtCud8II6jmknE%3D&reserved=0>  😊 😎 😊 !!! 

 

Do also join our TELEGRAM GROUP here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fjoinchat%2F7JBQMnY_frNkMTE1&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C62bec16a20ac4f848a1408d981ac0282%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683398735732644%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1DwpTkB6RGH0PDlX5rrz%2FNK2whyIxardH6KIyyrV8C4%3D&reserved=0>  and follow us on INSTAGRAM @designodysseysg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fdesignodysseysg%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C62bec16a20ac4f848a1408d981ac0282%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683398735742641%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=igw8rnOYMXkdvPGiar3RLWW87UjuOdC7CTfD6EzhbWA%3D&reserved=0>  to be updated on upcoming events!!! 

 



 

All our best,

Design Odyssey Team

Subject: Application for Choice of Degree Major
Body:
Dear Freshmore Students,

 

You have reached another milestone in SUTD – Choice of Degree Major!

From 27 Sept to 8 Oct 2021, you are required to make your preferred choice of degree major via MyPortal >  > Navigator > Self Service > Preferred Choice of Major. Your major choice will be recorded on the last day of the application window period. No changes will be allowed after this date. 

 

Note that you will be allowed to proceed to the major of study only if you have passed all 5 Required Freshmore subjects and passed at least 5 out of 7 of the Non-Prerequisite Freshmore subjects which is the minimum requirement to proceed to the major years pursuant to the Policy on Academic Warning, Academic Probation and Required Withdrawal for the Freshmore Terms. 

 

You will be notified via email of your confirmed major choice by 13 Oct 2021.

 

Thank you.

 

Regards

Eileen LIM

Associate Head Registrar Services

Office of Student Administration

Subject: Update on Covid 19 situation
Body:
Dear SUTD Family,

 

We are pleased to update you that the Covid 19 situation has been closed in the hostel. 

 

As of 27 September 2021, no one in the hostel is self-isolating, serving Quarantine Order, or being served with Health Risk Warning or Health Risk Alert. The two individuals infected are also well. 

 

Given the serious status of Covid 19 infections in Singapore, please be extra careful to keep healthy and maintain safe management measures strictly. We will need to continue working together to care, support and help each other as we return gradually to live a more normal life.

 

We appreciate everyone’s co-operation.

 

 

 

All my best,

Tow Chong

 

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

 

From: Chong Tow Chong <towchong@sutd.edu.sg> 
Sent: 16 September 2021 11:41 pm
Cc: Chong Tow Chong <towchong@sutd.edu.sg>
Subject: COVID-19 in SUTD

 

Dear SUTD Community, 

 

A Term 6 student has tested positive for COVID-19. The student was last on campus on 15th September.

 

Students and staff who were in close contact with the student have been informed to self-isolate and do ART tests, pending further instructions. All locations visited by the student are in the process of undergoing deep cleaning. We want to assure you that the University will continue to strictly implement safe management measures to ensure our community's wellbeing.

 

As a precautionary measure, we will be converting affected classes to online learning until the end of Friday, 24th September.  In addition,  physical fifth-row activities are suspended with immediate effect, and the SUTD gym plus all sporting facilities will also be closed until the end of 24th September.

 

We seek your support in ensuring that you continue to practise good personal hygiene and social responsibility. If you are unwell, please consult a doctor immediately.

 

I appreciate your cooperation in keeping the University a safe environment for all.

 

Please take care and stay safe.

 

All the best,

Tow Chong

Subject: RE: Invitation to ISTD Pillar Info Sharing Session (1 October 2021) *Changed from hybrid to virtual*
Body:
Dear Students,

 

Thank you for your responses. As of today, 16 of you have registered for the physical session and 119 of you have registered for the virtual session. Earlier, the ISTD faculty was thinking of meeting some of you in person so as to interact with you more on the CSD programme. However, due to the recent tightening of covid measures, we have to change the hybrid info session to a full virtual info session. 

 

On Friday, 1 October (1.30pm – 2.30pm) , we required all of you to log in to the following zoom link provided. Please be punctual so that we can start and end the session early. We noted that some of you may want to join other pillars for their info sessions set at a later timing on the same day. Thank you.

 

Join Zoom Meeting

https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/j/94538195012 <https://sutd-edu.zoom.us/j/94538195012>  

 

Meeting ID: 945 3819 5012

Passcode: 4Va4z**5

 

Regards

ISTD Team

From: ISTD 
Sent: Friday, 17 September 2021 11:45 AM
Subject: RE: Invitation to ISTD Pillar Info Sharing Session (1 October 2021)

 

Dear Students,

 

Thank you for replying, 111 of you had registered for the info session on 1 October. For those of you who have not signed up for the event, you can still register and attend the session virtually. Click here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.gle%2FLSp9WKgG3rkAy2wa9&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C0ed77ab10a884889e7f908d9819be695%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683328922875673%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=S91g7x%2BzhEEXjcP8kJmgTCmrLXdOJ%2BUoR%2FZHq%2BflzjM%3D&reserved=0>  to register. 

 

Apart from Prof Tony Quek, Prof Cheung Ngai-Man (Course Instructor of 50.001 Information Systems & Programming, 50.035 Computer Vision and 01.116 AI for Healthcare) and Prof Lim Kwan Hui (Course Instructor of 50.021 Artificial Intelligence) will be there to take your questions.

 

Here are some of the things you can look forward to at the info session.

 

1. What are some of the common questions asked and what are the answers for these questions? (https://istd.sutd.edu.sg/why-istd/ <https://istd.sutd.edu.sg/why-istd/> ) 

2. What are the new track and courses to be launched in the CSD (Computer Science and Design) programme?

3. For a CSD graduate, what is the degree name to be shown on the degree scroll?

4. Do you know a CSD student can sign up and graduate with the AI minor? What is the easy process in place to help you do so?

5. Do you know CSD students take up 40% of the entire cohort (current Juniors)? 

6. Do you want to know which tracks are more popular in the CSD programme?

7. What are some of the jobs taken up by CSD graduates?

8. How much does a CSD graduate earns?

    Graduate Employment Survey - Employment Rates and Salaries of SUTD/CSD Graduates (https://www.moe.gov.sg/-/media/files/post-secondary/ges-2020/web-publication-sutd- <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.moe.gov.sg%2F-%2Fmedia%2Ffiles%2Fpost-secondary%2Fges-2020%2Fweb-publication-sutd-&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C0ed77ab10a884889e7f908d9819be695%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683328922875673%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=IplqWJ0Y9kOP7E%2F5ymUQdDc9XfuMegHfbVvQmZBgkg0%3D&reserved=0> 

    ges-2020.pdf). 

 

Regards

ISTD Team

Subject: #ProjectYOU 2021 - Gender-Specific Workshops for you!
Body:
Hello there! 

  

 

  

🌟Be the protagonist in YOUR own life journey 🌟

  

We have teamed up with Women@ Google and Parcsen Loke from the Centre for Fathering to bring to you 

Gender Specific Workshops that will help to celebrate and empower your achievements and to develop healthy mindful habits. 

  

Do take note that Women@ Google will be specifically catered for females while Vision: Don't follow your passion is for males only. 

  

9 October 2021 (Saturday) 

10.30am – 12pm

Subject: RE: You're invited! Why the world needs more diverse Cyber talent - virtual panel discussion
Body:
­ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww2.deloitte.com%2Fus%2Fen.html&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3f0b20471598454b82f708d981924307%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683287567172684%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vsiSMN1G0YLTz1Osd1ScgqRKiJJI1pHQ6lCgsbwwNOs%3D&reserved=0> 



 

Asia Pacific  |  Cyber  |  September 2021




Why the world needs more diverse Cyber talent


Virtual panel discussion

 

 

 

In today’s “cyber everywhere” world, the cyber security industry and demand for cyber talent is growing rapidly. The cyber talent gap is real and a challenge for organisations globally. It’s not just lacking in diversity - there are simply not enough qualified individuals to fill millions of open positions globally. 

 

How can we overcome the challenges of the cyber talent shortage today and in the future? How can we increase diversity in the cyber workforce? How can we dispel the myths that cyber is just about “hackers in hoodies”? What are the potential growth opportunities in cyber and how can organisations attract talent?

 

 


Date and time


 

Tuesday, 12 October 11:00 – 13:00 IST

13:30 - 15:30 HKT/SGT

16:30 - 18:30 AEST

 

Why the world needs more diverse Cyber talent: Virtual panel discussion

 

Register today to secure your spot
Click here <https://deloitte.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_ElJg_dYoTZSGdInAa86hDA>  to register 

 

 

 

Join us during Cyber Security Awareness Month for our virtual panel discussion with Cyber leaders and NextGen Cyber talent in Asia Pacific on “Why the world needs more diverse Cyber talent” <https://deloitte.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_ElJg_dYoTZSGdInAa86hDA> , hosted by Deloitte Women in Cyber.

 

Welcome and opening remarks by Cindy Hook, CEO, Deloitte Asia Pacific

 

Panel session 1

The panel of Cyber leaders across Asia Pacific will discuss their career experiences, how diversity can help address the cyber workforce challenges ahead, and how Cyber is an area full of endless possibilities. We will hear from several Cyber leaders, including

 

*

Mrudul Uchil, India Site Head, Cybersecurity at VISA

*

Jenny Tan, Vice-President of ISACA Singapore Chapter

*

Edna Yap, Asia Pacific leader, Cyber Strategy, Deloitte Southeast Asia

*

Eva Kwok, Asia Pacific leader, Cyber in Financial Services, Deloitte China (Moderator)

 

Cyber Tips Talk – how do I get into Cyber?

The first panel will be followed by a Cyber Tips Talk, presented by Niranjini Arunachalam, Associate Director in Deloitte India’s cyber team. Niranjini will cover how you can prepare and equip yourself in terms of training and certifications to get into the Cyber field.

 

Panel session 2

We have also invited a group of Next-Gen Cyber Talent from Deloitte to share their career aspirations, how they entered the Cyber field, and to discuss how Cyber is so much more than just hackers in hoodies.

 

*

Oscar Ferne, Cyber Strategy, Deloitte Australia

*

Hatty Siu, Data & Privacy, Deloitte China

*

Guneet Kaur, Data & Privacy, Deloitte India

*

Melvyn Teo, Cyber Strategy, Deloitte Southeast Asia

*

Adrienne Maxted, Women in Cyber leader, Deloitte Australia (Moderator)

 

Click here <https://deloitte.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_ElJg_dYoTZSGdInAa86hDA>  to register.

 

 <https://www.facebook.com/deloitte> 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2FDeloitte&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3f0b20471598454b82f708d981924307%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683287567182678%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=EhRY9VQnzoETPGX0i%2Fyu7%2F3KglnPTCaPnfAAug2CQ5Q%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: RE: [POLL] ISTD x GOVTECH workshops + tech sharing IAP 2022
Body:
Dear Student Community,

 

Thank you for your responses so far, we hope to see more coming in so do help us by filling up the survey in the link below.

 

Poll Questions (Link)

Dear Student Community,

 

Good Day to you!

 

ISTD pillar together with GOVTECH are keen to organise half a day workshops (2 separate days) + tech sharing during (Independent Activity Period) IAP 2022 for our student community. To better facilitate the workshops and ensure we have a fruitful outcome, we would like to find out more about your interest domain and other areas which you are keen on via the simple poll below.  

 

Kindly help us to fill up the poll when you are available, hope to see your responses soon!

Subject: RE: Bloomberg Information Session - 19 Oct, 3.00pm Webinar
Body:
Dear Students,

I am happy to share with you that financial, software, data, and media company, Bloomberg will be partnering with CDC to speak to you about their internship and graduate programmes. I would like to encourage you to attend the session and engage with the team.

Date: 19 October 2021, Tuesday
Time: 3.00 – 4.00pm
Venue: Online Webinar 

Click HERE <https://sutd-csm.symplicity.com/students/?s=event&ss=is&mode=form&id=22c7ff9829ce2878a35d22fe943eab24>  to register for the event or Login to GEMS -> Career Event by 13 October 2021 (2359hrs).
Pre-registration is required. Webinar link will be sent out nearer the date.

The company is opened to hiring students from any pillars as long as you are able to show strong problem solving & collaboration skills and most importantly, willingness to learn.

Sign up with a friend!

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fcompany%2Fwhat-we-do%2F&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C3ec19077bd9e4be238ba08d9818f2194%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683274093724787%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=DfRUXg3DPXn44207abzNsEPywJrNkVhr0LBiNHPjl%2Fw%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: RE: Presenting: Limitless At L'Oréal 2021 (4-17 October)
Body:
Calling all Young Talents,

 

Looking to kick start your professional journey where you’re supported in building an impactful career that’s uniquely yours? 🤔 

 

Join us at our first immersive virtual fair from 4 to 17 October and discover career possibilities that are truly Limitless. 🚀 🚀 🚀 

Register now <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcareer.loreal.com%2FEventsRegistrationNew%2FJobDetail%3FjobId%3D111846%26utm_source%3Dlinkedin%26utm_content%3Dglobal_singapore%26utm_campaign%3Dl%2527oreal_on_campus_2020%26utm_medium%3Dsocial_post_orga&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cbcffc01b0daf4d9ec37108d9818bd95c%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683260345778390%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Siz3Bqbf%2BM2QCd2KW3CD9G1gb4o1XuJdUrtq7lLaQqs%3D&reserved=0>  to get the link & we will see you online!

Subject: [Restricted] Suspension of Fifth Row Activities WEF 27 Sep 2021
Body:
Message Classification: [Restricted]

 

Dear students

 

Fifth Row activities will be suspended with immediate effect until further notice. You are encouraged to move activities online. 

 

Please contact your respective staff advisors if you require any assistance.

 

Regards,

Office of Student Life

 

From: Student Life 
Sent: Friday, 17 September 2021 2:18 pm
Subject: RE: [Restricted] Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 13 Sep 2021

 

Dear students

 

All face-to-face Fifth Row activities have been suspended until the end of Friday 24 Sep 2021.

 

Following new advice from the Expert Committee on COVID-19 Vaccination, please take note that all students should abstain from strenuous activities for 14 days after the first or second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Those leading or facilitating the activity must screen participants before the start of each session. They must also remind those who have had a vaccination dose more than 14 days ago to inform them immediately if the participants develop chest pain, shortness of breath on exertion or abnormal heart beats at any point during strenuous physical activities – stop immediately and seek medical attention.

 

Thank you.

 

Regards,

Office of Student Life

 

From: Student Life 
Sent: Friday, 10 September 2021 3:34 pm
Subject: [Restricted] Updated Fifth Row Advisory WEF 13 Sep 2021

 

Message Classification: [Restricted]

 

Dear students,

 

Please refer to the attached guidelines for latest details.

 





 

Regards,

Office of Student Life

Subject: DDZ IS BACK - Dance DerivativeZ Freshie Trials
Body:
~~~~~~~~ WE ARE BACK!!! ~~~~~~~~





hello everyone!! we hope that y'all are staying safe, taking care, being happy and covid free!! with that, we are back to host the freshie trials that you have been waiting for. thank you so much for the overwhelming response previously and we are so sorry that it couldn't happen. but we have slots for the new trials that have already opened and just like last time, signups are closing out so once again, here're the new details you need to know:








new trial dates:
~ 1 oct (friday)
~ 6 oct (wednesday)
~ 8 oct (friday)




and every date has the same two session timings:
~ session 1: 6pm - 8pm
~ session 2: 830pm - 1030pm

venue:
~ dance studio 1/2

attire:
~ yourself in some covered shoes (and long pants would be nice)

things to bring:
~ yourself, a water bottle, a towel, and an extra mask







sign up link (is a must):

https://forms.office.com/r/Lv4cVedHQE <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FLv4cVedHQE&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2150450793354e1445d508d98177f977%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683175186395686%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=opjgJ%2B0fY%2FOmaq5fZGu26vW1nhromxUVTT44uFr6AlA%3D&reserved=0> 

if you signed up for the earlier trials on 17, 22, and 24 sept that were postponed, please sign up again as this is a new form for the new dates!




telegram group link (is a must too): 
https://t.me/ddzfreshietrials <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fddzfreshietrials&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2150450793354e1445d508d98177f977%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683175186395686%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=TP757nEk0DNzOn%2FaYlGGq9%2BNuqt%2BJIIyTuvK%2Bkl%2FSbI%3D&reserved=0> 



we also held an info session! if you would like to know more about ddz, you can watch the recording here:
https://youtu.be/eaxaAY5s1vw <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FeaxaAY5s1vw&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2150450793354e1445d508d98177f977%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683175186405682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=EWDPlW4eW9CWloD34EjonqWbXXmxd5i8cHRpIniUmbM%3D&reserved=0> 




if you've got any questions, hit us up:
~ matt @manutphua <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fmanutphua&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2150450793354e1445d508d98177f977%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683175186405682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2FNa%2FKAUvIqwAfX7jJhKJ%2B8sm9ugljPeXT7K2mpPLqd0%3D&reserved=0>  (on tele)

with love,
the ddz family

Subject: [PADI] Exclusive PADI Merchandise #2 History of Batik Sidomukti!
Body:
Dear SUTD,

Let’s start the new week by enjoying the history behind the Batik Motifs from the exclusive PADI merchandise designs!

Today, we will be sharing about the second motif, Sidomukti:



We hope that this has taught you more about batik 😊

Just a reminder that the order form is still open, and we have limited stocks!
Collect the all 4 designs and wear it to university with your friends!

We are selling it at: 
1 for SGD$6

4 for SGD$20 (Save $4!)

Purchase yours now through the link below: 
https://tinyurl.com/PADIBatikMask2021 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FPADIBatikMask2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cdec5cfcdaf03469543dd08d9816d2506%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683128587258415%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wKfkE%2Bv3u6DLUlW9bXLR0VErzs%2FHojafTUWq7LTAvTA%3D&reserved=0> 

Option for self-collection in the order form will be closed on 29th of September,
& we will open a booth for collection at SUTD on 30th September 2021 and 1st October 2021.
Alternatively, you may also opt for mailing!



Have a great week ahead,



PADI Exco 2021 💛


If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us on our Instagram <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fpadigraphy&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cdec5cfcdaf03469543dd08d9816d2506%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683128587268391%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=M1w5ZE63QmSZqFT%2FL%2FhcAWWBYR7AS2uN0Wem2T1C8o0%3D&reserved=0>  or Email us at indonesiancultural@club.sutd.edu.sg <mailto:indonesiancultural@club.sutd.edu.sg> !

From: Student Club - Indonesian Cultural <mailto:indonesiancultural@club.sutd.edu.sg> 
Sent: Wednesday, September 22, 2021 7:55 PM
Subject: [PADI] Batik Day - Exclusive PADI Merchandise!

 

Dear SUTD,

Hope all of you are starting this new term with a blast!

 

In Indonesia, we celebrate 2nd October, the date Batik was designated as Humanitarian Heritage, as Batik Day. 
As the date is coming, SUTD Indonesian Cultural Club (PADI) would like to introduce an exclusive merchandise <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FPADIBatikMask2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cdec5cfcdaf03469543dd08d9816d2506%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683128587288380%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=G2FA4MWDhBGSD0SNYV5Roi8kgSI%2FvWAOr1b2pLj6vuQ%3D&reserved=0> :

 



 

SUTD Indonesian Cultural Club (PADI) is launching out our Batik Mask editions, with 4 variations of Batik motifs!

Each batik represents a region in Indonesia as well as their culture and history.
You can choose whichever motifs you find fascinating! 
(We will share the history of each batik In the upcoming emails, stay tuned!)



We are selling it at: 
1 for SGD$6

4 for SGD$20 (Save $4!)

Purchase yours now through the link below: 
https://tinyurl.com/PADIBatikMask2021 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2FPADIBatikMask2021&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cdec5cfcdaf03469543dd08d9816d2506%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683128587288380%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=G2FA4MWDhBGSD0SNYV5Roi8kgSI%2FvWAOr1b2pLj6vuQ%3D&reserved=0> 

Option for self-collection in the order form will be closed on 29th of September,
& we will open a booth for collection at SUTD on 30th September 2021 and 1st October 2021.
Alternatively, you may also opt for mailing!

Collect the different designs and wear it to university with your friends!

PADI Exco 2021 💛

Subject: SUSTAINABLE ENERGY SERIES
Body:
Hi Freshies and SUTDents!

 

Are you passionate about GREEN ENERGY 🍀? 

Or maybe you need some resources (🔋🔌💡?)

Or advice in your own personal tinkering projects?

Or want to learn to incorporate Clean Energy ☀️⚡️🍀 into your Prototypes?

Or if you have BIG AMBITIONS AND PROJECTS that you would like to propose to us?

 

We welcome EVERYONE, with or without experience to join Energy Club 

 Where you can get the guidance and resources for your projects, no matter the size!

SIGNUP FOR OUR SUSTAINABLE ENERGY SERIES 

 

 CLICK HERE TO REGISTER <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fpages%2Fresponsepage.aspx%3Fid%3Ddrd2NJDpck-5UGJImDFiPWCmXKyZ921NoXVi0sVwpsFUNjlYUVpDUjRUNDNaUTJTQzNBQVYzQlRBTS4u&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C11cda43a08114bb2afcd08d98152997d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683014740193611%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=X6pzzs2v2X2kaW9hcIsYZ2FblnhJdQ9beoZhGEcZNmE%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Limited slots Registration based on first come first served basis!

VENUE FOR THE WORKSHOP WHETHER ONLINE OR PHYSICAL WILL BE DECLARED CLOSER TO THE DATE

 

 



 

 

 

chat here: https://t.me/joinchat/ytMob_zAe20wNzVl <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fjoinchat%2FytMob_zAe20wNzVl&data=04%7C01%7Caxel_liew%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C11cda43a08114bb2afcd08d98152997d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637683014740203597%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Y%2Fj%2F0Ms%2FbNL0bgtr8OEbczb5xaNLXz3EoUEKPOzEguY%3D&reserved=0>

Stay LIT!! 💡

Umang Gupta
